story:
The Archer Adventure!

Help Us Help Kids Make God Their Target!

We have designed a series of Bible based journals for children ages 4-10.  Our mission is to help kids discover that following God's purpose is their target, and His Word is their guide. 

  • Hi!  My name is Karen, and am the proud mama of 3 kids, 10, 8 & 20 months, and I've been blessed to call Isaac my man for the last 15 years.  I am the founder of a women's entrepreneur ministry called Pursuit Community, and the owner of an online journal shop called Intentional Home that helps women spend more time in God's Word, and bring organization, and intention to their days.  And now, I guess I can add children's journal maker to my list of things to juggle :) 
  • Last year, shortly after we got our first shipment of women's journals, my children started asking me why it was only for grown up girls, and when they could have a journal made for them.   This sparked some interesting conversations which led to them sketching out what their journal pages would look like.  Eventually this game landed on the screen of my computer, with two excited kids by my side as we started making their sketches come to life.
  • The events of that afternoon led to a conversation with my friend Jordanne to see if she could add some fun to these pages with her gorgeous illustrations.  After tons of brainstorming, research, dreaming, and designing with our family and friends, the very first Archer's Adventure Journal was born.   At first we only did a summer journal, but after we got it printed, we fell even more in love with it.   We got to see first hand how it helped children build habits of spending time with God daily.  The journals made it fun to get in God's Word, and taught them how the Bible actually applied to their lives.   

The Mountaintop Adventure

Here is the FUN part!  These Journals have truly created a Mountaintop experience for our family.  We have worked so hard over the past year designing, brainstorming, developing and now producing these journals.   The joy we've been able to see on children's faces as they used the summer journals, and the encouraging testimonies we've heard from parents & teachers have us shouting from the roof as if we just climbed a HUGE mountain.  Because, well, we sort of did!

  • After my children asked me for a journal of their own, I searched endlessly for something like this only to come up empty handed.  To our knowledge, Archer's Adventure Journal is the first Bible Based Guided Journal specifically designed for kids.  And THAT is something to get excited about!
  • As parents of 3 little ones, we know the importance of teaching them routines, and helping them cultivate good habits that will carry them throughout their lives and prayerfully lead them into responsible adulthood.  The very best thing we can teach our children is how to spend time with God, hear His voice, read His Word and apply it to their lives.  We truly believe that having a daily check-in tool like Archer's Adventure Journal where they are guided through His Word, and given prompts for further conversation will help them grow in their own faith, and become stronger and more confident in their relationship with Jesus.
  • Isaac and I were both raised by Mother's who dedicated their lives to elementary education.  With over 75 years of teaching between the two of them, our sweet Mama's became sounding boards, developers, advisors, and our biggest cheerleaders on the planet.  They helped us create a unique book for children that was not only adorable and fun, but also structured, purposeful
  • We utilized common core strategies to help children relate God's Word to their everyday life in a structured, predictable, and engaging way.  The journal gives children a chance to read, write, draw, and get in touch with their feelings.  And as a great bonus, it gives children the opportunity to write their very own book to be proud of.
  • A wonderful side-effect that we never anticipated was how the pages of these journals turned into windows into our children's hearts.  The things they have written, and the questions that they have asked since using the journals have been the greatest gift.  We've had the most incredible conversations, and learned so much about how to love them well, and support them best where they are at.   As a mama, I am seriously so thankful that I have this tool now.

The "out on a limb" Adventure...

It's true, we want to ensure that Archer makes it's way into the hands of hundreds of children across the country no matter what.

  • This spring we released a 13 week Summer Edition of the Archer Adventure Journal.  The journals sold out in 4 days and we quickly had a waiting list of several hundred people that wanted to get in line for the School Year Journal.
  • When we looked into production, that is when we hit our first obstacle.  Because we were adding about 300 pages to the journal, AND making it hard cover, the costs went up dramatically.  It started to become very apparent that we either wouldn't be able to make the journal, or if we did, they would be VERY expensive, and out of reach for many families.  With our target being to retail the journals for less than $25, we knew we had to figure out something.  As it turns out, if you make a very large order, the cost drops dramatically, but that also comes with a huge risk and an expense that we simply can't afford. 
  • We want to continue seeing Archer help children grow in their relationship with the Lord.  We want to see kids understanding the Bible in new ways, and learning how it applies to their everyday lives.  But we need your help.   Every bit of the money that we are able to raise through this campaign will go towards production costs for the journals, and will simultaneously help lower the retail price of the books for families and schools.  

The Nitty-Gritty Adventure

  • We need to raise $15,000 to help cover some of the production costs of our first ever run of Archer's School Journals.  
  • Production for the journals is already underway because we are so passionate about this project.  We wanted this to happen no matter what.  We truly believe that these journals will make an eternal difference in the lives of children, so this is a project that is guaranteed to come to pass.  Every dollar raised helps lower retail costs, and makes them more accessible for children of all incomes, and parents that have multiple children to buy for.
  • Since production is underway, we plan to ship out any Journals ordered by Mid-August!

Please consider being a part of our Adventure!

If you aren't in a position to give monetarily, but you believe in what we are doing, we would be SO blessed if you could help in some other ways.

  • PRAY | Please pray for us.  I know it sounds cliche', but we believe in the power of prayer, and we believe that with God, we can do impossible things.  We would love your prayers that we could get the printing costs of Archer covered to make them more accessible to children.  We would also love your prayers that God would open doors to bring the Adventures with Archer curriculum into schools and home-school communities.  We believe in these journals so much, and we know they will make an eternal impact in the hearts of children, so we pray that it can be many, many children.
  • SHARE | Please share this campaign!  Adventures with Archer is only a few months old, and we can only reach the people that we know.  If you've caught the vision and believe in what we are doing, we would be so honored if you would share this link with your friends, or mention it on social media. Thank you already!
  • GIVE | We would be so blessed if you'd consider donating financially to support our mission of helping kids cultivate a relationship with God.  Honestly, any amount helps.  If it's 50 cents, or 50 dollars, we would be ever so thankful.  We have also listed a bunch of fun perks that we thought you'd enjoy!

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.  We can't wait to get these books into the hands of little ones all over!

From our family to yours,

Karen, Isaac, Ava, Isaiah & Logan

story:
We love America. We care about our schools.

Our mission is to provide a free custom web app pre-loaded with anti-bullying resources for every school student council in America, and eventually build a full-featured native mobile app for every K-12 public school in the United States at absolutely zero cost to the school.

We offer a unique feature for positive social support to children affected by bullying.  Lets stop or at least minimize this tragedy together.

Suicide is the third leading cause of death among young people, resulting in about 4,400 deaths per year, according to the CDC. For every suicide among young people, there are at least 100 suicide attempts. Over 14 percent of high school students have considered suicide, and almost 7 percent have attempted it.

Bully victims are between 2 to 9 times more likely to consider suicide than non-victims, according to studies by Yale University

Together, we can make a difference.


Our Company

The School Apps USA mobile app platform has been in development for several years, while our sales office was established in July, 2011. We are located just off Route 747 near West Chester, Ohio, only a few miles North of Cincinnati.

School Apps USA is the industry leader in modern mobile apps, providing exceptional technology, training, and services to schools and organizations seeking mobile service and solutions that can improve their communication with parents, students, and staff.

Since November, 2012, School Apps USA LLC has been managed by brothers Kevin and Terry Kidd. We have 5 dedicated sales staff members, an I.T. Director, Assistant I.T. Director, and a growing team of qualified app builders to create a stunning app for your school or organization in the shortest turnaround time possible.

To date we have built mobile apps for over 60 schools, school districts, and educational organizations including:

Basha Elementary (AZ), Thurgood Marshall Fundamental Middle School (FL), Eugene Ashley High School (NC), Springboro City Schools (OH), Lakota Local Schools (OH), Edgewood City Schools (OH), Monroe Local Schools (OH), Little Miami Schools (OH), the Alabama Department of Education (in production), Mobile County Public Schools (AL), and the list goes on.

We are also an official partner of OESCA (Ohio Educational Service Center Assn.).


ABOUT KEVIN KIDD

Kevin brings 25 years of business and personnel management to School Apps USA. He has worked with administration boards in developing marketing and operations strategies. His experience also includes consulting on the distribution of high end properties throughout the US. As a sales executive for 5 years Kevin negotiated sales and brought over a million dollars in commission to his company.

With a love for children, Kevin has worked with kids directing and counseling in summer camps, coached youth sports for over 10 years, and developed a soccer league for a Florida community through a coalition with the YMCA. Kevin also spent extensive time working with The Big Oaks Boys and Girls Ranches in AL. 

Kevin is married with 3 children.


Our Need

We need $750,000-$1,000,000 to set up our massive infrastructure in order to build and maintain mobile apps for 1000's of schools.

We will be developing a customer service team, school acquisition team, support services, creative staff, and programming developers.

After infrastructure is completed (timeline approximate 3 months), we will commence a massive marketing campaign to introduce and invite corporate sponsors statewide, regionally, and nationally.

The cost per app will be scaled for sponsors to know exactly how far sponsorship dollars will go and for how long.

Initial proposed agreement with large sponsor and donor relationships beyond this campaign will be 2-year commitment per school app making app entirely free to the school. After agreement there will be an opportunity to renew.


The Impact

According to statistics reported by ABC News, nearly 30% of students are either bullies or victims of bullying, and 160,000 kids stay home from school every day because of fear of bullying.

“One in six American schoolchildren report being bullied verbally, physically and online, two to three times a month or more, many for more than a year.
That’s a fact.

Remember that bullying is symptomatic of a much deeper wound. If we allow it to continue to fester, the symptoms will only increase in severity. They will not go away. By failing to intervene, we forgo an opportunity to stem a tide that will, in time, wash ashore with a force more powerful and more violent than previously possible.”

Joaquin Phoenix, Actor
USA Today Column, 8/12/2012


We offer a unique feature for positive social support to children affected by bullying.  Lets stop or at least minimize this tragedy together.



The App

BRIEF FEATURE OVERVIEW

  • Help Eliminate Bullying and Improve Safety & Security
  • Send Unlimited Push Notifications for important announcements and updates
  • Increase Attendance at School Functions as well as Parent & Community Participation
  • GPS Locations and Contact Information with Click-to-Call
  • View Calendar of Events and Event Locations
  • View ProgressBook, EZ Pay, and Lunch Menus
  • View Staff Directories and Contact Details
  • Post Up-to-Date Sports Schedules, Locations, and Scores
  • Sell School and Sports Apparel & Merchandise
  • Offer Coupons or Advertising Space to Existing Booster Supporters
  • Instant Access to Official School Rules, Regulations & Important Documents
  • List Nearby Local Points of Interest and Reference
  • Allow Parents and Students to Post Comments and/or Pics on School Fan Wall
  • School Photo Galleries and eMail Photos Form for Gallery
  • Increase App Usage through Social Sharing using Facebook, Twitter, Text and Email
  • Robust and Extremely User-Friendly 24/7 Content Management System


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are able to contribute, thank you. If not today, we understand. Please share our vision and video with everyone you know, we would truly appreciate that. Our goal is that through hard work and dedication, lives will be positively altered forever.


More Information

School Apps USA, LLC
9018 Sutton Place
Cincinnati, Ohio 45011

www.schoolappsusa.com

CLICK HERE to download our Vision Packet

story:
A BIG SPECIAL THANKS TO ALL OF OUR BACKERS SO FAR! 


Meme (noun)

1. an element of a culture or system of behavior that may be considered to be passed from one individual to another by nongenetic means, especially imitation.
  • a humorous image, video, piece of text, etc. that is copied (often with slight variations) and spread rapidly by Internet users.
*****UPDATE********

                   

At VOTE4MEME, the scumbag Steves of the world hit the virtual big time.

VOTE4MEME is the new social platform where everyone and their “gangy” can quickly and easily submit memes, vote on their favorites, or do both— and win awesome prizes sponsored by great brands.

At VOTE4MEME, we will host the internet’s most unique and hilarious meme contests. Whether it's funny videos, photos, or GIFS, there’s a contest for every internet badass out there. And if you’re such a next-level slacker you’re actually too lazy to submit content, no problem! You can vote on other people’s submissions.

There is no power in the universe greater than the Urge to Meme. Right now, thousands of people are adding hilarious captions to cat pictures, turning Drake into a Jedi Knight, and risking their future child-bearing abilities just to make you laugh. And, until now, the only return for their efforts has been a lonely, vague sense of self-satisfaction. Pshhh... who wants that??

We’re here to harness all of that energy, and reward your artistry with REAL, tangible prizes, as well as major internet bragging rights.

HOW IT WORKS:

_____________________________________________________________________________

                        

Founded by professional goof-balls, Vote4Meme's goal is to give creative smartasses the world's best place to play.

On the surface, VOTE4MEME is an entertainment platform built to make you laugh, but at its core, it’s a vibrant, active community. VOTE4MEME is built on four pillars:

* To harness mankind’s unquenchable urge to waste time

* To inspire friendly, hilarious competition

* To build and nurture community involvement 

* To reward creativity, effort and especially, comedy

The stronger our community gets, the more differentiated subgroups of users within it become. Cat fanciers will likely have different interests than ice-bucket challenge fans. Basketball Trick-Shooters respond to different banner ads than Frustrated Mommies. But all of them love to express themselves. And they all love to laugh.  VOTE4MEME aims to be a community we all can share.

                         

Seeing your completed meme online is its own reward. But meme creation + prizes? Genius. And you’re getting in on the ground floor. What? You want more? We’ll give you more. 

Feast your eyes on this fabulous selection of backer packages. Not fabulous enough? Tell us what you need. We’ll make it happen. (Within reason. No, you can’t have a pony.)

                          

Remember when the asteroid took out the Earth in Deep Impact? This is like that, except with more Morgan Freeman and less mass extinction. You guys know – there’s a ton of creative energy out there. Haters gonna hate, and memers gonna meme. All that’s left is to provide a better platform for you to do it. And all that takes is money. Yours.

BUDGET BREAKDOWN

   

Note: No Team member will be receiving any compensation from this crowd funding campaign. Period. Everything is going toward the development of our site and this project.

___________________________________________________________________________

                           

Risks? On the internet? Who ever heard of such a thing? But seriously, success is never guaranteed. The possibility does exist that you don’t give us enough money, our technology explodes, or people suddenly stop finding cats hilarious. But if you think about it, we’ve got a simple, strong, low-overhead idea here. It just needs work. And cats. And money.  The more of all of those things you contribute*, the higher our chances of success, and the lower your risk becomes. We’re incredibly open to feedback, and committed to making executive decisions through careful planning, research, and testing.

                           

Help Spread the Word

We need more backers. So tell all your friends, your parents, your brother, sister, dog, priest, anyone willing to contribute.

Follow us on Social Media

Our “Drake” memes can always use more likes. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tinder, Whatever.

Discover a trove of lost Mayan gold and give us a share of the reward

Friends with Nathan Drake or Indiana Jones? Then what are you waiting for?! 

                           

Ironically, creating the Global Epicenter of time-wasting requires the exact opposite of wasting time. And we’re committed to that. We’ll do everything humanly (and Wookiely) possible to make this happen. We think it's going to be powerful, profitable, and above all, a hell of a good time.

Get on board. It’s going to be a blast!

*Please do not send cats. Pictures of cats are fine, though.

now, the only return for their efforts has been a lonely, vague sense of
self-satisfaction. Pshhh... who wants that??
We’re here to harness
all of that energy, and reward your artistry with REAL, tangible
prizes, as well as major internet bragging rights.HOW IT WORKS:_____________________________________________________________________________                        
Founded by professional goof-balls, Vote4Meme's goal is to give
creative smartasses the world's best place to play.
On the surface,
VOTE4MEME is an entertainment platform built to make you laugh, but at its
core, it’s a vibrant, active community. VOTE4MEME is built on four
pillars:

* To harness mankind’s
unquenchable urge to waste time
* To inspire friendly,
hilarious competition
* To build and nurture
community involvement 
* To reward creativity,
effort and especially, comedy
The stronger our
community gets, the more differentiated subgroups of users within it become.
Cat fanciers will likely have different interests than ice-bucket challenge
fans. Basketball Trick-Shooters respond to different banner ads than Frustrated
Mommies. But all of them love to express themselves. And they all love to laugh. 
VOTE4MEME aims to be a community we all can share.
                         
Seeing your completed
meme online is its own reward. But meme creation + prizes? Genius. And you’re
getting in on the ground floor. What? You want more? We’ll give you more. 
Feast your eyes on this
fabulous selection of backer packages. Not fabulous enough? Tell us what you
need. We’ll make it happen. (Within reason. No, you can’t have a pony.)
                          
Remember when the
asteroid took out the Earth in Deep Impact? This is like that,
except with more Morgan Freeman and less mass extinction. You guys know –
there’s a ton of creative energy out there. Haters gonna hate, and memers gonna
meme. All that’s left is to provide a better platform for you to do it. And all
that takes is money. Yours.BUDGET BREAKDOWN   
Note: No Team member will be receiving any compensation from this crowd funding campaign. Period. Everything is going toward the development of our site and this project.


___________________________________________________________________________
                           
Risks? On the
internet? Who ever heard of such a thing? But seriously, success is
never guaranteed. The possibility does exist that you don’t give us enough
money, our technology explodes, or people suddenly stop finding cats hilarious.
But if you think about it, we’ve got a simple, strong, low-overhead idea
here. It just needs work. And cats. And money.  The more of all of those
things you contribute*, the higher our chances of success, and the lower your
risk becomes. We’re incredibly open to feedback, and committed to making
executive decisions through careful planning, research, and testing.
                           
Help Spread the Word
We need more backers. So tell all your friends, your parents, your brother, sister, dog, priest, anyone
willing to contribute.
Follow us on Social
Media
Our “Drake” memes can
always use more likes. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tinder,
Whatever.Discover a trove of lost Mayan gold and give us a share of the reward
Friends with
Nathan Drake or Indiana Jones? Then what are you waiting for?! 
                           
Ironically, creating the
Global Epicenter of time-wasting requires the exact opposite of wasting time.
And we’re committed to that. We’ll do everything humanly (and Wookiely)
possible to make this happen. We think it's going to be powerful, profitable,
and above all, a hell of a good time.
Get on board. It’s going
to be a blast!
*Please do not send
cats. Pictures of cats are fine, though.

story:
Short Summary

Growing up in photographs. Year after year, that is the primary way thousands of community-ready parents behind prison walls in New York State must experience their children.

Why? Because year after year, that state’s parole board arbitrarily and unjustly denies parole to these parents and thousands of other community-ready men and women who have clearly earned the opportunity to return home.  

What We Need & What You Get

The Statewide Parole Reform Campaign, launched by the Prison Ministry of the internationally respected Riverside Church in New York City, is working to change this broken system of back-end mass incarceration. We now have a comprehensive Omnibus Truth-in-Parole Bill that would bring about reform in meaningful ways. (to view the bill, visit http://www.parolereformnow.org/) A successful, highly respected public-interest lobbyist and lawyer believes in the bill and wants to put his more than 25 years of legislative experience behind it so that people who deserve to be released are ultimately no longer languishing in prison. 

We need to raise $25,000 to retain his services and sustain a legislative campaign over the next three years, a mere fraction of what such work ordinarily costs—thanks to the lawyer/lobbyist’s mission of serving the public interest.  

The Impact

The time is now. If we do nothing, these unwarranted parole denials will continue to translate into extended years of incarceration, with a crippling impact that is felt far beyond prison walls:  

1.  Children and Families: Nearly 80,000 children in New York State have at least one parent in prison; most live in low-income communities of color. As the separation due to incarceration is unreasonably lengthened, these children experience a sense of loss that—because of stigma and the lack of compassion—is often more crippling than other causes of parental loss. They become more likely to have health problems, both physical and mental, and sometimes exhibit aggressive, antisocial behavior that leads to jail. Families struggle to stay connected to incarcerated loved ones, but visits typically require long hours of travel and money that’s in short supply. Collect calls can be cost prohibitive.

2.  The Community: As certain communities in New York continue to experience unreasonable parole denials, the socio-economic impact is shattering. These areas endure stigmatization, a dearth of economic development, heightened poverty, political disempowerment and widespread community decay. They become marginalized hubs for excessive policing. They become breeding grounds for despair and desperation.

3.  The Economy: Taxpayers are overburdened by unjust parole denials. People returning from extended incarceration lose about 40% of their earning potential and are often compelled to seek public assistance at taxpayers’ expense. Repeatedly denying parole to thousands of community-ready men and women results in lost tax revenues, high government payouts and drains on essential services. When people remain incarcerated well into their senior years, the economic impact is even more adverse.

In the end, each and every one of us is made poorer, in so many ways.

Risks & Challenges

While there are never guarantees with legislative campaigns, our lawyer/lobbyist has succeeded with parole legislation in the past, as well as with legislation to repeal the Rockefeller Drug Laws. Add to that the fact that more and more people across this nation—including legislators on both sides of the aisle—increasingly view America’s more than 40-year experiment with mass incarceration as a stunningly destructive failure. Given all that, we have faith that your donation will ultimately lead to more and more community-ready people returning home and becoming contributing citizens. 

Other Ways You Can Help

So, help us help us all. Please give.

Use your Indiegogo share tool! Make some noise about our campaign!

Thanks to one and all,

The NY Statewide Parole Reform Campaign,

Launched by the Riverside Church Prison Ministry

story:
In short

The environment of this card game is the classroom.

Using a collaborative/cooperative methodology in an informal educational setting, it was planned to motivate and engage students.

It is for learning about atoms structure and The Periodic Table of the elements.

It can be played in 5 different ways in 10 levels of expertise.

It has individual workout exercise sheets for educational procedure automation.

It can also be used within the family like a quiz card game.

At this moment its a prototype. To improve his design and produce it we need your help.

Help this happen next December.

Thank You!

more:

  • Goal: more isotopes then the other teams
  • 2 role playing: judges and players
  • up to 25 students playing at the same time
  • Students grouped up to 6 teams of 3 elements each
  • Judges can be  up to 7
  • 50% will fund a mini Fab Lab "Open Lab": lababerto.wordpress.com

Available in Portuguese.


Why?

I feel fortunate when students says "The lesson his going to end!? Already? Let me finished this, please, one more minute, please!? Teacher." I often ear this whenever I use this and other card games or online games. That's when I feel great, helping others to learn something very important, to gain confidence and acquire meaningful knowledge, with happiness and engagement.


Games engage and motivate students to learn. Cooperative learning its powerful. Why not merge them? For procedures automation we include pedagogical materials.

This card game its about atoms, ions and isotopes, and it as also pedagogical material to elaborate learning about this subject at a introductory level and for procedures automation. It as 10 levels of expertise and 4 different ways to play with.

It allows for students to work in group of 2 or 25. It as also pedagogical materials to practice about the subject in an individual way, because there a need to automate procedures, and 20% of the students don't like this type of learning.


The target students are from 13 to 16 years old. It can be played in a classroom or outside (if there is no wind).

We hope to sell 100 card games in this first shot.

Copyright: the card game and pedagogical materials to be printed and copied under CC BY 2.0;


About me

 I'm Chemistry and Physics teacher in a Portuguese Secondary School (curriculum). I've a degree in Physics, master degree in Educational Physics and DEA in eLearning. Passionate about startups, mini Fab Labs, projects, hands-on and cooperative learning, Rovers, Digital fabrication. Now, I've a new project, starting a mini FAB LAB (LabAberto) in the city of Torres Vedras where I live.


What We Need & What You Get

We need 2000 euros. 20% is for the investment in raw materials; 30% is for handcrafting the card game; 50% is to fund part of the laser cutter we need for the mini FAB LAB project to gain legs.

You get a complete card board game for peer learning with pedagogical material for individual student practice and full free completely pdf file to DIY under CC BY 2.0;.

Available languages: English, Portuguese. (its possible to use other languages, if you order it)


Perk

  • The BASIC perk, costs 8 euros, its a pdf file with all the card game and pedagogical materials to be printed and copied;
  • The INTERMEDIATE perk, cost 21 euros, includes the card game printed and plasticized in paper and a pdf file with pedagogical materials;
  • TOP perk, cost 27 euros/31 euros, in this case, the main card board is made with card/MDF and the rest of the cards are printed and plasticized. The pedagogical materials will be sended by email as a pdf file;
  • Grouping perk, 10 card games, 10 % discount
  • Grouping perk, 50 card games, 20 % discount
  • If we reach 5000 euros we will upgrade the card game to the possibility to have more cards and same of them with wild behavior
  • If we reach 10000 euros we will include also the possibility of learning particle physics at an introductory level and also electrons configuration


The Impact

We hope that this game provide a tool that help teachers around the world to:

  • promote better learning
  • promote cooperative learning
  • engage and motivate their students to Science
  • prepare real and insightful lessons that can be reused
  • prepare lessons with less effort and at a lower price
  • work in an international working group about the use of this game

Experience

Since 1992 I've been teaching. After 2000 I start to use cooperative games that promote team building. Short after, I plan to use this methodology within the classroom to teach Science. Most of the classes were very receptive, 20% didn't like it. I continue to use it but I complemented it with the pedagogical materials that the game have.

Short after this, I found that if I adapted pedagogical materials in a kind of "game" structure, with levels and hands-on approach, students engage in the process. As this practice went on, I found that this type of work was very helpful to promote the automation of procedures.

Last semester I took a short course on gamification at EDX "MITx: 11.127x Design and Development of Games for Learning" and discover same other strategies that I could use to adapt once again the materials that I have used in classroom.

At this moment, the card game is a stable and playful activity and we decided to share it,  hoping to find people interested in using and develop it.

The issue we have to solve its about the mailing. So, we have to decide what type of design we will use to make the game short and lighter enough to cu the costs

Another issue its about the overall design of the game. If we reach the 5000 euros, we will hire a designer to make sure that the game its more user friendly and beautiful. It makes sense, its for beautiful persons!

facebook.com/lababerto
twitter.com/lababerto
http://www.youtube.com/lababerto
lababerto@gmail.com


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot buy or you are not interested in the project,

  • spread the word: share it in the social networks
  • Indiegogo as same share tools, use them!
  • Fund directly our mini FAB LAB: lababerto.wordpress.com

And that's all there is to it.


Update:

  • Discussing a fifth way to play, using cards to explore the periodic table main properties like a quiz card game
  • We changed the main game card board by a board similar to the periodic table
  • We are organizing a WIKI (http://atomosemoleculas.com/wiki) to promote an international development team.
  • Next week we will finish the card with all the major updates. We hope to send it by the end of this month. Thank you!

story:
My name is Lina Tori Jan and I am from Kabul, Afghanistan. Currently I am studying abroad in the United States as a senior of Wyoming Seminary Upper school. Even though I am blessed more than I deserve, I will never forget about my past and childhood in Afghanistan. Growing up in poverty as a child taught me to have empathy toward every kid and older people who is suffering from poverty and harsh environment. When I was young, my family lived  in cold tents and on refugee camps for a few years. There were nights that my siblings and I went to bed hungry. Knowing the harsh consequences of the winter season in Afghanistan, I have  decided to launch a fundraising program to help the the poor families around the Kabul city. 

My goals is to raise $10,000. This money will be used for wood, food, medicine, blankets and school supplies. Each family will get $200 to buy wood and food (rice, wheat, oil) and an additional $100 for blankets and school supplies. I will be visiting these families personally and delivering their gifts.  Also, I am asking and planning to make small bags of gifts that will have toys and candies which will be delivered to the kids living on the streets as Christmas presents from their friends in the United States. I want them to know that all around the world, people do care and are aware of what they are going through and that they are not alone.  I am sure that there are many who would love to take part in this in sharing their Christmas with the kids. 

I am aware that reaching this goal may be difficult but this is something I really feel passionate about and would like to do. With Christmas coming in two months, I am hoping that everyone that can contribute will take part in it. Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. You can always contribute to my campaign through getting the word out.

Thank you!

story:
Music Teachers' Cultural and Educational Exchange, Wakefield/Chelsea, QC & Valparaiso, Chile!

Two music teachers and musicians, Heather Horak of the Gatineau Hills, QC (near Ottawa) and Camilo Gomez Camblor of Valparaiso, Chile embark on an exchange of music, culture, friendship, learning, and inspiration! 

Part 1: Heather goes to Chile to learn and work with Camilo (Feb 2016)

WHY?

To learn more about south american music traditions/textures through advanced studies on charango, musical and cultural immersion, and co-creation with musicians in Valparaiso, Chile.  To broaden the diversity of her scope as a musician and teacher, to get inspired, and to bring this inspiration home to her students and community.

Part 2: Camilo comes to Canada to perform and work with Heather (Summer 2016)

WHY?

To make his first splash in North America as a professional performer and animator, to share his music, conduct workshops and classes (some with Heathers' students, some with the public (children/adults), to teach about his native music traditions and textures, and to swim in the Gatineau River!

SEEKING YOUR PARTICIPATION

We need to raise $5,000 to pay for travel,  food/lodging, supplies/equipment, venues, promotion, tech support, recording, accompianing musicians and miscellaneous expenses.

OFFERING COOL PERKS!
Concert tickets, music lessons, percussion workshop for children, grease up your spanish speaking, take home a new CD, or host a live house concert. 
DIRECT YOUR CONTRIBUTION
Use the Perk "Grants" tabs to simply make a contribution and direct it to a specific aspect of the exchange (travel, study, recording, etc.)
THE IMPACT
  • Build friendships between two artistic individuals and their cultural communities
  • Support continuing education for independent teachers
  • Inspire/Broaden/Challenge two musicians/teachers who will in turn impact their students, communities, and their art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Become a "Buzz Team" member and help spread the word and drum up interest in our campaign!  Attend the workshops and concerts that will be presented next summer.  Help Heather pack.

story:
Summary

Humanity Africa is a not-for-profit organisation. Our flagship project #ProjectMazao aims to alleviate poverty by equipping farmers with agricultural input and training in Zambia.

Project Mazao involes rural farmers by giving them input and training.

1.  Farmers use this to feed their families and with the training create small enterprises.

2.  Farmers then sell these products to Humanity Africa at a fair price.

3.  Humanity Africa then sells this to markets for a small profit.

4.  With these profits Humanity Africa supports more rural farmers.

We have learned that the best way to help people is not by providing them aid in the form of food and clothes etc, but to teach them HOW to produce food and be self-reliant.

To this day, Humanity Africa has been supported by three corporate sponsors. We are supported by the Zambian Ministry of Agriculture, who have faith in our intentions and work. Companies have invested (between 2014-2015) over £35,000 in research, acquiring land to develop our projects and support amazing volunteers on the ground. Every year volunteers give over thousands of hours of volunteer time to work with us.

Would you give if you knew your gift lasted forever? Are you ready to donate?

What We Need & What YOU Get

The entire project costs £119,000, but we'd be ecstatic to raise £25,000. We have already invested £35,000 into the project already through our corporate sponsors. 

We want to reach our goal. The more we raise the more farmers we can work with. So if we raise £50,000, we help 200 farmers. If we raise £100,000, we help 400 farmers and if we raise a MILLION, we help a few villages of farmers. But nothing will happen without your support. 

SO WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO? 

Our corporate sponsors cover ALL ADMIN COSTS, which means...

Of every pound you give 70p goes directly to the farmer's training and empowerment.

The remaining 30p goes toward developing high yielding environmentally sustainable crops and livelihoods (including poultry and livestock) to make it £2.10 to give to 3 farmers. Check out our video!

In social enterprises, your gifts are multiplied, because we are investing in the future and not just the present.  

The Impact

In Zambia, supporting one farmer means supporting an entire family. The world would be a better place if this could happen in all corners of the globe. 

If a family becomes self reliant they will be able to send their kids to school and put food on the table.

We are not just bringing them out of poverty we are helping them to defeat hunger and gain education.

We believe and know that one big push will allow us to create and help develop enough opportunities in the field to make sure rural farmers can:

·  Harvest their crops and sell them at a fair price so they can keep profits

·  Train on intercropping and crop rotation so that they are never short on food 

·  Feed their families and send their children to school 

·  Be paid fair wages when they choose to work on other people's farms

·  Be ambassadors of their own transformation

Our team includes international development experts who give their time voluntarily and are committed to supporting rural Zambian farmers in a sustainable way.  You can contact the team with all your questions and we will be delighted to answer them all.

PERKS

Sign up for your perks on our perks page!

Risks & Challenges

The project’s external risks involve:

Not raising a substantial amount of money, thus delaying the project

Climate change issues impacting growth of crops

How we aim to tackle them:

We have to raise funds through different means

Introduce poultry and livestock along with agriculture to reduce shocks of climate change impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

·  Ask your friends and family to donate.

·  Volunteer with us

·  Don’t just like us, share : Liking us doesn’t help, but sharing does – EVERYWHERE. We are on facebook, twitter, linkedin, google+, flickr and instagram

·  Share our videos

·  Talk about us at social gatherings

·  Invite us to your events/meetings to explain more about what we do

story:
A start-up investment, a project of harmonious development. 
Help us complete it and make our dream a reality.
"Kaminari Nature & Culture Park" needs your help to open its doors! 


A RETURN TO NATURE & A RETURN TO INNOCENCE PROJECT
A flash back to daily rural and cultural life during the past in Rhodes, Greece 
(late 19th - early 20th century) 


"Kaminari Park", an open-air park and museum of more than 25 acres, allows visitors to experience the traditions and activities of village life in the Dodecanese islands through nature and agrotourism. It includes activities and synergies and offers every visitor the ideal place to live and experience a natural, traditional and healthy way of life. 

"Kaminari Park" follows the era of innocence, simplicity and originality. By recalling the actual living and working conditions that the villagers of Rhodes experienced up until the middle of the 20th century, we point out that the values of life have not been separated from our roots. These values will be the fundamental principles leading to the rebirth of our country. 
A visit to kaminari is a journey back to our roots, which makes the present a reflection to  our past.
A journey full of experiences, activities, memories and sentiments.


In order to accomplish this project and to achieve our goals,we need your contribution and financial support.
PROJECT HIGHLIGHTS
  • To designate the hidden treasures our villages have by focusing on the attempts to preserve customs, traditions and skills of local villagers’ ancestors. 
  • To keep alive and revive memories from the past. 
  • To step into our Greek heritage which many Greek immigrants have held close to their hearts after leaving the Aegean islands years ago seeking a new and better life abroad. 
  • To demonstrate and re-enact traditional occupations and skills. To teach, inspire and instruct young generations through relevant courses and activities.
  • To praise and honor, individually or through their associations, all our compatriots who live abroad and support our homeland all these years. 
The visitors will have the unique opportunities
a. To experience the flora and fauna of the area or to gain permaculture experience.
b. To visually see displays and re-enactments of activities from the past relevant to farming and non-existent traditional occupations including methods of producing local goods, authentic tools and other items which were used by the farmers in their daily productive lives. 


In this way, they can live and experience skills such as:
  • traditionally producing bread (from threshing wheat to baking) and local foods 
  • cultivation of crops 
  • production of dairy products (local cheeses) and the process of milking 
  •  preparing sweets from local fruits, using traditional methods 
  •  harvesting and collecting wild herbs, utilizing an Herb Essential Oil Distiller, and soap making 
  •  picking of olives for the production of olive oil 
  •  production of lime made by heating limestone 
  •  traditional charcoal making 
  •  presentation of shoe making, carpentry and blacksmith skills 
  •  traditional sewing of local costumes and broadloom weaves 
  •  making pottery
c. To attend courses and workshops about: pottery, wood-crafts, soap making, bread making and permaculture.
d. To see vintage photograph exhibitions presenting daily activities and life from the past , to admire artistic creations as well as documents concerning the period of Italian occupation of the villages around the Kaminari area.
e. To participate in the revival of the traditional wedding ceremony. 

Supporting tradition and aiming to bring you closer to it, we offer you a traditional wedding ceremony locally called “antigamos” in our Eco Park “Kaminari”. This ceremony will be inspired from the wedding of our grandparents and will revive tradition, music and customs that people in our village used to have years ago in their wedding ceremonies. Scenes from the past, derived from the roots of our families , will become the link between tradition and new generations in the beginning of their new life. 

DESCRIPTION OF THE AREA
The area consists of an open-air park of more than 25 acres, representing tradition and nature. All construction has been designed to utilize the natural environment, in adhering to the local and traditional methods of construction. The main materials used are stones, soil, clay, wood and mortar. The park is created in a way to allow one to experience the original architecture and design of the villages on the island. It consists of small traditional buildings as they were built in the past in the villages. As you walk through the park, the surrounding area will display the naturally growing fauna and flora found on the island of Rhodes. 


HOW HAS OUR PROJECT BEEN FUNDED SO FAR?
The project started in 2011 and up to this point we have completed 75% of it. For the total cost of 350,000 euros we have already invested 200,000 euros of our own capital and 62,500 euros subsidized by European Programmes. 
Following the guidelines regarding investment policies by the Greek government, we had secured a loan with the Dodecanese Bank for the remaining 25% (87,500 euros). Unfortunately, the bank filed bankruptcy and the remaining funding was lost. 
Therefore we are seeking alternative funding in order to complete our project. We feel this project has its merits and we are determined to see its completion.


HOW WILL YOUR PLEDGE BE SPENT?
Your money will be spent on the following:
  • Completion of the display and exhibition place for the local products (15,000 euros) 
  • Equipment for the old olive oil mill (8,000 euros) 
  • Reconstruction of the old lime kiln (2,000 euros) 
  • Landform and landscaping (10,000 euros) 
  • Planting (3,000 euros) 
  • Equipment for traditional, nonexisting occupations: shoe maker, forger, carpenter, potter, tailor, barber (2,000 euros each ~ total 12,000 euros) 
If we can surpass our goal, the extra money will go to additional construction works that we have excluded from our initial building budget. An extra 25,000-35,000 euros above our goal will allow us to complete the constructing works including the icon painting and religious items for the church dedicated to the people of Rhodes who live abroad –Our DIASPORA (10,000 euros). 
Also, the biological waste water treatment system (4,500 euros), the equipment for solar energy (8,500 euros), FreeFlo water recycling system (10,000 euros) and the equipment for the distillery (2,500 euros) can be funded. 


Make a pledge 
We need to reach our funding goal by January 31st, 2016. If you would like to help make this project a reality, please make a pledge to help us get a step closer to reaching that goal. The grand opening of Kaminari Park is scheduled for April 2016.
Invest and/or make a loan
You can invest in our project and become a shareholder with an equity option. Additionally, another option is to loan funds to the Kaminari project with flexible terms. For additional information, direct your email to info@kaminari.gr 
Other Ways You Can Help
Of course we understand if money is tight. If you are unable to contribute financially, we would still love for you to be involved. There are many ways to show your support!

Help us spread the word by sharing the information about our campaign on social media and within your community! Tell your friends, family, and colleagues about Kaminari Park. 

Share our website, www.kaminari.gr, with others who care about sustainable development and pioneer ideas. Be a fan of our Facebook page or sign up for our newsletter to get updates about Kaminari Park and other happenings in ECOMUSEUM Rhodes. By spreading the word you will be helping us to find our potential supporters.

If you have old vintage 1910’s-50’s items you want to donate to us, we can surely find a place and a use for it.
Most importantly share this campaign with everyone you know! Hopefully, they can contribute to our cause. Any contribution big or small will be a great support and appreciated. 


SYNERGIES AND COOPERATION
  • Are you interested in synergies with this project?
  • Are you interested in making a cluster? 
  • Do you have a similar activity (e.g. ecomuseum or theme park, permaculture) which you would like to connect with us so that we could have a common promotion policy? 
  • Do you have an idea which you would like to include in the activities of our project? 
  • Are you a craftsman of wood or other metallic items? Would you like to display your work at Kaminari Park? 
  • Are you interested for a unique event for the representatives of your conference? 
  • Are you interested in a natural way of life and want to get involved in our activities? 
  • Are you interested in being an investor or shareholder in independent projects of the Ecomuseum Rodos? 
Please mail us at info@kaminari.gr

WHO WE ARE
Τhe person who inspired this project is Dimitrios Koukoulas, an economist with significant experience as CEO and partner in private sector companies. He has expertise in tourism, shipping and the stock exchange field. His associate is Mos Emmanouil Koukoulas , B.Sc Essex University (Computer Science).
Apart from this core team, who are mainly responsible to run this project and are members of the profit organization OMIKRON SA, there are also other members from the non-profit organization “ECOMUSEUM RODOS”. They are a group of citizens in Rhodes with prominent, exceptional and outstanding social activity. We are a team that believes and runs ambitious projects, have innovative ideas and work hard. 

OTHER ACTIONS/ACTIVITIES OF OURS

“Grandma Tsambika's House”, a folkloric museum located in Malona village


"Ecomuseum Rodos” is a heritage theme park in progress. It is the ideal solution for thematic routes in the area of the multiple villages: Archangelos, Malona, Massari, Laerma, Apollona and Platania. The concept is entirely based on a study of the sustainable development of cultural tourism and has been planned around the Ecomuseum Rhodes which unites, interprets, and presents the various potentials of the old village KAMINARI (14th century). It offers cultural landscape through the following components: thematic routes, trails, a documentation centre (The Kaminari Park), including the thematic backbones: water, natural beauties, history, tradition and daily life. 
“Dodecanesiandream.com” is a project which tried to establish a social network for all the Dodecanese people of Diaspora around the world. 

MAKE A DONATION (click here)

If you liked our work and effort, then please consider to make a kind donation through Pay Pal or any Credit Card. For all donations you will receive a thank you email from us and a surprise gift along with a Shout-Out on a special page on our www.kaminari.gr website. The names of all our supporters with their permission will be displayed on the notice board located at Kaminari Park. 

GIVING BACK TO THE COMMUNITY
An amount of money equal to the amount raised through crowdfunding will go back into supporting local community projects within four years such as: 
The “Feraklos Castle” reconstruction, in the Haraki area, in collaboration with the Ephorate of Byzantine Antiquities (Rhodes division) https://www.facebook.com/groups/322559974480350

Activities conducted by citizens of Rhodes concerning the protection of “DAMA-DAMA”, the deer which is the symbol of Rhodes. 

The protection and preservation of old olive trees of Rhodes. (Facebook Page)


We urge communities to come together, seek the real way of life and develop synergy projects in making an effort to survive in our homeland country. 

BUSINESS OR CHARITY
We are individuals belonging to the private sector economy. Thus, project “KAMINARI” is not a charity; it is a social enterprise structured as a for-profit company. This means we have a social mission and a commitment to reinvesting profits to continue to fulfill the goals of our project. Being set up as a for-profit business allows us to grow as a self-sustaining organization rather than depending upon grants and government aid for support. This gives us more opportunities for growth at a time when there are so many cuts to public services. 

“Behind every cloud there is a silver lining”. 
You can enable us to make a dream come alive. We strongly want you to participate in the evolution of this project and to become a part of the KAMINARI story. We would like to thank all of you for taking the time to read through our Crowdfunding project. 



ECOMUSEUM RHODES- registered as a non-profit organization
Registration Number 476/11, Rhodes
Tax Registration Number 997562880, Tax office of Rhodes, GR

OMIKRON SA- registered as a for-profit organization 
ΜΑΕ number 38910/80/Β/97/26 
GEMI number 72033520000
Tax Registration Number 094388167, Tax office of Rhodes, GR
ΙΒΑΝ GR14 0140 5930 5930 0200 2013 710
BIC: CRBAGRAA

We hope that we have provided you the information regarding our business project. 

If you have any additional questions or suggestions, please contact us at info@kaminari.gr

We look forward to hearing from you!

story:
Το Κοινωνικό Ωδείο είναι οι άνθρωποι.

Είμαστε εθελοντές, καθηγητές μουσικής και όχι μόνο. Μια ομάδα πολιτών που μοιράζεται την αγάπη για τη μουσική και την αλληλεγγύη για τον συνάνθρωπο.

Αποφασίσαμε να ενώσουμε τις δυνάμεις μας για έναν κοινό στόχο. Να μεταδώσουμε αφιλοκερδώς την τέχνη μας σε όσους δεν έχουν τα χρήματα να την σπουδάσουν. Να αποδείξουμε ότι δε μας λυγίζει η κρίση, ότι η ανθρώπινη αξία δεν μετριέται σε κανένα νόμισμα. Να επαναφέρουμε στο επίκεντρο την επιθυμία για μάθηση και την προσφορά.

Το Κοινωνικό Ωδείο, λοιπόν, είναι οι άνθρωποι του και θα λειτουργήσει με άξονα την συνεργασία και την συλλογική ευθύνη. Οι αποφάσεις μας είναι το αποτέλεσμα γενικών συνελεύσεων στις οποίες δεν συμμετέχουν μόνο οι καθηγητές αλλά και οι μαθητές ή οι γονείς τους ως ισάξιοι φορείς του μηνύματος του Κοινωνικού Ωδείου, αρωγοί στην προσπάθεια του.

Το Κοινωνικό Ωδείο είναι η μουσική.

Στην Ελλάδα η μουσική παιδεία ήταν ανέκαθεν προνόμιο όσων μπορούσαν να υποστηρίξουν πολυδάπανες ωδειακές σπουδές. Η κρατική μέριμνα για την διδασκαλία της μουσικής είναι μηδαμινή και υπό τις παρούσες συνθήκες φαίνεται αμφίβολο, εάν δεν τις υπερασπιστούμε, ότι θα διατηρηθούν έστω οι ελάχιστες δομές που υπάρχουν.

Μέσω του Κοινωνικού Ωδείου θέλουμε να κρατήσουμε ζωντανή την μουσική παιδεία. Αυτό δε σημαίνει όμως ότι υπαναχωρούμε από το πάγιο και διακαές αίτημα μας για δημόσια, δωρεάν, ποιοτική παιδεία για όλους. Με ίσες ευκαιρίες για κάθε μαθητή, με ερεθίσματα προς κάθε κατεύθυνση, συμπεριλαμβανομένης της μουσικής. Είναι η άρνηση του κράτους να εκπληρώσει τις υποχρεώσεις που έχει απέναντι στους πολίτες που μας σπρώχνει στην ανάγκη της ίδρυσης του Κοινωνικού Ωδείου.

Ωστόσο, δεν ανταγωνιζόμαστε τα Ωδεία. Υπήρξαμε μαθητές τους, είμαστε κατά πλειοψηφία καθηγητές, σεβόμαστε το έργο τους. Το Κοινωνικό Ωδείο επιδιώκει να παράσχει την ευκαιρία σε όσους έχουν τα λιγότερα μέσα και την μεγαλύτερη ανάγκη, να δημιουργήσει μια διέξοδο μέσα από τη μουσική.

Η αποτελεσματικότερη αντίσταση στην θλιβερή καθημερινότητα είναι η ανύψωση του πνεύματος, η καλλιέργεια και η γνώση. Μπορούμε και οφείλουμε σε αυτή τη σκοτεινή συγκυρία να γίνουμε η νότα που θα μας ταξιδέψει στα όνειρα μας.

ATHENS SOCIAL CONSERVATORY


Who we are.

We are volunteers and music teachers, a group of ordinary people with two things in common: love for music and solidarity for the others. 
In 2011, at the beginning of the economic crisis in Greece, we decided to join forces for a common goal: communicate free of charge our art to those who can't afford traditional music courses. Thus was founded the Athens Social Conservatory, in order to give everyone access to music education, regardless of their economical means. 

What we do.

In Athens Social Conservatory, every year, volunteer music teachers give lessons, without any payment, to over 80 children and adolescents. We give lessons of classical, modern and traditional music, theory classes, preparatory music classes and choir. Since 2013, the Conservatory has found its permanent home in Byron, Athens. Little by little, financed by donations from volunteers and friends of the Social Conservatory, we equipped the place with musical instruments and teaching material. We can proudly claim that now the Social Conservatory can provide as complete musical education as a normal Conservatory.

What we need.

However, as the Social Conservatory grows, its needs increase.  Our funds, risen exclusively by volunteers and friends, are insufficient to meet even the most functional expenses. There is now a real danger that the whole project comes to a financial impasse.
With the funds raised by this campaign we will be able to cover our ​​operating costs, to preserve and repair musical instruments, to buy books, educational material and a decent computer (yes, Intel Pentium still exists in a suburb of Athens!!)  and to organize some events in order to promote the work of Conservatory to the society. Your contribution is important to continue to offer free musical education to dozens of children who cannot afford it. 

Other ways to help.

But even if you don't have the financial ability, you can help in many other ways: become a volunteer, help us in the organization and maintenance of the place, participate to the events that we organize. You can get updates on our actions and events from our blog (http://koinwnikowdeio.blogspot.gr/) or our facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/koinwniko.wdeio).



Short Summary

 For approximately the last eight years, Greece has been suffering from a deep and multifaceted social crisis. The most tangible manifestation of the crisis is the financial one, which has deprived millions of citizens from access to basic goods. In their attempt to deal with this situation, more and more citizens are getting involved into self-organised solidarity collectivities. One of these is the Social Conservatory.

The Social Conservatory was founded in Athens in the end of 2011. Its main activity is free music lessons to students from families otherwise unable to afford them. The teachers work as volunteers without any remuneration. Every year an average of 40 volunteers (teachers and people involved into other activities) and of 80 students, mostly minors, pass from the Conservatory’s classrooms. Some of Greece’s top musicians, e.g. former members of the ERT (Greek Radio – Television) Symphony Orchestra, fired after the latter’s sudden closure by the government, are included in the ranks of our teachers. Classical music dominates the curriculum, but modern, traditional and …….. are also taught.

story:
Hi, I am an international final year pharmacy student in the United Kingdom.

I am a self-funding student who rely on earnings from weekend part-time jobs to support myself. I live a modest lifestyle and my small part-time income does not allow me to generate enough saving to fund for the application.

In order to become a registered pharmacist, I am required to undergo a year of training known as the Pre-Registration training. At the same time I am required to pay the following fees as part of the requirements in order to be eligible to enrol in the training programme:

  • RPS sponsorship (£1000)
  • Visa application fee (£200)
  • Pre-reg application fee (£150)
  • Total = £1350

Hence I hope you could help a talented and hard-working future pharmacist to achieve his ambition and give back to the community in the future by serving as a responsible pharmacist.

I thank you in advance for your kindness; every little donation means a lot to me.

story:
Short Summary

Namaste. My name is Anica James and I am a documentary photographer, currently based in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Exactly one year ago, I was living in Kathmandu, Nepal, where I interned with the Nepal Epilepsy Association for three months, focusing on a photography project documenting the medical side of epilepsy in the country.

I know what it is like firsthand to have epilepsy. While I was working with the NEA, I was confronted with the many hardships faced by people with epilepsy, especially living in a developing nation where their government does not give any funding towards their healthcare system. Many of the patients with epilepsy have to take medicine on a daily basis in order to control their seizures, but now, due to the recent and devastating earthquake on April 25, 2015, thousands of people are displaced, and do not have access to the medical care that they need.

This campaign is important to me because epilepsy is a commonly overlooked disorder, yet it affects over 50 million people worldwide. I am asking for your help because now, more than ever, the people in Nepal need donations for medical aid and I truly believe that together, we can make a difference.


What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $20,000, in which 100% of the money will be given directly to the Nepal Epilepsy Association to help their patients affected by the earthquake. The money will be used by the associations staff, most of whom represent the only neurosurgeons in Nepal, to purchase and distribute medicine, replace medical equipment and generators, and to help repair and rebuild their medical clinics that have been damaged.

In exchange for your donation of $100, you will receive a signed, limited edition 8”x10” photographic giclée print, which you can select from the images posted below. I have carefully selected the images in order to showcase not only what life was like in Nepal, but to also show historical buildings that are no longer there.

Each photograph will be printed on Hahnemühle William Turner 310 cotton rag paper with UltraChrome inks, assuring you that you will be receiving the highest quality product, thanking you in exchange for your donation to this important cause. My sponsor, Atlantic Photo Supply, are generously covering all of the printing costs for this project to ensure that 100% of your donation will be going directly to the Nepal Epilepsy Association and the victims of the earthquake. Prints will be delivered before the end of June 2015.


Images

 

#1. New Year's Day

#2. Hope

#3. Boudhanath Stupa

#4. Namaste

#5. Fun in Durbar Square

#6. Viduity

#7. Market Day

#8. View of Pashupatinath

#9. A Piece of History

#10. Khula Bazaar Goat Market

#11. Nyatapola Temple

#12. Prayer Time


The Impact

The earthquake on April 25, 2015  has devastated much of Nepal and has affected neighbouring countries. In Nepal, a country of roughly 28 million people, approximately 30, 000 have sought treatment for seizure disorders, but there are thousands of Nepalese who have epilepsy that still have not received treatment.

Nepal is a beautiful country, famous for its stunning, mountainous landscape, rich culture and generous hospitality, yet a significant percentage of people live in poverty, and most people are dependent on agriculture for a living. There are less than twenty neurologists in the whole country, and for those living with epilepsy life can be very isolating and overwhelming. Access to medication, support from specialists, and community understanding of this highly stigmatized condition is very limited to many.

Due to the earthquake, people are now running out of the medication they need and some patients are now homeless. Head injuries, lack of water and sleep, as well as high levels of stress can cause seizures, which is a constant fear for some epileptics. Many of Nepal's epileptics live in remote rural areas of the country, where the access roads have been destroyed or blocked by the earthquake and its aftershocks, making it even more difficult for them to receive the specific modern medical aid they need.

For more information about epilepsy in Nepal, please spend a moment and look at the project on my website. This will give you more insight into where your money will be going, and together, we can all help raise awareness and make a difference to those in need.

Never End Peace And Love.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is able to afford a $100 donation, so that is why I have also included a $20 donation option, because every little bit counts.

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, you can still help! Please help by:

·  sharing this IndieGoGo page,

·  sharing the link to the story on my website,

·  share information about the earthquake in Nepal,

·  sharing the link to Atlantic Photo Supply’s blog

·  and do whatever you can to help raise awareness!

If you reside in Halifax Regional Municipality, you can also stop by either of the Atlantic Photo Supply stores to see my photographs in person (202 Brownlow Ave, Unit CCF, Dartmouth and/or 1535 Dresden Row, Halifax).


Dhanyabad! (which means 'Thank you' in Nepali)


Proudly sponsored by:
