story:
Ashland High School Water Polo Club


"I owe just about every success in my life so far to joining water polo freshman year.  I know that I'd be a very different person had I not heard of the team in middle school." - Vincent Zaro Wright, AHS Senior 

"Water polo gave me a really strong group of girls that are like sisters.  I now know what it means to work hard for something." -  Kelsey Gida, AHS Alumni 

Water polo is referred to as the world's toughest sport. 

The Ashland High School Water Polo team is a club sport. Traditionally, our players have competed at the highest level in Oregon high school water polo, making the State Finals almost every year, for the past 6 years. The Boys' Team won the State Championship in 2012. Both the Boys' and Girls' Teams placed in the top 3 at the Oregon State Championships in 2013 and 2014. 

The team does not receive the typical support from the school district as many other high school teams. The players must pay all the expenses associated with competition at the Oregon High School level. In the recent past, we have been blessed with a very generous grant that along with our fundraising, allowed our club to cover about ⅔ of the total annual cost to train and compete in the Oregon High School Conference. That grant has been decreasing and next year (2016) will be the last year we receive any funding from them.  In the spring of 2015 our local university closed their pool facility, thereby eliminating the only regulation competition sized pool in our community. Due to the generosity of some of our other community pools, Jackson Wellsprings and the Ashland YMCA, we are able to provide a place for our athletes to practice 4 days a week. However, we are now required to travel out of Southern Oregon for all regulation play, including to host our “home” matches. This additional travel requirement  adds more expenses for the club, to an already high travel expense this year. Our closest conference games are in Cottage Grove, Oregon.  According to the Mail Tribune, Ashland Parks and Rec has offered Daniel Meyer pool in their off season to school and community group users. While Daniel Meyer pool meets the minimum size requirements and will allow for us to host our home matches in 2016, the proposed fees could cost the team up to $4,000.00 per month. In 2014, our club paid a total of $14,000 for all our pool requirements for 5-6 months, competition season plus spring conditioning season. We calculate that to use Daniel Meyer at their proposed rates our pool expenses potentially rise by $10,000 next year.

Helping Ashland Water Polo helps not only the club, but 30 families that belong to our community. These players have a special bond that lasts a lifetime, work incredibly hard, and need your support.  Any donation amount is accepted and greatly appreciated.
story_txt:
Ashland High School Water Polo Club

"I owe just about every success in my life so far to joining water polo freshman year.  I know that I'd be a very different person had I not heard of the team in middle school." - Vincent Zaro Wright, AHS Senior 

"Water polo gave me a really strong group of girls that are like sisters.  I now know what it means to work hard for something." -  Kelsey Gida, AHS Alumni 

Water polo is referred to as the world's toughest sport. 


The Ashland High School Water Polo team is a club sport. Traditionally, our players
have competed at the highest level in Oregon high school
water polo, making the State Finals almost every year, for the past 6
years. The Boys' Team won the State Championship in 2012. Both the Boys' and Girls' Teams placed in the
top 3 at the Oregon State Championships in 2013 and 2014. 

The team does not receive the typical support from the school district
as many other high school teams. The players must pay all the
expenses associated with competition at the Oregon High School level. In
the recent past, we have been blessed with a very generous grant that
along with our fundraising, allowed our club to cover about ⅔ of the
total annual cost to train and compete in the Oregon High School
Conference. That grant has been decreasing and next
year (2016) will be the last year we receive any funding from them.  In the spring of 2015 our local university closed their pool facility, thereby eliminating the only regulation
competition sized pool in our community. Due to the generosity of
some of our other community pools, Jackson Wellsprings and the
Ashland YMCA, we are able to provide a place for our athletes to practice
4 days a week. However, we are now required to travel out of Southern
Oregon for all regulation play, including to host our “home” matches.
This additional travel requirement  adds more expenses for the club, to an
already high travel expense this year. Our closest conference games are in Cottage Grove, Oregon.  According to the Mail Tribune, Ashland Parks and Rec has offered Daniel Meyer pool in their off season to school and community
group users. While Daniel Meyer pool meets the minimum size
requirements and will allow for us to host our home matches in 2016,
the proposed fees could cost the team up to $4,000.00 per month. In
2014, our club paid a total of $14,000 for all our pool
requirements for 5-6 months, competition season plus spring
conditioning season. We calculate that to use Daniel Meyer at their proposed rates our pool expenses potentially rise by $10,000 next year.

Helping Ashland Water Polo helps not only the club, but 30 families that belong to our community. These players have a special bond that lasts a lifetime, work incredibly hard, and need your support.  Any donation amount is accepted and greatly appreciated.

story:
Help Save Yellow Dog Village

Yellow Dog Village should be saved and preserved. This is an important historical site, a miners village with 34 houses that hold within them the histories of hundreds of families over the past 100 years.

What We Need & What You Get

 You can go back in time! When the repairs to the houses in the village have been done, you can come to stay at the village, and to study traditional crafts from the craftsmen who shall live here in the village. Come, live in the village, as they did a century ago. Try your hand using tools they used, see what it was like to live in a village a century ago. Unplug from the technology that seems to be controlling our lives, for a week, and go back to a time when a village was a true community.
After almost a year of clean-up of cutting and grazing weeds and grasses, cutting trees and shrubs back, and picking up trash, tires, etc, the village looks like a village again.

As an important historic site, Yellow Dog Village is the perfect setting to teach traditional rural crafts. To establish this educational program, we need your help to fund the necessary repairs to preserve these houses and buildings. 

The Urgency

 To preserve the village, there are repairs that are needed immediately. Five roofs need to be replaced quickly. When the village was abandoned, teenagers made it a hangout, and broke over 300 windows. Doors were smashed and broken. Your donations will all go toward repairs and preservation of the structures and facilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help us by:

  • Get the word out and tell everyone about this project, and how important it is!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • contact us at limestonevillage@hughes.net and ask about workshops we will be conducting this winter and spring!
  • Register for workshops, and go back in time here at Yellow Dog Village!

story:
"Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom" -  Aristotle


          Brief summary /A propos de moi

  • Hi! Let me introduce myself! My name is Judith Verdon, I'm from Hungary (central Europe), living currently in France for some years, with my family.  (By this fact, I also use  the French language for the description of my project).         I grew up  in one of the most beautiful countries in the world (for me), a small country, with warmly welcoming and lovely people: in Hungary. 
  • Bonjour! Permettez-moi de me présenter: je m'appelle Judith Verdon, je suis d'origine hongroise (d'Europe centrale), vivant actuellement en France depuis quelques années, avec ma famille. (C'est donc par ce fait que j'utilise également la langue française  dans la description de mon projet).           J'ai grandi dans l'un des plus beaux pays du monde (pour moi), un petit pays, avec des gens chaleureux et accueillants: en Hongrie.

  •                                      

  • At the moment, I am learning (by online courses) about self-awareness and personal development, I am "student" and my studies will finish at the end of March  2016.  My main goal is to become a coach of self-knowledge and personal development, in order to help many people in Hungary (and hungarian speaking people everywhere in the world) ... people who need to change their life in  a positive direction, by setting  reasonable life goals and also to reach them.    
  • Je suis en train de suivre des cours de formation de conscience de soi et de développement personnel. Mes études se termineront en fin de Mars 2016. Mon objectif principal est de devenir coach de connaissance de soi et  développement personnel, afin de pouvoir aider de nombreuses personnes en Hongrie (et ceux qui parlent hongrois partout dans le monde) ... les gens qui ont besoin de changer leur vie dans une direction positive, en se fixant des objectifs de vie raisonnables et aussi les atteindre, bien sûr.

           

    What is Self-Awareness? /  Qu'est-ce que la               conscience de soi?

       Self-awareness is a psychological state in which people are aware of their          traits, feelings and behaviour. Alternately, it can be defined as the                          realization of oneself as an individual entity."(Crisp & Turner, 2010) 

  • Why do I want to become a coach of self-awareness?..// Pourquoi voudrais-je devenir un coach de conscience de soi? 
  • Well, my Personal story could maybe help you to understand the reason of  my hot passion for self-knowledge and personal development: During my childhood (and even after) I have been myself  in a very depressing family situation which was for me very hard to live...(and of course, a very low level of esteem of myself!...like many people today, unfortunately ). Consequently, for many years, I was searching for different solutions in order to get out of these difficulties. Finally, there is now exactly 1 year ago, I met online a hungarian coach of motivation and personal development who helped me to change completely my life (quickly, in only 21 days!),  in a positive direction and build for me a positive and strong personality, that I have today.    
  • Eh bien, mon histoire personnelle pourrait peut-être vous aider à comprendre la raison de ma passion chaude pour la conscience de soi et le développement personnel:  Lors de mon enfance (et même après), je vivais une vie et  une situation familiale très déprimante, très angoissante, très dure  pour moi.. (et bien sûr, un très faible niveau d'estime de moi-même!.. comme beaucoup de personnes aujourd'hui, malheureusement). Par conséquent, pendant de nombreuses années, je cherchais des solutions différentes afin de pouvoir sortir de ces difficultés. Finalement, cela fait exactement 1 an que j'ai découvert par internet les enseignements d'une grande coach hongroise de motivation et de développement personnel et elle m'a personnellement aidé à changer ma vie (rapidement, en seulement 21 jours!), dans une direction positive et me bâtir une personnalité forte et positive que j'ai enfin aujourd'hui.

    Therefore,  I decided to help  people to never be so deeply  depressed, desperate and sad as I was before...I started to work hard on myself and today, I am finally happy, I'm smiling to people, I have big goals (for example : this project) and I feel better and better, every single day !         

    Par conséquent, j'ai décidé d'aider les gens pour qu'ils ne soient jamais si  profondément déprimée, triste et désespérée que moi, je l'étais à l'époque ... J'ai donc commencé à travailler très dur sur moi-même, sur ma personnalité et aujourd'hui je me trouve enfin heureuse, souriante envers les gens, j'ai de grand objectifs (par exemple: ce projet) et je me sens de mieux en mieux dans ma peau, chaque jour!

                        


     The Impact /L'impact

  • In  my home country, as everywhere in the world, people need help and guidance to find a way and get out of the negative "flow" of their life, to get out of their depression, their stress, panic, sadness, sorrow, anxiety and aimlessness. Self-awareness and self-knowledge are excellent  keys to help every person to find positive goals and  to build a strong, positive and "healthy" character. 
  • Dans mon pays d'origine, comme partout dans le monde, les gens ont besoin d'aide et des conseils pour trouver un chemin pour sortir d'un «flux» négative de leur vie,  sortir de leur dépression, leur stress, leur panique, leur tristesse, leur chagrin, leur anxiété et désoeuvrement. La conscience de soi et la motivation personnelle sont d' excellents clés pour aider des personnes à se trouver des buts positifs et de se construire une personnalité forte, positive et "saine".                        

                          

                                     "Watch your thoughts, they become words.

                                      Watch your words, they become actions.

                                      Watch your actions, they become habits.

                                      Watch your habits, they become your character.

                                      Watch your character, it becomes your destiny."

                                      (Frank Outlaw)  

  • The online courses , followed by a 21 day-program : the methods I am  learning now and  I'll  teach later, (using internet tools: web conference room, skype, ..)  are mainly inspired by the following bibliographies (some of them): 
  • Les cours en ligne, suivis d'un programme de 21 jours : les méthodes que je suis en train d'apprendre et que j'enseignerai plus tard (en utilisant des outils Internet: salle de conférence web, Skype, etc..) , sont principalement inspirés par les bibliographies suivantes (en voici quelques une):
  • dr. Joseph Murphy's spiritual books: The Power of your Subconscious Mind, Selvarajan Yesudian: Yoga and Health (hatha yoga), Gertrud Hirschi: Mudras: Yoga in Your Hands, Noah St. John: The Affirmations System, Dale Carnegie's success books, Carl Gustav Jung's, Eckhart Tolle's works and teachings...  (and many more)

       


     Challenge / Le défi

  • It's been a long time,  I am interested in psychology, personal development and self-knowledge...  Recently, I decided to be "useful" and help  others to be able to change their life by thinking in another way.   
  • Cela fait  longtemps que je m'intéresse à la psychologie, au développement personnel et à la connaissance de soi ... Récemment, j'ai décidé d'être «utile» et d'aider les autres à pouvoir changer leur vie, en pensant d'une manière différente.
  • My challenge :     if, with your help,  this fundraiser is successful,  I can become a self-awareness and personal motivation trainer and start my online trainings by April 2016. Follow my progression!   
  • Mon défi :    si, grâce à votre aide précieuse, cette collecte de fonds réussit bien, je pourrai devenir formatrice de connaissance de soi et de motivation personnelle pour pouvoir lancer mes formations en ligne d'ici Avril 2016. Suivez mon parcours!
          "We make a living by what we GET, but we  make a life by what we                                                                     GIVE." (Winston Churchill)

   What I need for this project ? How your donation        could help? //

   Comment votre don pourrait aider?  

   Voici ce dont  j'ai besoin pour ce projet...

   Although, this is the first time in my life to  ask for donations, your precious          contributions could help me to achieve my goal and start my online coaching. 
   Bien que ce soit pour la toute première fois de ma vie que je demande des            dons, vos précieuses contributions me permettraient de réaliser mon objectif et      lancer mes coachings en ligne: 
   All what I want is  just a contribution of your part (an amount of € 1.500),            which represents a part of my planned expenses: €  3.805 :  /  Ce que je                   souhaite, c'est juste une contribution de votre part (soit un montant                             de € 1.500) , laquelle représente une partie de mes frais totaux prévus, soit                €  3.800:
  •  the cost of my self-awarness, self-developpement studies / les frais de mes études de conscience de soi et motivation personnelle:               €  1.360
  • the costs of my final exams + getting a licence agreement / les frais de mon examen final en mars, avec l'obtention d'un contrat de licence: €     220
  •  fees for 2 compulsory practical trainings in 2016 / les coûts de 2 formations  continues obligatiores par an:                                                               €    450
  • IT tools and web development costs for  my future online trainings and  videoconferencing  /  Outils informatiques, coûts de développement web pour mes futures formations et visios en ligne (laptop, webcam, webhosting (weebly PRO), own domain name (.com) , different webdesign tools) :      €  1.550 
  • materials, books, notes related to my studies (approximately) /                  matériaux, livres, notes en rapport avec mes études                      €     220
    Total amount of my costs (approximately) /  Le montant total de mes frais                 (prévu environ) :                                                                                                   €   3.800

     What I have to offer you? /Qu'ai-je à vous offrir?

  • First of all, a BIG Thanks for all your donations ! Without your help, this project would not have been  realized! I'm so grateful! A personalized virtual thank you card will be sent to you! // Tout d'abord, un grand Merci pour tous vos dons! Sans votre aide, ce projet n'aurait pas se réaliser! Je vous suis reconnaissante: une carte postale virtuelle personnalisée de remerciement   vous sera envoyée de ma part!
  • Your name on my own  website, with personal thank you message //               votre nom sur mon propre site web avec message de remerciement personnel
  • Your Name here on this Campaigne site // votre nom ici sur le site  Indiegogo 
  • Twitter Shout out and Follow / message de remerciement+  suivi sur Twitter
  • Facebook, Linkedin Shout Out // message de remerciement sur FB et Linkedin
  • Your name as VIP member in the Exclusive Self-Awareness Club on my own website  /  Votre nom en tant que membre VIP dans le Club  Exclusif de  conscience de soi sur mon propre site web
  • Short Skype conversation, giving answers to your question / Conversation courte sur Skype, je réponds à toutes vos questions.
  • Please note: even if I do not completely would reach my goal, all collected funds, all your precious contributions will be fully paid for the development of my Self-Awareness project: studies , costs , ID tools, web development, etc!  
  • Á noter: même si je n'arrive pas à mon but (atteindre complètement mon objectif) tous les fonds recueillis, toutes vos contributions précieuses seront entièrement versées pour le développement de mon projet de conscience de soi: frais d'études, coûts ,  outils informatiques, développement web (détaillés plus haut), etc...
     My "No Risk" Guarantee / Ma garantie pour vous:
     REFUND/ REMBOURSEMENT: I can offer you a               refund of your donation, if you have changed your             mind and/or if you have not received the perk                     you have choosen! / Je peux vous offrir une garantie       de remboursement, si vous a  changé d'avis et/ou si       vous n'avez pas reçu la contrepartie que vous aviez         choisie! Vous ne risquez rien!
     Other ways to help /D'autres façons d'aider

        If you like my project, but you have not much money  to support it (I can         understand it),  you could still  help me: If you can find the time to add this page link to your Twitter, Instagram and/or Facebook, I might reach a lot of new visitors for my  project.  I am grateful to you who have been there to support it and I am honored to have you on board ! Thanks so much for your help! /Si vous aimez mon projet, mais vous avez pas beaucoup d'argent pour le soutenir (je peux le comprendre), vous pouvez tout de même m'aider. Si vous pouviez trouver le temps d'ajouter cette page à votre Twitter, Instagram et / ou Facebook, je pourrais atteindre un plus grand nombre de nouveaux visiteurs pour ce projet. Je vous suis reconnaissante d'avoir été là pour le soutenir! Je suis honorée de vous avoir à bord!    Merci beaucoup pour votre aide!

   Join the success of this project!  / Participez à la réussite de ce projet!->

    Please like my page on Facebook/ Vous pouvez aimer ma page sur FB:

     https://www.facebook.com/selfawarenessproject

     Follow me on Twitter/ Suivez-moi sur:   https://twitter.com/SelfAwarenessHU

      LinkedIn /  Ma page LinkedIn: 

       https://www.linkedin.com/in/judith-verdon-61097910a

  • Thanks also for advertising around this project! /  Merci également pour faire de la publicité autour de ce projet!
  • Remember: you can also use Indiegogo sharing tools !/  Pensez à utiliser également les outils de partage d'IndieGoGo!
        And Last, but NOT Least, I Would Like to Personally Thank :
        Et finalement, mais pas moins important, je tiens à remercier                                   personnellement:
-

                                      Watch your actions, they become habits.
                                      Watch your habits, they become your character.
                                      Watch your character, it becomes your destiny."
                                      (Frank Outlaw)  



The online courses , followed by a 21 day-program : the methods I am  learning now and  I'll  teach later, (using internet tools: web conference room, skype, ..)  are mainly inspired by the following bibliographies (some of them): 

Les cours en ligne, suivis d'un programme de 21 jours : les méthodes que je suis en train d'apprendre et que j'enseignerai plus tard (en utilisant des outils Internet: salle de conférence web, Skype, etc..) , sont principalement inspirés par les bibliographies suivantes (en voici quelques une):



dr. Joseph Murphy's spiritual books: The Power of your Subconscious Mind, Selvarajan Yesudian: Yoga and Health (hatha yoga), Gertrud Hirschi: Mudras: Yoga in Your Hands, Noah St. John: The Affirmations System, Dale Carnegie's success books, Carl Gustav Jung's, Eckhart Tolle's works and teachings...  (and many more)



       



     Challenge / Le défi

It's been a long time,  I am interested in psychology, personal development and self-knowledge...  Recently, I decided to be "useful" and help  others to be able to change their life by thinking in another way.   

Cela fait  longtemps que je m'intéresse à la psychologie, au développement personnel et à la connaissance de soi ... Récemment, j'ai décidé d'être «utile» et d'aider les autres à pouvoir changer leur vie, en pensant d'une manière différente.


My challenge :     if, with your help,  this fundraiser is successful,  I can become a self-awareness and personal motivation trainer and start my online trainings by April 2016. Follow my progression!   

Mon défi :    si, grâce à votre aide précieuse, cette collecte de fonds réussit bien, je pourrai devenir formatrice de connaissance de soi et de motivation personnelle pour pouvoir lancer mes formations en ligne d'ici Avril 2016. Suivez mon parcours!


          "We make a living by what we GET, but we  make a life by what we                                                                     GIVE." (Winston Churchill)


   What I need for this project ? How your donation        could help? //
   Comment votre don pourrait aider?  
   Voici ce dont  j'ai besoin pour ce projet...
   Although, this is the first time in my life to  ask for donations, your precious          contributions could help me to achieve my goal and start my online coaching. 

   Bien que ce soit pour la toute première fois de ma vie que je demande des            dons, vos précieuses contributions me permettraient de réaliser mon objectif et      lancer mes coachings en ligne: 


   All what I want is  just a contribution of your part (an amount of € 1.500),            which represents a part of my planned expenses: €  3.805 :  /  Ce que je                   souhaite, c'est juste une contribution de votre part (soit un montant                             de € 1.500) , laquelle représente une partie de mes frais totaux prévus, soit                €  3.800:

 the cost of my self-awarness, self-developpement studies / les frais de mes études de conscience de soi et motivation personnelle:               €  1.360
the costs of my final exams + getting a licence agreement / les frais de mon examen final en mars, avec l'obtention d'un contrat de licence: €     220
 fees for 2 compulsory practical trainings in 2016 / les coûts de 2 formations  continues obligatiores par an:                                                               €    450
IT tools and web development costs for  my future online trainings and  videoconferencing  /  Outils informatiques, coûts de développement web pour mes futures formations et visios en ligne (laptop, webcam, webhosting (weebly PRO), own domain name (.com) , different webdesign tools) :      €  1.550 
materials, books, notes related to my studies (approximately) /                  matériaux, livres, notes en rapport avec mes études                      €     220
    Total amount of my costs (approximately) /  Le montant total de mes frais                 (prévu environ) :                                                                                                   €   3.800




     What I have to offer you? /Qu'ai-je à vous offrir?


First of all, a BIG Thanks for all your donations ! Without your help, this project would not have been  realized! I'm so grateful! A personalized virtual thank you card will be sent to you! // Tout d'abord, un grand Merci pour tous vos dons! Sans votre aide, ce projet n'aurait pas se réaliser! Je vous suis reconnaissante: une carte postale virtuelle personnalisée de remerciement   vous sera envoyée de ma part!
Your name on my own  website, with personal thank you message //               votre nom sur mon propre site web avec message de remerciement personnel
Your Name here on this Campaigne site // votre nom ici sur le site  Indiegogo 
Twitter Shout out and Follow / message de remerciement+  suivi sur Twitter
Facebook, Linkedin Shout Out // message de remerciement sur FB et Linkedin

Your name as VIP member in the Exclusive Self-Awareness Club on my own website  /  Votre nom en tant que membre VIP dans le Club  Exclusif de  conscience de soi sur mon propre site web

Short Skype conversation, giving answers to your question / Conversation courte sur Skype, je réponds à toutes vos questions.

Please note: even if I do not completely would reach my goal, all collected funds, all your precious contributions will be fully paid for the development of my Self-Awareness project: studies , costs , ID tools, web development, etc!  


Á noter: même si je n'arrive pas à mon but (atteindre complètement mon objectif) tous les fonds recueillis, toutes vos contributions précieuses seront entièrement versées pour le développement de mon projet de conscience de soi: frais d'études, coûts ,  outils informatiques, développement web (détaillés plus haut), etc...




     My "No Risk" Guarantee / Ma garantie pour vous:


     REFUND/ REMBOURSEMENT: I can offer you a               refund of your donation, if you have changed your             mind and/or if you have not received the perk                     you have choosen! / Je peux vous offrir une garantie       de remboursement, si vous a  changé d'avis et/ou si       vous n'avez pas reçu la contrepartie que vous aviez         choisie! Vous ne risquez rien!


     Other ways to help /D'autres façons d'aider


        If you like my project, but you have not much money  to support it (I can         understand it),  you could still  help me: If you can find the time to add this page link to your Twitter, Instagram and/or Facebook, I might reach a lot of new visitors for my  project.  I am grateful to you who have been there to support it and I am honored to have you on board ! Thanks so much for your help! /Si vous aimez mon projet, mais vous avez pas beaucoup d'argent pour le soutenir (je peux le comprendre), vous pouvez tout de même m'aider. Si vous pouviez trouver le temps d'ajouter cette page à votre Twitter, Instagram et / ou Facebook, je pourrais atteindre un plus grand nombre de nouveaux visiteurs pour ce projet. Je vous suis reconnaissante d'avoir été là pour le soutenir! Je suis honorée de vous avoir à bord!    Merci beaucoup pour votre aide!
   Join the success of this project!  / Participez à la réussite de ce projet!->
    Please like my page on Facebook/ Vous pouvez aimer ma page sur FB:
     https://www.facebook.com/selfawarenessproject
     Follow me on Twitter/ Suivez-moi sur:   https://twitter.com/SelfAwarenessHU
      LinkedIn /  Ma page LinkedIn: 
       https://www.linkedin.com/in/judith-verdon-61097910a



Thanks also for advertising around this project! /  Merci également pour faire de la publicité autour de ce projet!
Remember: you can also use Indiegogo sharing tools !/  Pensez à utiliser également les outils de partage d'IndieGoGo!

        And Last, but NOT Least, I Would Like to Personally Thank :
        Et finalement, mais pas moins important, je tiens à remercier                                   personnellement:
-

story:
Short Summary

I am the Co-founder and Director of La Puerta Abierta Learning Center in Santiago Atitlan, Guatemala.  Recognizing the importance of having access to books, literature and creative teaching practices for  children and teens, I began La Puerta Abierta in 2007 with retired teacher, Karen Hedrick and a team of dedicated local teachers.

We’ve grown up over the past eight years.  Our staff of one dedicated librarian has evolved into a team of 8 talented and innovative teachers who continue to establish our center.  La Puerta Abierta is now housed in a simple yet aesthetic two room building with large windows and ample sunlight on the outskirts of town.  We have an outdoor play garden which welcomes children to jump, run and imagine.  We visit eight schools in the Traveling Library program, accommodate two groups of young children in our Mommy and Me classes on weekends, receive a group of 35 teen scholarship students on Sundays for study hours, host a teen reading circle  and offer preschool, kindergarten, and 1st grade classes at our center.

I've dreamed of creating educational exchanges for our educators at La Puerta Abierta to share culture and knowledge with educational institutions around the world.  This year, Juanita will be our first teacher to travel abroad.  She will spend 6 weeks in Boston collaborating with educators at Pine Village Spanish Emersion Preschool and will have the opportunity to visit a variety of early education centers between Boston and New York.  

About Juanita...

If I close my eyes and squeeze them tight, I can see Juanita as I met her when I first arrived in Santiago Atitlán, Guatemala in 2004. I was a Peace Corps volunteer, working as an environmental education teacher in rural schools and Juanita was a 5th grader in my class. She was one of two female students amongst a sea of male classmates, and while she was the smallest student in her group, she made the most memorable impression on me. Juanita shimmered with confidence, kindness and diplomacy.

 After she graduated from elementary school, my life continued to intertwine with Juanita’s. In fact, she “grew up” with La Puerta Abierta. We opened our library and learning center in 2006 just as she graduated from elementary school. She was eager to participate in her community and was hungry to read and learn more about the world beyond the boundaries of Santiago Atitlan. She was one of our first local volunteers at our center and would dedicate a few hours every week to organizing books in our library collection, preparing materials for our story hours and designing our bulletin boards.

As the years passed, Juanita became increasingly busy with high-school projects, extra curricular activities and family commitments (Juanita is the oldest of 4 sisters.) Even when her days felt full, Juanita would find small windows of time to collaborate at La Puerta Abierta.

Five years ago La Puerta Abierta expanded to incorporate early childhood education classes into our program. The development of our preschool coincided with Juanita’s graduation from teaching school in Santiago Atitlan. As we interviewed Juanita for a position as a teacher at our center, she shined with the same confidence, intelligence and creativity that I detected in her years prior. After “growing up” in our center, she was an ideal match for our school.

Juanita has dedicated the past five years to working with children at La Puerta Abierta. She’s had experience teaching preschool, kindergarten, first grade, early stimulation, and managing our traveling library.

Today, Juanita is the Co-Director at La Puerta Abierta and helps to ensure that our programs are strong, stable and smooth. She greets parents in the the morning with warm smiles, helps our staff develop curriculum, organizes field trips, evaluates students, and welcomes volunteers to our center. In fact, I’m quite certain that we’ve come full circle and that I’ve nearly worked my way out of a job…a satisfying revelation for those of us in the field of development.




Juanita continues to dream big. In addition to working at La Puerta Abierta, she is studying psychology at the university and hopes to develop community programs that benefit children in the future.

As I reflect on Juanita’s experience, I realize that La Puerta Abierta is much more than a learning center for children. We are also a training center for teachers, providing a space to cultivate young educators. And I couldn’t be more proud that Juanita is now training our new teachers at La Puerta Abierta.

Contributors will play a vital role in Juanita's professional development as well as supporting global learning as we intend to create exchanges between teachers, classrooms and students.  

We are kindly soliciting $4,800 to cover Juanita's travel, visa and living expenses while in the United States.  Any donations over $50 will receive a package of 5 hand-crafted one of a kind finger puppets designed and created by the mothers of La Puerta Abierta.  

Gracias!  Merci! Maltiox! Thank you!

story:
Who We Are

Accessible Academics is an agency that advocates and provides life, academic, and job skill support to people with special needs transitioning from high school, through college, to independence. 

Anne Showers, Ed.M., coach and certified teacher,  recognized an immediate need for academic and life skills support for several college students who would be left on their own.  To support those students, Anne formed Accessible Academics, LLC in January 2015.  Her goal is for Accessible Academics to become a non-profit organization so that more students will be served.  

Who We Serve

Young adults, ages 18-25, who are pursuing college or vocational training.  Our students may have Autism, ADHD,  Learning Disability, Traumatic Brain Injury,  Anxiety Disorder, or other neuro-biological differences. 

What We Need 

Legal and filing fees for non-profit formation is expensive.  We need $3000 to cover those fees so that Accessible Academics can become a non-profit.  

  • All funds up to $3000 will go towards filing fees
  • Any funds beyond $3000 will go towards providing free or reduced-cost programming for current and future students

What We Do

We provide our students: 

Academic Support: Time management, organization, self-advocacy, study skills, note-taking skills, and executive functioning support. 

Life Skills Support:  Budgeting and banking, household cleanliness, management of medical appointments and prescriptions, groceries and cooking.

 Job Support: Location of part-time employment or internship opportunities for students, job coaching on site, connection with local vocational rehabilitation offices for post-graduation employment.

Social Support:  Our students are part of a community. They participate in group study hall and organized activities at the college housing complex, Collegiate Village.  They have the opportunity to be matched with a peer mentor who can help them navigate the social scene at Collegiate Village and make new friend.

Risks & Challenges

This campaign is to help us raise the necessary funds to become a non-profit.  So because we are not yet a non-profit, your donations are not (yet) tax-ductible.  When we receive non-profit status, we will notify you so that you can then claim your donation on your tax return.  There is a risk that we may not achieve non-profit status. However, we will make any appeals necessary. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and family!  

Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter!

story:
I was adopted from Yekaterinburg Russia in 1996, and came to the United States at the age of three and a half. I have always wanted to learn more about my past, as I feel it is a very important part of one's growth and future life.

I made the decision a couple of months ago after I graduated college. I still have memories from my past, especially those of the orphanage I was in. I will be traveling with a special program that will take care of all the details. I am also in the process of facilitating a birth family search.

I will be traveling with my mother in the summer of 2016. This trip will help me learn about where I came from (birth place, and about my birth family) and perhaps why the circumstances led me to be put up for adoption. Although it is an emotional roller coaster, in the long run it will provide a real strong sense of re-connection.

The program will cost $8,000 USD total for my mother and I, including our air fair. The program then provides meals, total travel when in Russia, room and board, and a full time translator for 2 weeks.

My intention throughout this journey is to give back to the world in a way that allows for other adoptees to go back to their birth places. I will provide free coaching to others going through the same things I did, and I will help them with the process if they feel they need support.
I will also make a donation to orphanages (mine in Russia), as well as some here in the United States.

There may be many obstacles along the way such as financial and emotional, yet I have always been determined and compassionate throughout my life, and I always persevere.

Below, is my last blog post which I believe truly resounds with what this trip has become and the transformation it has made... 


" I have been wanting to write this blog for a while now, but needed to first process what has happened in the past month. As we all know, sometimes difficult news to bare needs to be protected at first before sharing with others for your own healing.

As most of you know, I have been in the midst of working with someone who faciliated the search for my birth family. This process has not been easy, and has had many ups and downs. Yet, I find it appropriate now to share with everyone what I have learned and found out.

On November 7th the search officially started in Yekaterinburg Russia. I was nervous and excited all at the same time and for days waited for the searcher to tell me what he found. My understanding was that the search itself would only take a couple of days in Yekaterinburg. For about two weeks I wasn’t hearing anything. Finally, on a Saturday morning the email came.

The search revealed that two weeks before he arrived, my birth mother passed away (October 30th). When I was reading this, I didn’t feel a lot of emotion, but was more shocked and couldn’t believe this. How strange and auspicious that she died so soon before he arrived. Then he pursues to tell me that most of the people he talked to said she never had family visit her and she never spoke about her family. Therefore, there was nobody stepping up and claiming responsibility for the funeral arrangements or the body for that fact. He gave me a couple of options. One, I could not do anything and let the State take care of it and she would be buried in some area where other unknown people are and given a number. The other option, I could claim responsibility and arrange the burial/cremation and do what I wanted in terms of her funeral.

Of course, I had to process this, but I did decide I wanted to take responsibility. I felt in my heart that it was the right thing to do, as well as some kind of healing process for me to be able to say that I buried my birth mother. I was the one that took care of her in that way.

As of right now, we don’t know anything about a birth father, and or any other siblings (on record). Because my birth mother was so incredibly poor, the tracking of her life was not easy to attain and or much further information. The search revealed that I was most probably born in a small village on a farm about 100 miles outside of Yekaterinburg, called Zaykovo. From there, I traveled to another town called Irbit and stayed in an orphanage for some months. Then finally went to Yekaterinburg to the last orphanage. Yet, this story doesn’t seem quite right because when the searcher traveled to Yekaterinburg and found neighbors and friends who knew my birth mother, two nice women said they have actually met me. They were shown my picture, and they read a letter that I wrote to my birth family. One of the women knew my mother because she worked with her at a shoe factory, and the other woman was the owner of the apartment complex that my mother had a room in. Luckily, they are very nice and want to meet me when I come in the summer. In addition, Larisa was kind enough to to hold any valuable things and or pictures that my mother had, and she helped with much of the funeral logistics on that side with the searcher. Just a couple of days ago, my birth mother was finally cremated and the urn is being held for me until I get there.

Since I have learned more, it has been extremely emotionally difficult. Disappointment, anger, sadness, etc. You could never imagine and predict what you would feel. I certainly didn’t. And I certainly had no clue that this story would turn out like this. Yet, I believe everything happens for a reason, and I know this is how everything was meant to be. Now, more than ever I feel like this trip back is really about closure for myself, as well as for her. In addition, I am starting to feel that my fundraising is not just for me. I will give a percentage to the Gift of Identity Fund which is part of the program I am going with that awards grants to those going on the trip based on family income. I applied to this and did not receive the award, which made me realize that there are families in the exact same position as us. Wanting to do this search and trip, yet needing help for sure. Therefore, anything that I raise, some of that will go to the Gift of Identity, as well as another portion will be donated to the orphanage I was in and will be named after my birth mother (Olga Nikolayevna Safranova)."

" I have been wanting to write this blog for a while now, but needed to first process what has happened in the past month. As we all know, sometimes difficult news to bare needs to be protected at first before sharing with others for your own healing.

As most of you know, I have been in the midst of working with someone who faciliated the search for my birth family. This process has not been easy, and has had many ups and downs. Yet, I find it appropriate now to share with everyone what I have learned and found out.
On November 7th the search officially started in Yekaterinburg Russia. I was nervous and excited all at the same time and for days waited for the searcher to tell me what he found. My understanding was that the search itself would only take a couple of days in Yekaterinburg. For about two weeks I wasn’t hearing anything. Finally, on a Saturday morning the email came.
The search revealed that two weeks before he arrived, my birth mother passed away (October 30th). When I was reading this, I didn’t feel a lot of emotion, but was more shocked and couldn’t believe this. How strange and auspicious that she died so soon before he arrived. Then he pursues to tell me that most of the people he talked to said she never had family visit her and she never spoke about her family. Therefore, there was nobody stepping up and claiming responsibility for the funeral arrangements or the body for that fact. He gave me a couple of options. One, I could not do anything and let the State take care of it and she would be buried in some area where other unknown people are and given a number. The other option, I could claim responsibility and arrange the burial/cremation and do what I wanted in terms of her funeral.
Of course, I had to process this, but I did decide I wanted to take responsibility. I felt in my heart that it was the right thing to do, as well as some kind of healing process for me to be able to say that I buried my birth mother. I was the one that took care of her in that way.
As of right now, we don’t know anything about a birth father, and or any other siblings (on record). Because my birth mother was so incredibly poor, the tracking of her life was not easy to attain and or much further information. The search revealed that I was most probably born in a small village on a farm about 100 miles outside of Yekaterinburg, called Zaykovo. From there, I traveled to another town called Irbit and stayed in an orphanage for some months. Then finally went to Yekaterinburg to the last orphanage. Yet, this story doesn’t seem quite right because when the searcher traveled to Yekaterinburg and found neighbors and friends who knew my birth mother, two nice women said they have actually met me. They were shown my picture, and they read a letter that I wrote to my birth family. One of the women knew my mother because she worked with her at a shoe factory, and the other woman was the owner of the apartment complex that my mother had a room in. Luckily, they are very nice and want to meet me when I come in the summer. In addition, Larisa was kind enough to to hold any valuable things and or pictures that my mother had, and she helped with much of the funeral logistics on that side with the searcher. Just a couple of days ago, my birth mother was finally cremated and the urn is being held for me until I get there.
Since I have learned more, it has been extremely emotionally difficult. Disappointment, anger, sadness, etc. You could never imagine and predict what you would feel. I certainly didn’t. And I certainly had no clue that this story would turn out like this. Yet, I believe everything happens for a reason, and I know this is how everything was meant to be. Now, more than ever I feel like this trip back is really about closure for myself, as well as for her. In addition, I am starting to feel that my fundraising is not just for me. I will give a percentage to the Gift of Identity Fund which is part of the program I am going with that awards grants to those going on the trip based on family income. I applied to this and did not receive the award, which made me realize that there are families in the exact same position as us. Wanting to do this search and trip, yet needing help for sure. Therefore, anything that I raise, some of that will go to the Gift of Identity, as well as another portion will be donated to the orphanage I was in and will be named after my birth mother (Olga Nikolayevna Safranova)."

story:
Hey everyone! I'm Yi and I'm a passionate young entrepreneur. I just got admitted to the Stanford Ignite Program to improve my skills as an entrepreneur. I still can't quite believe it, but I got selected to join 34 other industry leaders to work on pitching, developing, and commercializing startup ideas. https://www.gsb.stanford.edu/programs/stanford-...

Unfortunately, the tuition amounts to a grand total of $14,500 and that’s where I need help. I live in New York City and earn a startup wage, while my husband is still in school accumulating student loans. After some people suggested they'd like to help out, I created this Indiegogo campaign so I can offer my custom made rewards in exchange for monetary contributions (but I also welcome non-monetary support, which will be reciprocated with hugs, friendship and gratefulness).

Any contribution helps, seriously. I am already so grateful to have what I have today, but if anyone wants to help a little more, then my gratitude will never end. Thank you so much!

 P.S.: If you'd like multiple perks, just donate the total amount :)

story:
Update: I am at the summit now thanks to all that have contributed, particularly David who bought me a return ticket so I could for sure attend and make it home. The amount of support, financially and otherwise, has been amazing as is the program. For the first time, in a long time, I feel like I'm getting somewhere. A quote for the course "vulnerability- to allow the winds of life to blow over your soul". We are about half way to the goal, so I can continue taking steps toward my dreams and this education is simply the first step!

As a young child I was always told, you must either choose to work with your mind or do work with your hands. Growing up, I nurtured both sides and I found myself falling into a pattern of trying one side, finding something to be missing, only to switch and still be dissatisfied. In the physical realm, I have found I have a talent for helping people by teaching dance and through it expressiveness and empowerment. I learned that I wanted to be the dancer who could express and communicate their ideas the best. Better yet, I wanted to teach expressiveness and empowerment through the use of movement. In the past two years, I have been doing this through leading my student dance group and teaching many of my fellow college students the power and beauty of relating to others through dance and to have the confidence to approach learning something through playfulness and collaboration. I desire to take this talent to the next level to be able to empower even more dancers through helping them to connect to the emotional and relational aspects of partner connection.

About two years ago, I fell ill. There was a lot of pain and visits to the ER and doctors as we tried to figure out what was going on. It was determined I needed to have surgery and when I emerged, I found that I was now missing an ovary and had an incurable disease, endometriosis.

I kept working and pursuing my dreams anyway. I worked hard, pushing out of my comfort zone and juggling more doctor appointments and self care as my condition worsened, my class schedule, a job search, my own improvement as a dancer, researching scene building, research on partner dance communication, and my student’s education of dance and leadership. As things worsened I grew angry and bitter toward the condition, as it was stopping me from not only expressing myself but from teaching self expression to others. Bed ridden, my dreams seemed to be slipping through my fingers as I had to let go of what I wanted to do to focus on health. After a few months of fluctuating pain, and being jobless, I’ve realized that I needed to re-define my approach to working, dance and helping people. I believe I can still offer my gifts to the world, but I must find different ways to fit them in my life.

But this goal will take time and money. Through attending the ThrivingChangemakerSummit I’m being offered a way to still helping people in a less physical way and allows me to do good work while ill. By attending not only will I receive tools to increase my ability to teach dance but I can start training as a Life Coach. This would give me the training to do what I already do informally, helping people to be their best versions of themselves and to achieve their goals, on a much larger scale. Doing so would also give me financial stability while learning more about the dance industry and when considering attending grad school for dance movement therapy regardless of health.

With the money raised I plan to specifically put it towards these uses:

The Thriving Changemaker Summit (For leadership development and some life coach training)

The plane ticket to The TCS

BlueSHOUT/ other dance events 

Miscellaneous things that contribute to my education in dance or life coaching or life in general ( dance shoes, doctors appointment, medication, long neglected basic necessities)

story:
Hi Friends,

STC Branch primary school located in my native village Kadayam, is in dire need of funds for rebuilding. School has 5 classrooms in total and roof of 3 has been broken down. This is the ONLY Primary School in Therku Kadayam Village. It was established in the year 1941. This school has educated the people in Kadayam and nearby villages for nearly two generation including my aunt, me, my sister and my cousins.

It's a Tamil Medium - Co-educational school with a current strength of 150 students. School has its own (private) building but it requires of lot of repairs to meet the State Standards. State officials have declared that, school license will be cancelled if the roof is not rebuilt this summer. Estimated cost of rebuilding is Rs.20 Lakhs. Since it is difficult to raise such a huge amount by just the Local Kadayam people who are completely dependent on this school for their kid’s education, I request you to help my school in whatever way possible. Please remember no amount is little!!
 
Please see the attached photos which shows the broken roof and kids of all 5 grades collected under the only sustaining building which also has temporary roof.

story:
Hi Friends! 

My name is Kecia Lee and I want to thank you so much for taking the time to visit my Indiegogo page!  I need your help to get me into the renowned Thai Yoga Massage program lead by master Deon De Wet!  I’m a full-time yoga instructor and my desire has always been to help facilitate healing in others.  As you may have guessed, the living of a yoga-instructor is very humble. We do it for the LOVE of it.  So, I’m calling on the support of others who believe in my work to help me pay my tuition to Deon’s program.  Below I’ve shared a little about my vision, WHO I am, and WHY my work will benefit those in need!  I hope that you find my journey inspirational enough to help me see my dream through!  Thanks again for your consideration! 

Healing & Joy To You,

Kecia

My GRAND VISION to bring yoga therapy to athletes:

Every idea starts with a DREAM, right?  I believe in dreaming big, audaciously big!  My big audacious goal is to work with collegiate and pro-athletes.  Why?  Having been a former competitive soccer player myself, I understand the athlete’s need for traditional yoga and Thai yoga massage.  I remember all too well how the feeling of tense muscles, heavy with lactic acid made feel like I was dragging cinder blocks with each sprint.  I can still remember balled-up hamstrings and I.T. bands so taunt that a single quick change in direction could have easily snapped my knee on more than one occasion.  I remember injury.  There rarely was a player that could go through an entire season injury-free.  Unheard of.  So I started to think, “What if I could help collegiate athletes to become faster, stronger, more agile, and all around healthier in their bodies?  Why stop there?  What if I could help pro athletes earn an edge against competitors who are equally skilled”?  Let’s face it, at the pro level the variance in skill level reduces dramatically.  As a pro, you are up against the best of the best and it takes a lot of talent and training to stand out.  Even more, in the case of both the collegiate and the pro player, his or her body is an ASSET.  Careers end abruptly every day due to injury.  I know how hard athletes train, and losing opportunity or financial security due to injury is just heart breaking.  Nobody wants to see the blood, sweat, and tears of a competitor’s dedication and sacrifice flushed down the drain to an injury that could have been prevented. 

If I sound passionate, it’s because I am!  I have immense respect for the commitment and drive of competitive sports players.  It takes an exceptional human being to make it to D1 sports or to go pro.  Selfishly, I want to be surrounded by those exceptional people.  We as individuals become our best when we surround ourselves with the best!  I can think of nothing more gratifying, more inspiring, or more exciting than a life designed to helping the world’s best athletes achieve peak performance and long-lasting careers through Thai yoga massage therapy.

                                

Some questions you may be asking yourself….  

Who is this girl anyway?

Kecia Lee is a San Diego based yoga teacher, health nut, and beach bum.  In the yoga studio, her infectious smile, warmth, and passion allow her to connect deeply with and inspire her students.  An avid food lover and wellness coach, she is also passionate about sharing healthy, whole, mouth-watering recipes.  Her mission is to help others live with vitality and unlock their most joyful expression of life.

Kecia is a former competitive club soccer player, top national recruit, and scholarship player for the University of Minnesota.  She spent 8 years training with and competing with the Olympic Development Program and Women’s Region II Team.  After years performing maniacal fitness regimens Kecia began using yoga as a way to treat old injuries and undo years of wear and tear to her body.  After experiencing the benefits of yoga which seemed to “turn back time” on her body, she was inspired to share that healing through teaching.  

                        

What exactly is Thai Yoga Massage therapy?

Thai Yoga Massage is a unique healing system that blends yoga and traditional Thai bodywork.  Integrating many techniques and practices, it is a complete, balanced and deeply therapeutic system of healing.  Practioners guide clients through a series of flowing movements, gentle twists, and deep stretches while applying rhythmic massage along the body’s energy lines & pressure points.  Together these actions result in a full body treatment that relieves muscular tension, pain, and injury.  Thai Yoga Therapy also improves flexibility, range of motion, circulation, relaxation and mental clarity.

                      

Why athletes?

If you are or once were a serious athlete like Kecia and you are reading this, you know that athletes rarely stretch and hardly ever receive bodywork.  In fact, most athletes LOATHE stretching, which ultimately prolongs their recovery after high-intensity workouts and increases their risk to pain and injury.  Even more, in order to reach maximal gains in physical training and competition, it is important that athletes achieve full range of motion within body movements.  If muscles are overly stiff, shortened or restricted, range of motion declines and athletes cannot effectively recruit smaller muscle groups/muscle fibers to complete a physical action.  The moral of the story is:  INCREASED RANGE OF MOTION = MORE MUSCLE FIBERS RECRUITED TO COMPLETE AN ACTION = A STRONGER, FASTER, HEALTHIER AHLETE.  In sports, agility and efficiency reign king.  Thai yoga therapy gives sports players the competitive edge they need to be the best.

                                            

How does it work?  Can you be more specific?

Thai yoga massage increases range of motion and enhances athletic performance through both direct and indirect myofacial release.  Myo-HUH? Myofacial release is designed to increase the elasticity of the body’s fascia.  What the HECK is fascia?  Fascia is a thin, sticky webbed-like sheath that encases muscles, bones, organs, nerves, vessels, and so on.  Fascia is by nature very elastic.  However, repetitive use of certain muscles groups, muscle trauma through sports training, and injury can cause fascia to harden, shorten, or scar.  When this happens, muscles become restricted and range of motion is decreased.  Boooo!  Yeah, we don’t want that.  We want supple, smooth fascia that allows muscles to contract, lengthen, and move with freedom. 

Where is my money going?

Your donation will cover the following costs:

·  Tuition

·  Travel Costs

·  Daily Allowance

·  Learning Materials


                                 

Again, THANK YOU so much for your time and consideration! You have no idea what your contributions mean to me.  So much LOVE & GRATITUDE to you!

 -Kecia

story:
Hi everyone,

Thanks for taking the time to look at our campaign.

This campaign is important to us because it’s about people. It’s about unlocking the inherent potential in lives and in communities. It's about writing individual stories and bringing life, hope and freedom.

Following in Nelson Mandela’s footsteps we want do significantly improve reading outcomes in South Africa and we would like to give you the opportunity to join us.

We have chosen Mandela Day to launch our campaign and unite with friends and family to make a real difference. Mandela Day

Our Motivation

We care passionately about giving our rainbow nation’s most precious asset – its young children – the best possible start in life!

As Nelson Mandela once said “Education is the most powerful weapon you can use to change the world!

We have developed a fresh solution in education that is working remarkably well. We have an outstanding team that is both passionate and competent and we are determined to make a difference.

In the programme we have developed, we believe we have the ‘powerful weapon’ Mandela speaks of and we want to change the world, child by child, teacher by teacher, community by community!

Our Radical Readers Programme

In a nut shell our Radical Readers programme is an extremely effective intervention, consisting of two main elements;

  • Training for passionate and capable community based teachers, to set up and run self-sustaining Radical Readers Tutor Centres, using socially funded seed money.

  • An exciting curriculum and child-friendly materials suitable to teach children from preschool to Grade 3 irrespective of their social, linguistic and economic backgrounds.

Once established, these centres teach children to read using the internationally acclaimed Letterland phonics programme, which is part of the broader Radical Readers curriculum. Other crucial learning areas are also strengthened in the curriculum and children are also exposed to science experiments which expose them to the wonders of the world around them.

The whole programme is carefully monitored, teachers receiving ongoing mentoring and children are assessed regularly.

The centres are run as sustainable small businesses where parents retain the dignity of contributing to their child’s education. In cases where parents are absent or unemployed, sponsorships are available.

Our children are achieving outstanding results, with an average of 81% being achieved for letter shape and sound recognition, representing a 65% increase from the baseline assessment done at the start of the programme.

Who we are

At Advance 360 Education (Pty) Ltd, we are extremely fortunate to have a passionate team of professional people with many years of experience in both education and business.

For more details please read our Company Profile or our Company Brochure

 Our Immediate Goal

The goal of our campaign is to enable us to establish Radical Readers Tutor Centres in community based preschools in Diepsloop, Soweto, Cosmo City and Zandspruit.

The Radical Readers programme is being piloted in 10 tutor centres with great success and 6 new centres now want to launch.

  • 10 centres involved in the pilot phase need to have more teachers trained.

  • 9 of the centres involved in the pilot phase need to be fully equipped to operate optimally.

  • 6 new centres need business training, equipping and teacher training.

Donors will have the satisfaction of enabling the success of these centres by contributing to, or fully funding such things as training for tutors; classroom equipment; lessons and books for children and assessments.

 

The Funding Goal & Duration

Our campaign launched on Mandela Day, Saturday, July 18th 2015, and runs for 45 days, ending on Monday, 31th August 2015.

Our funding goal, to complete the setup of the 9 existing centres is $97,500 and includes 5% Indiegogo fees, 3% 3rd Party Fees for PayPal, 23% for teacher training, 31% for business training and for 38% equipment.

Donors who contribute to teacher training, business training and / or equipping a centre, will receive feedback on how the funds are allocated, since each beneficiary has different factors affecting the apportionment of this seed giving.

A portfolio of the benefiting teachers and entrepreneurs can be made available to donors who would like to select the recipient of their donation, once it has been made.

Contributions may also benefit donors in respect of e.g. Social Media, B-BBEE Contribution or CSI Donations. Should you wish to explore these options please liaise with us.

In the event that we do not reach our initial funding goal the funds raised will still be used as designated for the existing centres and they will continue to be developed as far as possible towards their next stage.

We aim to exceed our funding goal by raising an additional $65,000 for the other 6 new centres.

The Future Impact

As soon as the above needs have been met, we plan to concentrate our efforts and focus on one community at a time in order to tangibly and measurably fulfil our goal of changing a community and experience the impact of greater transformation.

There are 10,000 preschool children in the Diepsloot community, North of Johannesburg. We have seen some of these children on our Radical Readers programme achieve improvement in their assessment results from 0% to 100%.

We cannot walk away and leave them without a hope of achieving all they could and becoming all they are meant to be. We are compelled to walk with them and support them as their individual stories unfold. Do join us!

The Perks

Become an indispensable part of the story as you join us to #change-a-destiny by participating in our goal to get as many friends and family to join together across the world and contribute $1 towards a gift to honour Madiba

Many think $1 will not make much of a difference, however a study conducted by Nobel Laureate, James Heckmann showed that for every $1 invested in early childhood development there is a $7 return in the economy, when children are properly developed they become contributing members of society.

The money collected will be a gift to a community we are uplifting and serve as a reminder of our achievement that, together we can #change-destinies!

At the end of the campaign we will be able to decide what the gift will be. We will launch a face book page to get ideas and keep everyone updated.

You can also participate in one of our #change-a-destiny perks listed below.


The Risks

There are many reasons the risks in partnering with us are low, the main ones being;

  • successful pilots

  • proven materials

  • passionately committed and well qualified team

  • careful selection process

  • ongoing mentoring and training

Our flag ship centre has been funded in full, thanks to Advansys (Pty) Ltd, who took the initial risk and made the whole project possible this far. They will go down in history as our first #destiny-changer!

In the unlikely event that a business owner ceases to grow their business, resources will be redirected to a new business owner

If a child relocates and there is not a centre close to them, support can be redirected to benefit another child.

The Journey

We plan to take every opportunity to unlock the inherent potential in the lives of multitudes and we want to make it as real for you as possible.

We will be sharing stories on our Indiegogo Campaign Updates Page during the campaign.

Our Radical Readers Face-book page will also be launched as a reminder of the impact and the importance of being a #destiny-changer!

If you are not able to partake in any of the perks, you can still play a significant part by sharing our campaign with family and friends or by becoming a volunteer.

Keep in touch!

Bruce and Sandy
story_txt:
Hi everyone,


Thanks for taking the time to
look at our campaign.
This campaign is important to us
because it’s about people. It’s about unlocking the inherent potential in lives
and in communities. It's about writing individual stories and bringing life, hope
and freedom. 

Following in Nelson Mandela’s footsteps
we want do significantly improve reading outcomes in South Africa
and we would like to give you the opportunity to join us. 
We have chosen Mandela Day to launch our campaign and unite with friends and family to make a real difference. Mandela Day
Our Motivation

We care passionately about giving our rainbow nation’s most precious
asset – its young children – the best possible start in life!
As Nelson Mandela once said “Education is the most powerful weapon
you can use to change the world!
We have developed a fresh solution in
education that is working remarkably well. We have an outstanding team that is
both passionate and competent and we are determined to make a difference.
In the programme we have developed, we believe
we have the ‘powerful weapon’ Mandela speaks of and we want to change the world,
child by child, teacher by teacher, community by community! 

Our Radical Readers Programme
In a nut shell our Radical Readers programme is an extremely effective
intervention, consisting of two main elements;


Training for passionate and
capable community based teachers, to set up and run self-sustaining Radical
Readers Tutor Centres, using socially funded seed money.
An exciting curriculum and
child-friendly materials suitable to teach children from preschool to Grade 3 irrespective of their social,
linguistic and economic backgrounds. 



Once established, these centres teach children to read using the internationally
acclaimed Letterland phonics programme, which is part of the broader Radical
Readers curriculum. Other crucial learning areas are also strengthened in the
curriculum and children are also exposed to science experiments which expose
them to the wonders of the world around them.
The whole programme is carefully monitored, teachers receiving
ongoing mentoring and children are assessed regularly. 
The centres are run as sustainable small
businesses where parents retain the dignity of contributing to their child’s education.
In cases where parents are absent or unemployed, sponsorships are available. 
Our children are achieving outstanding
results, with an average of 81% being achieved for letter shape and sound
recognition, representing a 65% increase from the baseline assessment done at
the start of the programme.


Who we are

At Advance 360 Education (Pty) Ltd, we are extremely fortunate to
have a passionate team of professional people with many years of experience in both
education and business. 
For more details please read our Company Profile or our Company Brochure
 Our Immediate Goal
The goal of our campaign is to enable us to
establish Radical Readers Tutor Centres in community based preschools in Diepsloop,
Soweto, Cosmo City and Zandspruit. 
The Radical Readers programme is being piloted in 10 tutor centres
with great success and 6 new centres now want to launch. 

10 centres involved in the
pilot phase need to have more teachers trained. 
9 of the centres involved in
the pilot phase need to be fully equipped to operate optimally. 
6 new centres need business
training, equipping and teacher training.

Donors will have the satisfaction of enabling the success of these
centres by contributing to, or fully funding such things as training for
tutors; classroom equipment; lessons and books for children and assessments.

 
The Funding Goal &
Duration
Our campaign launched on Mandela Day, Saturday, July 18th 2015, and runs for 45 days, ending
on Monday, 31th August 2015.
Our funding goal, to complete the setup of
the 9 existing centres is $97,500 and includes 5% Indiegogo fees, 3% 3rd
Party Fees for PayPal, 23% for teacher training, 31% for business training and for
38% equipment.

business training and / or equipping a centre, will receive feedback on how the
funds are allocated, since each beneficiary has different factors affecting the
apportionment of this seed giving.
A portfolio of the benefiting teachers and entrepreneurs
can be made available to donors who would like to select the recipient of their
donation, once it has been made. 
Contributions may also benefit donors in respect of e.g. Social
Media, B-BBEE Contribution or CSI Donations. Should you wish to explore these
options please liaise with us.

raised will still be used as designated for the existing centres and they will continue
to be developed as far as possible towards their next stage.

for the other 6 new centres.

story:
My Jacari volunteer had a profound influence on my early development and had a memorably expressive laugh. I was 7 years old. Looking back, it was only one year that I had her support but I can still recall it vividly. She took us up the tower at St. Mary’s Church where she animatedly taught us Oxford history. For the first time I saw my city from above which gave me a significant sense of space and place. 

Former Jacari Pupil

Although the city of Oxford is most commonly associated with its world-renowned university, living amongst the prestigious libraries and colleges are children who struggle with the most basic skill needed to achieve their potential at school: a common language. 

For 50 years, award-winning charity Jacari has successfully increased educational participation and engagement among children in Oxford for whom English is an additional language.  It does this by providing 1-1 home tutoring to children in Oxford, aged 4-16, who are struggling with English and wouldn't otherwise be able to pay for this extra support. This year, as funding for charities tightens and school budget cuts have increased the number of children referred to our waiting list has grown, we need your help more than ever.

We have just £1000 left to raise in order to fully fund Jacari next year!  Your help to  raise this amount in full will enable Jacari to next year:

  • Continue supporting our 200 student volunteers to give 230 local children free 1-1 home-tutoring English lessons
  • Ensure that 100 local children on our waiting list start receiving home-tutoring

What is Jacari?

In order to combat racial intolerance in Oxford City, in 1965 a group of students from Oxford University set up a teaching scheme to volunteer their time teaching English to children in their local community. Today, Oxford has almost double the national average of children who speak English as an additional language (18%) and with research consistently demonstrating the enduring difference in attainment between bilingual children and their peers at every level, Jacari (registered charity 1108827) continues this important work so that every child has the chance to achieve their potential. 

Jacari works closely with 17 local schools to identify pupils who would benefit from regular additional teaching in order to achieve their academic potential, but would otherwise be unable to access this support.  Led by a full-time coordinator and student committee, each year Jacari trains volunteers from the two universities in Oxford, University of Oxford and Oxford Brookes University, to act as weekly home tutors to these children. 

Over the years, feedback from teachers, parents, volunteers and pupils consistently highlights the benefits of Jacari tutoring on children's language ability and academic skills.  Uniquely, our tutors are able to pay individual attention to their pupil's educational and pastoral needs, which improves general confidence and motivation, as well as their ability to engage with and contribute to school life and the wider community.

Why is Jacari crowdfunding?


As reported on BBC news in February, although last year 200 Jacari volunteers tutored 230 children across the city we still have a waiting list of over 100 local children who desperately need support.

With your help we can meet this demand for volunteer tutors.

To do this Jacari needs to fundraise all of next year's costs by 31st July and we're very nearly there! Our major costs are the salary of our full time Coordinator, the rent of office space that provides a central place for the Coordinator to maintain links with volunteers and local schools, as well as resource library so that our volunteers can plan engaging and successful lessons for their pupils.  

As a small, grassroots, student-led charity Jacari receives no annual funding which means that each year our fundraising has to start from scratch. So far this year we've worked hard to raise £29, 000 through fundraising events, winning grants and partnerships with innovative social enterprises such as the Charity Football League and The Knowledge Project. But we have £1000 left to go! 

How can you support us?

  • Pledge your support by choosing an option on the right.
  • Share this crowdfunder page with all of your friends and family using the indiegogo share tools. It's super quick and easy!
