Shipping rates are kept to a minimum, and are included for most perks going within the European Union. Mugs need special handling and shipping fees are therefore a tad higher. All perks will be shipped via regular postal service as "priority mail" within Europe and as air mail or freight mail outside Europe, also depending on what options the Post Office gives me. If you need a faster delivery via private courier, please contact me before or at the moment of address confirmation (I will send you an e-mail for that), and I can arrange that for you. 
Most perks are offered as single or double packages. If you are interested in a "special" package, or in bulk quantities, or in anything that is not listed in the perk options on the right, please contact me before you claim the perk(s), and I will work out a convenient "bulk shipping rate" for you. The idea is to avoid surcharging for multiple credit card purchases and shipping rates, as IGG does not allow the lumping of multiple perks. Once we agree on the special package perk and shipping rate, you can just pledge the money amount in the "back it" window at the top right of the campaign page, and... wait for the package to reach you! "Bulk" packages may be shipped to you directly from the supplier in The Netherlands.  For single- and double-order perks, I will adopt shipping cycles of 10-15 claims, so popular perks may be shipped even before the expected shipping time of January or February 2017. Once a batch is fulfilled, I will contact you for T-shirt size or color, address confirmation, and any other necessary piece of information. For all claimed perks, shipping will follow a "first come, first served" basis.
If you have ideas or suggestions for perk variations or new perks, please contact me!
 
The 2017 Limno Consulting Wall Calendar

The "featured" perk is a small (two ~16 x 21 cm sheets to form a "long" A4 or legal size format when mounted) wall calendar with 12 unique photos of lakes, streams, or aquatic organisms taken and donated by seven different contributors from all over the world. My heartfelt thanks go to Paolo, Andy, Gianluigi, Marit, Viktor, and Daniel for sharing their beautiful pictures with me! (I am the seventh contributor.)
The calendar text is in English and does not report religious holidays to keep it neutral. Most other holidays and events (like daylight saving time and solstice and equinox times) apply to Europe, North America, and Australia/New Zealand -- i.e., where I expect most of the calendars to be shipped to. Sorry for those special events that I was forced to leave out for space constraints.
In order for you to receive the calendars a.s.a.p., they will be shipped within 2-5 days from your claim. While supplies last!
 
The "100%" Collection

 
The "100%" collection includes T-shirts, baseball caps, tote bags, mouse pads, and mugs. They are offered in two designs -- 100% limnologist and 100% ecologist -- that emphasize the science-based yet fun-loving spirit of all (aquatic) ecologists. The designs are unique and are an exclusive of this campaign -- you will not find them anywhere else!
 
 

T-shirts are in a unisex cut and come in either white or black 100% cotton. Black T-shirts come with a $5 surcharge as per supplier price list. Shirt brand is Fruit of the Loom or equivalent. Print matter and T-shirt live longer with a lukewarm or cold washing machine cycle and cloth line drying or "delicate cycle" machine drying. Please refer to the chart below to choose your T-shirt size. Please keep in mind that shirts may shrink slightly upon first washing cycle, so if your size is midway two of the offered sizes below, please round it up.

 
 
 
 

Mouse pads are 3-mm thick and with a full-color "100%" print on white background. The black background faded quickly on early tests and therefore black-background mouse pads are not offered here. The pad texture allows for smooth and precise mouse movements. (I have tested it for several months by now.)
 
 

Mugs are offered in both "100%" designs and in a unique "knowledge is power" design (also an exclusive of this campaign) specifically thought for teachers, students, and book lovers of all types. All mugs feature a full-color print on white background. Unfortunately mugs require special handling and therefore shipment fees are a bit higher for mugs and mug-containing perks.
 
 

Baseball caps are 100% cotton, with the "100%" design printed on white background. Open-top canvas tote bags also are 100% cotton, with the "100%" design printed on warm (creamy) white background.  Tote dimensions are 36 cm wide x 33 cm high (or 14 in w x 13 in h). Tote bags are washable in a delicate washing machine cycle at lukewarm or cold temperature.
Please see the updates page for details about the added perks (baseball caps and tote bags).
Please contact me before claiming any perk if you need special perk packages not included in the list on the right, so we can work out the cheapest possible shipping rate.
 
Annual Membership to The David Pakman Show

The David Pakman Show (TDPS) is an internationally syndicated, independent talk show focusing on news and politics based in Boston, Massachusetts (USA). TDPS airs on radio, television, and the internet, and on Free Speech TV via DirecTV and DISH Network. The almost daily (Mon-Fri) podcasts are available to a global audience on TDPS own website. Podcasts are posted daily at around midday (US time) or dinner time (European time). Check out the publicly available podcasts at http://www.davidpakman.com. Members enjoy daily 45-min commercial-free podcasts (audio and video) plus an additional 15-min bonus show, and several time-limited specials, periodically offered at TDPS.
Though based in the US, TDPS reaches out to a truly global audience. TDPS discusses all topics with a critical and open mind. TDPS also reports on and discusses science, especially those topics most involved in policy making and politics, like climate change (an example is at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ipqkspWFito&t=15s), the antivaccination movement (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_TUgJogftrE), and other hot topics (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zAe4fVtPsCs&index=19&list=PLVrg5xLmCvhH0n1ig7zyctR1bu3f6W_ou; a still valid 2012 clip), plus interviews with scientists (check out this 2012 interview with Neil DeGrasse Tyson at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=msZ790rgN7g&index=15&list=PLVrg5xLmCvhH0n1ig7zyctR1bu3f6W_ou). The TDPS YouTube channel offers science-based clips in a self-standing "Science and Technology" list.
Host David Pakman also personally interacts with his audience on a daily basis via his show and a plethora of social networks.
I am happy to offer a limited number of annual TDPS memberships at a 25% discounted price as a perk in my IGG campaign. First come, first served. For those who claim this perk, I will forward your names to TDPS and you will go from there. You might enjoy additional perks if you apply for membership when TDPS offers them (like, for example, the 2017 TDPS calendar on sale at the end of 2016). TDPS memberships run for a year starting from the time of first subscription, renewable after each 1-year cycle.
 

Referral Contest
You can still earn a perk if you cannot contribute, or you can add an extra perk if you have already claimed one (or more). You can do this by referring this campaign to your network of friends and coworkers via Twitter and/or Facebook. IndieGoGo tracks the contributions that stemmed from your referrals via a link to this campaign uniquely assigned to each individual referee.
The top three referrers will "win" a special perk:

The top referrer will have collected the most contributions adding to at least US$ 500. Special perk: one "100%" complete set ("the works!" perk on the right), with no shipping fees.

The second place referrer will have collected the second-highest contributions total adding to at least US$ 250. Special perk: one "100%" mini-set, with no shipping fees.

Third place will go to the referrer with the third-highest contributions total adding to at least US$ 150.  Special perk: your choice of one mug or any two-item combinations excluding mugs (e.g., two t-shirts, t-shirts + mouse pad, t-shirt + cap, etc.), with no shipping fees.


In case of a tie within each prize category (e.g., if there are two referrers with >US$ 250 competing for second place), the higher dollar amount will win. In case of a dollar amount tie, the referrer with the higher number of contributions (or, secondarily, visits), will win. The "loser" will get the lower-tier prize (in this example, the third-place special perk). If two referrers are still tied as number of visits, they'll both get the higher special perk.
You need to have an IndieGoGo account to be a referrer.  Referrers promote this campaign with IGG’s share tools while logged into their IGG account. This is important because otherwise such a unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits. When you are logged into your IGG account and use IGG’s share tools to send a tweet, for example, the link in the tweet includes your unique ID. Then, when a new backer reads the tweet and clicks through the link to contribute, you are recognized as helping bring in the amount contributed by the new backer.
How to become a referrer:
1. Log into IndieGoGo - you must be logged in to receive credits for your referrals.
2. Visit the Limno Consulting campaign page (or -- log into IGG while you are on the Limno Consulting campaign page), where you can grab your unique link to the right side of the campaign introduction (above the perk list) by clicking the "link" button (the chain button highlighted with a cyan arrow):

 
You'll see a pop-up with the URL. Notice the numbers at the end -- that's how I know it's you referring your friends.
3. Copy the link and start sharing!
Use your link to share the campaign on social media, email, blog posts, etc.
For example, if you would like to share via Twitter, once you have copied the unique ID link, click on the "twitter" symbol, type a brief message, and include your unique ID link.
TWITTER EXAMPLE:"Support the Limno Consulting e-library campaign on @Indiegogo:  https://igg.me/at/LimnoCampaign2016/x/12345678"
* The '12345678' number on the end will be different for everyone, as that's your unique ID.
When anyone clicks on your unique link, they are taken to the Limno Consulting campaign page. If they back the campaign, they'll be added to your referral collection.
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word!!  You are welcome to use the IGG share tools, your contact network, e-mail, social networks, tam-tam, smoke signals, or anything you like!
 
 
Thanks a lot for your support!
 
website: http://www.limnoconsulting.com
twitter: http://twitter.com/LimnoGeek1

story:
Olá pessoas queridas!

Sou Carolina, bióloga, ecóloga e aluna de doutorado em Economia Ambiental pela Universidade de Brasília. Acho que sou cientista desde criança, quando andava pela praia observando os bichos na areia. Durante a graduação em Ciências Biológicas participei duas vezes do Programa de Iniciação Científica, e desde então não larguei mais a Ciência. Apesar de ser bióloga/ecóloga, escolhi o doutorado em Economia, porque acredito que o mundo precisa de profissionais interdisciplinares, que pensam fora da caixa e assim fazem a diferença! Agregar conhecimentos é melhor que limitar ou segregar! 

Faço essa campanha de arrecadação de fundos para eu poder participar em dois cursos internacionais, os quais fui selecionada: um na Flórida, promovido pela University of Florida (Global Youth Leadership Academy - GYLA), e o outro na University of Oxford (Oxford Summer School in Ecological Economics 2016). Esses cursos são extremamente importantes para mim, pois no primeiro, além de ter conseguido um desconto de 20%, terei a experiência de imersão da língua inglesa e em liderança, o que para uma cientista é essencial! No segundo, que é o que eu fiquei mais agradecida por ter sido selecionada, irá me prover um conhecimento gigante dentro da área que eu quero seguir, que é a Economia do Meio Ambiente. Eu saí do meu emprego para me dedicar aos cursos e ao final do doutorado! Infelizmente, o Brasil passa por uma fase de “vacas magras” para a ciência e educação! Por isso, agradeço demais aos que já leram até aqui e àqueles que puderem contribuir e/ou compartilhar essa campanha por aí! Já fizeram uma cientista brasileira feliz! :)

Agora vamos aos cálculos! Para o curso da Flórida, eu preciso de U$2.800 (R$ 9.800,00 aprox.) só para pagar o curso que oferece estadia e alimentação no período de 30 dias de curso em Agosto! Além disso, precisarei de U$ 160 (R$560,00 aprox.) para custear o visto de estudante e U$ 1.200 (R$ 4.000 aprox.) de passagem. Para o curso em Oxford, precisarei de U$2.300 (R$ 8.020 aprox.) para custear o curso, a estadia e a alimentação durante os 6 dias de curso em setembro, mais U$ 1.500 (R$ 5.000 aprox.) para passagem aérea. Os custos desse curso são em libras esterlinas (1.575 libras), mas coloquei em dólares para facilitar os cálculos. Somando todos esses custos, dá em torno de U$8.000 (R$ 28.000 aprox.). Peço U$ 11.000 (R$ 38.400,00) para ter uma margem extra para custear as taxas do site e as passagens mais próximas da data de embarque! Pois a medida que nos aproximamos da data de embarque, as passagens tendem a aumentar o valor. Qualquer auxílio, seja compartilhando, ou contribuindo com R$1,00 já ajuda demais!!!

Como a data do curso na Flórida está muito próxima e ainda não consegui o suficiente para custeá-lo, é bem provável que eu vá somente para o curso em Oxford! Portanto, se eu conseguir metade do que estou pedindo (U$ 5.500) já estarei completamente realizada! Acho que esse curso em Oxford trará maior retorno para a minha vida acadêmica e profissional! E é o curso que eu estou mais animada e eufórica! :)

E, caso eu consiga além do valor, ou ainda não dê tempo de eu conseguir o visto para o primeiro curso, destinarei a verba para a participação de dois congressos internacionais: o "18th Annual BioEcon Conference: Instruments and Incentive Mechanisms for Biodiversity Conservation and Ecosystem Service Provision", a ser realizado em Cambridge, em setembro/2016 e o "First Latin American Ecosystem Services Partnership Conference", na Colômbia, em outubro/2016. Em ambos com a apresentação de trabalhos! :) 

Ainda existem poucas pessoas no Brasil que sejam corajosas e que tenham a visão de “mudar” de curso para complementar um conhecimento. As dificuldades são muitas e muitas são as barreiras a serem vencidas! Acredito que as áreas se interconectam e que cada vez mais precisamos disso na ciência em prol de um bem maior. Por isso, contribuindo com esse projeto, você estará contribuindo com a formação interdisciplinar de uma cientista com a visão um pouco para frente, que acredita que pode contribuir para novos rumos da ciência na área ambiental. Assim, estará auxiliando a ciência brasileira a transpor fronteiras e barreiras do conhecimento!

Muito grata pela sua ajuda!!

Me ajude a compartilhar essa campanha por aí! :)

(English version:)

I'm Carolina, a biologist, ecologist and doctoral student in Environmental Economics at the University of Brasilia. I think I'm a scientist since childhood, when I walked along the beach observing little animals in the sand. During my graduation in Biological Sciences, I have participated twice on the Scientific Initiation Program and since then I have never dropped academic life. Despite being a biologist/ecologist, I chose doing my PhD in economics, because I believe the world needs interdisciplinary professionals, who think outside the box and make a difference! Adding knowledge is better than limit or segregate it!

I am making this fundraising campaign to be able to afford and participate in two international courses, which I was selected: one in Florida, sponsored by the University of Florida (Global Youth Leadership Academy - GYLA), and the other at the University of Oxford (Oxford Summer School in Ecological Economics 2016). These courses are extremely important to me! The second course is the most important one, because it is directly related with my doctoral thesis and there is none course like this in Brazil. I was very thankful for being selected at this course because it will provide a huge knowledge in environmental economic field, which is the area that I want to follow. I quit my job to dedicate exclusively to the end of my doctorate and to these courses! Unfortunately, Brazil is going through a phase of lean year for education and science. So, thanks very much those who have read this far and those who can contribute and/or share this campaign.

Now, let’s do the math! To travel to Florida, I’ll need U $ 2,800, just to pay for the course that provides room and board during the 30-day course in August! Also, I'll need U $ 160 to fund the student visa and $ 1,200 for flight tickets. To travel to Oxford I will need $ 2,300 to pay for the course, stay and food during the 7-day course in September and another $ 1,500 for airfare. The costs of this course are in pounds (1,575 pounds), but I put it in dollars to facilitate the calculations. Adding all these costs, gives around $ 8,000. I am asking for $ 11,000 to have an extra margin to pay site fees and the flights tickets nearest of the date of shipment! As we approach the date of shipment, the tickets tend to increase the value. Any aid either sharing or contributing it will be really helpful.

As the date of GYLA course in Florida is very close and I could not get enough to pay for it, it's most likely that I only go to the course in Oxford! So if I get half of what I'm asking ($ 5.500) I'll be fully fulfilled!

If I get beyond the value, I’ll destine the funds for the participation of two international conferences: the "18th Annual BioEcon Conference: Instruments and Incentive Mechanisms for Biodiversity Conservation and Ecosystem Service Provision ", which it’ll be held in Cambridge in September/2016 and the" First Latin American Ecosystem Services Partnership Conference ", in Colombia in October/2016.

There are still a few people in Brazil who have courageous and have vision of "change" the main field to supplement your knowledge. The difficulties are many and there are many barriers to overcome! I believe that different areas of knowledge are interconnected and we need more and more interconnected knowledge in science for the sake of a greater good. Therefore contributing with this project, you will be contributing to the interdisciplinary training of a scientist who has a vision a little forward, which believes that she can contribute to new directions of science in the environmental field. So, you are helping the Brazilian science to cross borders and barriers of knowledge!

I am very grateful for your help!!

(And sorry for any mistake in my english writing! ;))

story:
HoneyLove and CameroonONE are two organizations with rather different missions-

HoneyLove is a Los Angeles based honeybee conservation organization that seeks to protect honeybees through education and by inspiring urban beekeeping. CameroonONE is based in Boston and specializes in privatized foster care in West Africa by funding the educations of orphaned children and reuniting them with their families.

But WONDERFUL things can be achieved through collaboration! Through a shared culture of education and mutual ambitions of ensuring that the causes we serve thrive, we have together discovered a process in which both vulnerable groups can look after each other:

Bees caring for children, and children caring for bees!!!   

It is so simple! By bringing together our operations already in place, there will be massive benefits to our bees, our students, and the communities that they share! With worldwide bee colonies declining by 90% and the rate of parentless children in Sub-Saharan Africa on a perpetual upswing, there has never been a clearer opportunity to battle both epidemics with one single charge...

Project Vision: Our beefarmers in Cameroon will be trained in treatment-free and ethical beekeeping practices; local bee populations will soar; the students and village will learn this trade; the honey and wax will be harvested to generate a sustainable income for our orphan projects for years to come (more students will be welcomed into our program which means more education and healthier citizens and continuing to keep families together in a secure environment); and local crops will see better yields from the influx of pollination and jobs will be created as an effect of growth and all around improve rural social-economics. The beauty of this coordinated effort is that the results are so beautifully holistic and the system can be replicated wherever there are both bees and children with special needs or without a home.

In order for this to come to realization, we will be looking to build a farm with a full 800 hives on land that has already been purchased in northwest Cameroon. Fourteen hives are already in operation and our project leader has a background and extensive experience in beekeeping. The initial phase will require 150 hives to be installed and colonized in year one in order to start producing wax and honey to sell to reinvest into additional hives until the farm reaches capacity. Phase one is critical to the overall success as early year cultivation will lead to a speedier turnaround.

Through a shared culture of education and mutual ambitions of ensuring that the causes we serve thrive, we have together discovered a process in which both vulnerable groups can look after each other:Bees caring for children, and children caring for bees!!!   It is so simple! By bringing together our operations already in place, there will be massive benefits to our bees, our students, and the communities that they share! With worldwide bee colonies declining by 90% and the rate of parentless children in Sub-Saharan Africa on a perpetual upswing, there has never been a clearer opportunity to battle both epidemics with one single charge...Project Vision: Our beefarmers in Cameroon will be trained in treatment-free and ethical beekeeping practices; local bee populations will soar; the students and village will learn this trade; the honey and wax will be harvested to generate a sustainable income for our orphan projects for years to come (more students will be welcomed into our program which means more education and healthier citizens and continuing to keep families together in a secure environment); and local crops will see better yields from the influx of pollination and jobs will be created as an effect of growth and all around improve rural social-economics. The beauty of this coordinated effort is that the results are so beautifully holistic and the system can be replicated wherever there are both bees and children with special needs or without a home.In order for this to come to realization, we will be looking to build a farm with a full 800 hives on land that has already been purchased in northwest Cameroon. Fourteen hives are already in operation and our project leader has a background and extensive experience in beekeeping. The initial phase will require 150 hives to be installed and colonized in year one in order to start producing wax and honey to sell to reinvest into additional hives until the farm reaches capacity. Phase one is critical to the overall success as early year cultivation will lead to a speedier turnaround.

story:
Growing Artists Citizens of The World

I founded Stomp and Shout Chicago in 2013 with a clear mission, " to innovate inspiring ways to bring music, art, and theatre to kids and their families". I was seeing SO many arts programs that were offering the "same old thing". SO many programs that were offering a limited slice of the delicious arts pie. I believe the best kinds of Arts Classes are less concerned with training the next Broadway star, and are more concerned with growing their student's confidence, inspiring team work, strengthening problem solving skills, deepening creative and critical thinking skills, and growing big, beautiful imaginations. Speaking of imagination -- take  a minute to imagine what our kid's adult lives would like with these tools at their disposal? It's pretty thrilling to imagine, right?

Back to that mission. Let's breakdown how we aim to serve that statement:

  • We provide an Arts Foundation for all of our families so that they can continue to sing, play, and create for years to come.
  • We spark imaginative conversations in class with the goal that this imaginative language develops at home.
  • We bring arts programming to families that may not have the resources to attend an arts class on their own. (See specifically our partnership with Rivendell Theatre Ensemble on the Strong Girls Make Stuff Program as well as our Play For Everyone Program that reserves two free seats in each session of our Early Childhood Programming for families that are having financial difficulties).
  • We foster community between families and their neighborhoods. We like to say we're helping to create mom and pop tribes.
  • We create unique {fun} classes that expand our student's artistic horizons.


A Bit Of History:

September of 2013
Our first Early Childhood session begins in Logan Square. At session's end our enrollment was at 9 kids. The class was taught by Cassie with Noah on guitar.

Summer 2014
We added two more location into the mix (for a total of three) and found that we'd grown to 21 students! 

Winter 2014
Cassie partners with Brooklyn based songwriter, Jo Solomon. The merger lands Cassie with amazing songs to develop the early childhood music and creative play program she's been dreaming about for years. It also gives us a sister, Stomp and Shout Brooklyn. 

Summer 2015
Holy smokes -- 38 enrollments, 3 teachers, 3 locations, and 2 guitarists.

Winter 2015
Our Early Childhood neighborhoods grow to include: Logan Square (the OG), Roscoe Village, Bucktown, West Loop, and Oak Park.

Stomp and Shout Chicago spearheads it's first program for older kids, Strong Girls Make Stuff at Rivendell Theatre Ensemble.

Big Things On The Horizon

You can see we've been growing in a big, beautiful way! Even more amazing opportunities have been flying Stomp and Shout's way and we've found ourselves in one of those exciting moments: there's a need and an opportunity for growth, but all of that growth needs capital to support it. That's where you come in....

The Launch of Stomp and Shout Kids
We've been slowly rolling out a brand new music and creative play program for kids ages 8 months - 4 years. By Spring of 2016 we'll have added a Manhattan location, an Iowa location, and many, many families. We've got BIG DREAMS for this unique program. Your investment will help facilitate: 

  • Recording & Sound Design for our original poems & short stories
  • Design, Writing, Research, Printing of Take Home Materials
  • An Illustrator for our Play Packets, Poems, and Stories
  • The nitty gritty: a lawyer for trademarking, partnership agreements, and licensing.
  • Spreading the word: A fancy-schmancy PR person to alert the masses to the brilliance of Stomp and Shout

Stomp and Shout HQ located in Logan Square

The time has come for us to plant our roots. Where to do it was a no brainer -- beautiful Logan Square! Not only will Stomp and Shout HQ provide a space for our classes, trainings, and a much needed office for Cassie, it will also open up opportunities for us to throw parties, produce inventive, immersive children's theatre and family friendly concerts  (what up kindie rock!), and offer space to other family/kid focused companies (think: birthing classes, mama groups, dance classes, instrumental music lessons, and more!). Don't worry -- we'll continue to offer our classes all over the city of Chicago!!

The Perks

With your investment, you're putting your Stomp and Shout Kid at the center of the program. We're all parents, grandparents, aunties, uncles, cousins, babysitters, and/or besties to tiny tots. The kids that we love deserve to shine -- and this is the opportunity for it!

"Become A Stomp And Shout Kid" Perks:

  • Your child's picture and bio featured in Stomp and Shout Materials
  • Your child's voice featured in Stomp And Shout Poems and/or recorded materials. 
  • Your child's likeness as one of our coloring page characters
  • Original Stomp and Shout Song or Poem written about the child in your life

Additional Perks:

  • Family Admission to launch concert & party 
  • Party Celebration Package
  • Music & Poem Downloads
  • Onesies

We Have Big Dreams

We know these are big dreams, and this is a big goal! If we don't reach the full Indiegogo goal we'll start building piece by piece starting with the nitty gritty, then working toward the space, then putting the final pieces together. Step by Step, oooh baby....isn't that what a great man once said? #nkotb

With each step we'll be able to reach more and more kids and families. We'll be able to offer creative income outlets for our teaching artists, we'll be able to develop new programs like First Stomp for infants and Big Stomp for Pre-School aged kids, we'll be able to build an Arts & Imagination filled space for the families of Logan Square (and our other beloved neighborhoods), we'll be able to introduce the power of play to cities around the country, and we'll be filled with JOY while we do it. I mean, come on, if this isn't joy, I don't know what is! 

Another interesting fact to be aware of: Cultivating this kind of artistic venture is in Cassie's blood. She was born in a trunk and raised in a family that birthed a theatre before they birthed her.  The 37 year old Lamb Arts Regional Theatre in Sioux City, IA. She's seen first hand what it takes to make an organization like this grow and thrive....she's been waiting 35 years, and with the declaration of Chicago as her forever home, she's now ready for the challenge!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the good Stomp and Shout word is just as valuable as investing in this campaign.

  • Tell your neighbors about our classes, come to a class yourself, invest in the joy with your time. www.StompAndShoutChicago.com
  • Make some noise about the campaign -- Know a family who would love to put their child in the spotlight as a Stomp and Shout Kid? Share the campaign details with them. Know someone invested in the growth of Logan Square? Share the campaign with them. Know someone who supports female entrepreneurs? Share the campaign with them. Know someone who is a champion of arts education? Share the campaign with them.
  • Instagram, Tweet, Facebook your support with the hashtag #iknowastompandshoutkid

With so much gratitude and a lot of joy -
Cassie Slater

story:
Hi!

I'm Carrone Conroy, founder of Elite Mentoring and you can get a hold of me at Carrone@elitementoring.co, I am looking forward to hearing from you. 

Education is something I have always been passionate about. After teaching for several years, working hard to complete my MBA and with my social entrepreneurship background I believe I am in an awesome position to really add value to this amazing industry. 

I am trying to raise money for Elite Mentoring to launch a peer-2-peer mentoring based education (or learning) platform. Elite Mentoring is wanting to carve a place in the adult and professional education industry as well as the traditional education industry. Starting with a simple website and online platform and growing from there. 

After working in the education system for several years I couldn't help but notice the inefficiencies. Being as passionate and committed to education as I am, I know I can help make a change for the better. 

With a little bit of help from you we will be able to put together all the different parts that make a online platform like this work. And with a little bit of luck we will be able to start building the future of education, artificial intelligent learning programs, videos and chat bots to really start building individual learning programs for all.  

Your contribution, in anyway, shape or form would mean the world to me. 

I just want to thank you for taking the time to even check out this campaign. It really does mean the world to me, so thanks! 

What We Need & What You Get

I am a big believer in dreaming big! The target of $100,000 I will admit, does seem a little ambitious. With this level of backing I will be able to hire world class programmers, developers and designers to help get this platform absolutely humming! And if there was enough money so I could work on Elite Mentoring full-time, well that would be a dream come true. 

I haven't got the exact details of how much it is going to cost but I know it is going to be a lot. This campaign is really about raising enough money to get a world class website up and running as well as promoting the website and mentoring programs. 

Now, honestly, the perks are the perks, but if you want anything done, and I mean anything at all, to thank you for your contribution just get in touch and let me know. 

The most exciting perk is the mentoring program, which is really like a pre-sale of our actual product. Where you will be matched up with one of your mentors for our Elite 12 month Mentoring Program at a fraction of the cost. 

These coaching programs are specific and tailored to the individuals needs. The programs involve catching up with your mentor as often as once a week, with 24 hour access via chat applications and email. A 12 month coaching program with this much access to a mentor would traditionally cost in the thousands. I am confident with the intelligent use of technology it can be done for a fraction of the cost. 

Now I know giving money away online to a complete stranger is risky, but with my hand on my heart, I can say I am in this for all the right reasons and if you can help in anyway I will be truly grateful. I mean over the moon and back grateful. 

The Impact

Changing the world is something our generation believes in intuitively. The problem is how do we change the world? The best answer to this question I have heard is "find a problem and then solve it." Now the world has one less problem in it. 
Education is the problem I want to fix, and your contribution will go along way to helping me do that. 
Education should be all about bringing forth what is within, lighting a fire inside of people. Not filling people's heads with "knowledge" and then testing the life out of them. This is exactly what I want to change. 
Yes, starting something from scratch or changing anything is hard, and changing something as big and complicated as education will be super duper hard. And that is the challenge I am looking forward to, that is the challenge that gets me out of bed in the morning. And I have done similar stuff like this before. I know I can do it again. 
Risks & Challenges
Ok, yes, making an impact in any situation is hard, it takes a lot of effort, and some good old fashioned hard work. The most important thing I have learned is how valuable it is to be flexible. 
As I head along this journey there will be countless challenges and obstacles to overcome. And things will change along the way. As long as I stay committed to the true essence of what this is all about, "helping people", as along as I stay committed to the greater good, I just know in the end the world will be a better place. If all else fails and everything falls apart with Elite Mentoring, if we are able to help just one person, it would've all been worth it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing to this campaign can look like anything you want it to look like, helping spread the word around will make a world of difference to this campaign. 
Contacting me personally if you believe you can help in another way is great as well. 
And lastly any financial contribution would make the world of difference to me, 

Thanks again for taking the time to check out this campaign, I wish you all the best in everything you do. 

And here's to us changing the world!

story:
Short Summary

My name Sheem One the M.C. I am a Hip Hop artist. I plan to travel to the Revolt Music Conference to learn advance knowledge about the music industry. The conference is a think tank for the future progression of Hip Hop culture.I need to be there. It will be an unparalleled experience. A three day conference panels, keynotes, performances and exclusive VIP think tanks hosted by Mr. Sean “Diddy” Combs, A networking breakfast, lunches, exclusive invite to the chairman`s cocktail hour, and closing Gala ceremony. I am asking for the help of my community to help make this next level happen. Thank you to everyone who is blessed to give and thank you to those who wanted to but could not. I appreciate you all. Peace and Love.

What We Need & What You Get

Being a full time artist sometimes things needed are out of reach. The hotel and travel fees are out of my budget. The conference itself is a sacrifice of high dollar value. Getting my music in the right hands, making contacts with people from all over the world, the growth of knowledge in the business, branding, and learning the future direction of music can be vital to my career. The Conference itself is $1100 and food and travel will be roughly 4 to $500. 

The Impact

I am a Hip Hop Artist that needs to make the right connections to be heard by the world. I embody the character needed in men. I represent one of the most chased after careers in the world. Hip Hop music. Hip Hop M.C.`s need a positive representation. That is me. I am not perfect, but I am perfect for this responsibility. Give from your heart if you want effect change, a small ripple of change in our youth and the music we digest.


Risks & Challenges

My music home base is in a location not known for Hip Hop. It is very difficult to be put in the right situation for the right people to become connected to your sound. The only way is to travel.

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is very important. Please find the time to tell a like minded person about my mission to grow.

story:
The Joy in Birthing Foundation is a 501 (c) 3 non-profit organization. In 2015 we have educated and served over 250 women and families. We are slated to serve even more in 2016. But we need your support to reach our goals. All contribution are tax deductible.

Our clientele is disproportionately impacted by a real crisis in the maternal heath in the United States. Inconsistent care likely contributes to racial disparities in maternal health outcomes often resulting in unnecessary interventions, discrimination, and higher rates of complications in vaginal deliveries. The rates for complication for cesarean births increases five-fold. 

The need for committed doulas is growing tremendously and we have just begun. Please contribute so that we can continue our work, we welcome donations in any amount and there are some fantastic prizes included for your generous donation.

"Jessica was incredibly supportive, caring, warm and patient with me from the start. I had so many questions and concerns about the labor and delivery- bordering on neurotic. Yet she was thorough and very informative. I could tell that she had a lot of experience as a doula because she was calm and knowledgable in our meetings before the delivery. She was also readily available over the phone, and email and in person to talk to me whenever I needed. 
During the delivery she was sensitive to my needs – whether I needed space or more comfort. Right after my daughter was born she made sure the nurses gave us skin to skin contact which was something I told her was important to me." - Daniella G. (from the video!)

Who do we serve 

  • Homeless pregnant women (~10%)

  • Pregnant women in the foster care system (~50%)

  • Young teenagers (~30%)

  • Survivors of sex trafficking and torture who have become pregnant (~5%)

  • Low income and immigrant women who are pregnant and alone and often do not speak English (~5%)

"I was very determined to have an all natural labor with no medication, I couldn't have done it without the help of my doula. She is the best doula i could have had! I’m glad i had her as a doula. From walking to massaging she helped me through my whole labor i highly recommend her to any soon to be mother. :)"  - Former client of the Joy in Birthing Foundation.

What is a doula’s commitment per client?

Each expecting mother receives 20-40 hours individualized doula support including:

  • Prenatal meetings,

  • Phone, text, email support,

  • 24 hour accessibility,

  • Accompanying to the hospital for the birth

  • Postpartum support


So far, our doulas have not received any compensation and many of them end up spending their own money in order to serve our clients-typical expenses for a doula include, gasoline, parking at hospitals, food at hospital commissaries, doula supplies, childcare for their own children.  


For us to continue helping women have the birthing experience they deserve and desire, we need to recognize and support our professional doula’s commitment.  The Joy In Birthing Foundation is committed to raising money to pay a portion of our professional doulas fee.  


Who we are 


The Joy In Birthing Foundations is a 501 (3) c non-profit organization of professional doulas serving the Greater Los Angles area.  We have three primary goals:

  1. To accompany families through pregnancy, birth and the postpartum period by offering volunteer doula services* thus reducing the risk for medical interventions for both mother and child, while providing informational, emotional and physical support before, during and after the birth of their child.  

  2. To offer important education to low income families and the communities at large about safe pregnancy birth and baby care practices, through classes and printed material.

  3. To facilitated doula training within the communities we serve and stimulate peer support. Provide our volunteer doulas advanced training and mentorship.  



Why are these services needed?

Since 1990, the maternal mortality ratio in the U.S. has more than doubled. We now rank 64th in the world, with 28 maternal deaths per 100,000 live births. African American women are also suffering severe maternal morbidity at higher rates: more than 60,000 women a year experience a life-threatening condition during childbirth. 

When continuous labor support was provided by a doula, women experienced a:

  • 31% decrease in the use of Pitocin*

  • 28% decrease in the risk of C-section*

  • 12% increase in the likelihood of a spontaneous vaginal birth*

  • 9% decrease in the use of any medications for pain relief

  • 14% decrease in the risk of newborns being admitted to a special care nursery

  • 34% decrease in the risk of being dissatisfied with the birth experience*


*this outcome was best affected by a doula rather than another type of support


- "The Evidence for Doulas," 2013. Dekker, Rebecca. based on "Continuous support for women during labor," 2012. Hodnett, et. al.

For more information about what a doula is and how they can help before, during, and after birth please click here.


How do we find our pregnant clients in need?


 We support agencies with maternal-child health programs and social service providers to improve the quality of birth, breastfeeding and baby care. We work with our partners to empower women to get the care they desire, to educate and accompany families before, during and after the birth of their child by providing doula care free of charge for those families who are in need. Together we seek to promote gentle birth and provide holistic support of pregnant families through informational, physical, and emotional support.

Our partners include:
story_txt:
The Joy in Birthing Foundation is a 501 (c) 3 non-profit organization. In 2015 we have educated and served over 250 women and families. We are slated to serve even more in 2016. But we need your support to reach our goals. All contribution are tax deductible.Our clientele is disproportionately impacted by a real crisis in the maternal heath in the United States. Inconsistent care likely contributes to racial disparities in maternal health outcomes often resulting in unnecessary interventions, discrimination, and higher rates of complications in vaginal deliveries. The rates for complication for cesarean births increases five-fold. The need for committed doulas is growing tremendously and we have just begun. Please contribute so that we can continue our work, we welcome donations in any amount and there are some fantastic prizes included for your generous donation."Jessica was incredibly supportive, caring, warm and patient with me from the start. I had so many questions and concerns about the labor and delivery- bordering on neurotic. Yet she was thorough and very informative. I could tell that she had a lot of experience as a doula because she was calm and knowledgable in our meetings before the delivery. She was also readily available over the phone, and email and in person to talk to me whenever I needed. During the delivery she was sensitive to my needs – whether I needed space or more comfort. Right after my daughter was born she made sure the nurses gave us skin to skin contact which was something I told her was important to me." - Daniella G. (from the video!)
Who do we serve 
Homeless pregnant women (~10%)
Pregnant women in the foster care system (~50%)
Young teenagers (~30%)
Survivors of sex trafficking and torture who have become pregnant (~5%) 
Low income and immigrant women who are pregnant and alone and often do not speak English (~5%)
 "I was very determined to have an all natural labor with no medication, I couldn't have done it without the help of my doula. She is the best doula i could have had! I’m glad i had her as a doula. From walking to massaging she helped me through my whole labor i highly recommend her to any soon to be mother. :)"  - Former client of the Joy in Birthing Foundation.What is a doula’s commitment per client?Each expecting mother receives 20-40 hours individualized doula support including:
Prenatal meetings,
Phone, text, email support,
24 hour accessibility, 
Accompanying to the hospital for the birth 
Postpartum support
So far, our doulas have not received any compensation and many of them end up spending their own money in order to serve our clients-typical expenses for a doula include, gasoline, parking at hospitals, food at hospital commissaries, doula supplies, childcare for their own children.  For us to continue helping women have the birthing experience they deserve and desire, we need to recognize and support our professional doula’s commitment.  The Joy In Birthing Foundation is committed to raising money to pay a portion of our professional doulas fee.  Who we are The Joy In Birthing Foundations is a 501 (3) c non-profit organization of professional doulas serving the Greater Los Angles area.  We have three primary goals:

*this outcome was best affected by a doula rather than another type of support- "The Evidence for Doulas," 2013. Dekker, Rebecca. based on "Continuous support for women during labor," 2012. story:
Hi, I'm Oz.

For the last 20 years I have been studying, practicing, and teaching rare and forgotten martial arts of England. Along the way I have picked up a lot of old books looking at early forms of boxing, wrestling, and fencing. I've started scannning these and making them available to everyone in order to try and keep these amazing fighting systems alive.  The problem is that some of them are extremely rare.

The first ever dedicated treatise on Wrestling in English was written by a Nobleman called Sir Thomas Parkyns, and was published at the beginning of the 18th century.

I have recently got the opportunity to buy an original copy of this amazing work that dates back to 1727, but it is completely out of my price range at £1500

If I can raise the funds to purchase this book it would enable me not only to preserve an amazing piece of our martial heritage, but also to offer it to the public in a way that is truly accessible, long lasting, and more importantly usable.

I'm asking for £1600 to cover the cost of fees, as well as the purchase price of the book.  


So if you can spare anything to help, please do, it would mean an awful lot to me.  If you con't donate money then don't despair, you can still help.  I'd really appreciate any help at all in spreading the word and getting this project as widely known as possible.

If I manage to raise more money than it takes to buy this work, then I will put it towards other, rare books, I have a depressingly long list of books I can't afford to buy! :D

Thanks very much indeed.

Oz

story:
UPDATE: OCT 28th - ADDED THE PANGOLIN PERK (TSHIRT and 40 mins of quality education)

Get a cool looking shirt and equip a teacher to teach a dynamic and interactive class of at least 30 underprivileged  children in Kolkata, India. 

 

 

 

“Changing the World, One School a Time”

250 million students attend years of school but are still illiterate when they graduate.  We are here to change this but WE NEED YOU!

 

Statistics show that over 250 million students globally can’t read, write, or count. There are also 1.2 million students that drop out of school in the US every year.  Additionally, 25% of teachers (1.7 million) in India don’t attend classes the entire year.  Zedbridge's mission is to leverage technology to equip unresourced schools and teachers with a high quality education program that allows students to discover and achieve their full potential.  

Unlike other solutions, we provide a comprehensive global solution (An entire school in the box) that contains all the components (instructional, training, administrative tools, and a support structure) required to run an Elementary school (pre K - eighth grade).  Also, unlike other solutions that rely mainly on autonomous learning, we understand the importance of working with existing educational infrastructures and having a teacher as a mentor and guide in these children's lives.  
 
The Zedbridge global educational solution empowers almost anyone to teach utilizing the best teaching practices and employs curricula that follows education standards and develops the entire child.  Additionally the program is easily deployable, customizable, scalable, and has a support structure that enables teachers to succeed.  
We realize that we can NEVER replace a qualified and experienced teacher but our hope is that through this education model we can exponentially improve the teaching of these un-resourced teachers. 
 

 Zedbridge was born out of a need to provide affordable high quality education for the underprivileged students of HCS Elementary school in Kolkata, India.  

Over the last two and a half years we have been informally developing and testing select components of the Zedbridge program at HCS and we have seen a dramatic improvement in student grades and teacher motivation.  We are now at a stage where we are ready to develop a complete pre-packaged program that we can try at HCS and then replicate to other schools in India and around the World.

 

“We are striving to transform education for the underprivileged from the chains that bind the poor in the cycle of poverty to be the most powerful tool used to change the world,” Rajiv Patnaik.
Our extensive experience working with HCS has provided us with considerable insight into the problems and needs of un-resourced schools that serve underprivileged children.  We also have a team of qualified administrators and educators  who excel at providing quality education.
 
We believe that this educational solution can change the world -- or as Steve Jobs said “make a dent in the Universe”-- because of its simplicity, its support structure, its low cost, and its easy replication.  It is our goal to narrow the education gap between the privileged and the underprivileged.

This campaign will raise funds for the a team of 12 qualified and experienced teachers to develop 6 months of curriculum and lesson plans for an entire Elementary school (Pre K - 8th Grade) in India. 

Join us and walk with us on this journey to "making a dent in the Universe"

You can help by contributing what you can and by joining our movement.

 

 

 

 

EXPLORE MORE

     |  solution  |  plan  |  what we need  |  impact  |  perks  | story  |  timeline  |  faq   |   

 

FEATURED IN

 

 

 

                                 

Hello, my name is Rajiv Patnaik, and I am the founder of Zedbridge. 

Zedbridge began in early 2013 after the passing of my father Zachariah Patnaik, who was the president of HCS Elementary.  Zedbridge - “The Zachariah Education Bridge” was founded in honor of my father Zachariah.  It's purpose was to bridge the education gap between the privileged and underprivileged.  

My father, Zachariah, having very humble beginnings, personally experienced how quality education could ignite a child's dreams and desires. He also witnessed how easily those same dreams and desires could be extinguished when a child is engulfed in poverty and does not have access to quality education.  

My father dedicated over 27 years of his life serving underprivileged children through HCS in Kolkata, India.  He passed away in February 2013 when I took over the school.  It is an honor to follow in my father's footsteps and a privilege to be part of such a potentially powerful institution.  

I am where I am in life because of the quality education that my father received through his early years.  If if hadn't been for the people who invested in him at a young age, he would not have had access to quality education and I could have been born into poverty and been part of the 250 million illiterate students!  So it is with much gratitude and a privilege to play a part in the story of each children's lives that I lead this organization.

With the privilege comes a huge responsibility. The parents of our students sacrifice more than you and I can ever imagine to enable their children to attend school, because they believe education is the ticket out of poverty.  This lays on me the responsibility to provide space where all these children are allowed the basic right to dream and then are given the tools to pursue their dreams. 

 

This has been a challenge for us to create given our lack of resources and qualified teachers.   Zcloudschool, our education model was born out of these limitations and the fact that there are many more schools like us that can't afford the traditional resources to provide quality education.  We had to THINK OUTSIDE THE BOX to develop a model that provides quality education at an affordable cost. 

There is yet another level of schools, where teachers are equipped to fail. They have lost the motivation to teach effectively due to a lack of training and support .  These are the schools that employ the 1.7 million teachers in India that don't attend any classes the entire year! These are the schools around the world that produce the 250 million illiterate students!  There is absolutely no reason for these statistics when educational resources are free and plenty.  This injustice is what drives me to spend the rest of my life to create change. 

We have a unique and amazing opportunity with HCS Elementary.  It's our sandbox, our testing ground!  We have complete freedom to develop our model at a live school and test it without limitations.  If successful, it can be replicated in other schools in India and then around the world. 

Thank you for taking the time to read our story.  Please join us in this walk.  We cannot do this on our own.
 
Rajiv Patnaik
Founder/CEO
Zedbridge
You can help by contributing what you can and by joining our movement.
 

 

 

                                   

 

Our mission is to develop a model that makes quality education a universal opportunity made possible through our passionate and global team of partners, volunteers, and supporters.

Zedbridge is predominantly a volunteer-driven and grassroots effort. Many talented and diverse individuals from all over the world have contributed their abilities and passions to finding solutions to help make quality education more equally accessible.

      

 

                                                      

 

 

 

 

 

Our solution is to equip these under resource and unmotivated teachers with resources that a qualified teacher would have.  We believe that we can inspire these teachers if we can equip them properly and show them how to reach and positively influence their students.

The Zcloudschool solution provides an entire pre-packaged school (PreK - 8th grade) in the cloud with all the main elements that make up a great school:

The Zcloudschool alternative educational solution combines traditional teaching and a low-cost technology center to provide an innovative learning environment. The traditional teaching approach follows education standards and uses printed detailed lesson plans following best teaching methods. Classes are taught locally but are monitored and administered remotely. The low-cost technology center follows the Self Organized Learning Environment (SOLE). Classes are taught and monitored remotely through the Internet via live or recorded instruction.

                                  

 

Our next step is to employ a team of local, experienced and qualified teachers in India as well as a team of experienced teachers here in the US to develop the traditional teaching approach of our model. This includes developing a full year of dynamic and interactive lesson plans for an elementary school (PreK - 8th Grade).

We will initially follow the ICSE (Indian Council of Standard Education) education standard for the curriculum.  This is one of the main education standards in India. 

This team will work with our teachers at our school in India to develop and test these lesson plans with our students. This campaign is to raise funds to pay salaries of this team for six months.  

We will incorporate these lesson plans into our school and will start evaluating the program at this point to see how it is functioning.  

The team will then develop the curriculum and instructional material for the innovative teaching. 

Our plan is to develop this model within the first 18 months and then replicate it at 5 other schools in Kolkata, India within 2 years of us starting this process.  Once we have seen success, we will take it to other cities in India and then the rest of the world. 

Our plan is also to develop a model that allows for a level of sustainability, where we can charge for it and offer it free of cost to schools that cannot afford it.
 
                                     

Imagine a world where every child has access to schools that have motivated and driven teachers who are excited to impart quality education; have the opportunity to grow and prosper, and where technology, and knowledge are open to them, to help them achieve their full potential. 

 

Without reading, writing, and arithmetic skills, this world is closed to them. Books...the Internet...Wikipedia...wider education...all of this needs to be unlocked with literacy.

We are creating a movement, a global community of organizations and individuals that will sustain and build up this education model.  If you are interested in joining our team or know anyone that would be interested in this, please let us know.  We want you to be part of this movement and to put your brick in the wall in allowing these children to achieve their full potential. 

We also have a great range of perks that allow you to objectively lay your brick in this wall.  As you can imagine a project this large is going to cost a lot.  We are going to shoestring this project to get us initially started and do this project in modules based on the funding that we receive.  

 

                                     

 

                                     

We’ve put together an exciting set of perks around our mission.  Our perk names come from animals found in India!

Every dollar you give will not only support quality education for the 280 underprivileged students at our school but will have an exponential return, once we start replicating at other schools in India and the rest of the world. 

These perks are set up to raise $60,000 for the initial phase of this model to be implemented.  This will also help us to develop  six  months of curriculum/lesson plans for an elementary school. 

 

$10: INDIAN FLYING FOX SPONSOR (40min) 

                               

 

At $10, you will enable a teacher to provide 1 forty min interactive and dynamic class to at least 30 students.  

 

  • Website Credit - your name will be added to http://www.zedbridge.org to demonstrate your support for the Zcloudschool model.
  • Digital Certificate - we will send you a digital certificate that you can use to show your support for the campaign.

$25: PANGOLIN SPONSOR (40mins)                                    

 

                           

At $25, you get an awesome tshirt and will enable a teacher to provide 1 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

 

 

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):
  • Digital thank you card drawn by one of the students 
  • Website Credit 
  • Digital Certificate

 

$20: LION TAILED MACAQUE SPONSOR (80mins)  

                                     

At $20, you will enable a teacher to provide 2 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

The classes will be developed at our school using the best teaching methods and then will be used for a live class at our school.

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):
  • Digital thank you card drawn by one of the students 
  • Website Credit 
  • Digital Certificate

$50: NILGIRI TAHR SPONSOR (200mins)

 

 

                                   

At $50, you will enable a teacher to provide 5 forty min interactive and dynamic classes for one subject to at least 30 students.

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Digital thank you card drawn by one of the students and mailed to you
  • Twitter shout out
  • Website Credit 
  • Digital Certificate 

 

 

$100: CHINKARA SPONSOR (400mins)

 

                             

At $100, you will enable a teacher to provide 10 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

$250: NEELGAI SPONSOR (1000mins)

 

                            

At $250, you will enable a teacher to provide 25 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

$500: LEOPARD SPONSOR (2000 mins)

 

                           

At $500, you will enable a teacher to provide 50 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Digital Certificate 
     

 

$1,000: ROYAL BENGAL TIGER SPONSOR (4000 mins)

                                  

At $1,000, you will enable a teacher to provide 100 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

$2,500: ASIATIC LION SPONSOR (10,000 mins)

 

                                    

 

At $2,500, you will enable a teacher to provide 250 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Thank you card drawn by one of the students and mailed to you

$5,000: GREAT INDIAN RHINOCEROS SPONSOR (20,000 mins)

 

                            

 

At $5,000, you will enable a teacher to provide 500 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Twitter shout out

  • Thank you card drawn by one of the students and mailed to you

$10,000: KING COBRA SPONSOR (40,000 mins)

                               

                                

At $10,000, you will enable a teacher to provide 1,000 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Plaque with your name on it on one of our classrooms. 
  • Twitter shout out
  • Facebook shout out
  • Thank you card drawn by one of the students and mailed to you 
  • Website Credit 
  • Digital Certificate

 

$25,000: INDIAN ELEPHANT SPONSOR (100,000 mins)

 

                                   

                            

 

At $25,000, you will enable a teacher to provide 2,500 forty min interactive and dynamic classes to at least 30 students.

Receive the previous perks of (see above for details):

  • Plaque with your name on it on one of our classrooms. 
  • A video of our students performing a recital in your honor.
  • Twitter shout out
  • Facebook shout out
  • Thank you card drawn by one of the students and mailed to you 
  • Website Credit 
  • Digital Certificate 
 

On a tight budget? There are other important ways you can support too!

  • Share our campaign video on Facebook.
  • Make a tweet about our campaign on Twitter.
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to stay updated on the movement.
  • Join our mailing list and be the first to see our stories of impact.

If you’ve done any of the above, here’s a virtual hug <3

Making the world a more equitable place through education isn’t an easy thing to do alone.  Together, we are changing lives for the better. You have our love and gratitude!

 

 

                                           

 

 

  1. Are you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
    Yes, Learning Equality is a registered 501(c)(3) charity (EIN 47-1895963), incorporated in California. You will receive tax receipts for your donations through the crowdfunding campaign.
     

  2. How can I get a tax deductible receipt?
    When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the the campaign ends.

  3. How will you spend the money we’re giving you?

    Our approximate cost breakdown is as follows. Note: the costs below do not account for all our staff costs and any administration costs.  This campaign is specifically set up to raise the funds to create 6 months of developing the Traditional teaching module of our model.  The costs below are to the best of our knowledge given our experience to-date.  Changing public education is not quite as simple as these charts make it seem.

     

  4.  

    Can I donate from outside the USA?

    Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. Unfortunately we can’t accept PayPal, so the way to donate internationally is with a credit card.

    What payment methods do you accept?

    Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

    Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over $10,000?

    The nonprofit payment processor (FirstGiving) that is handling the transactions for this campaign is able to accept direct wire transfers for contributions of $10,000 or more. If you are interested in making a large contribution through a wire transfer to FirstGiving, please contact us at crowdfunding@zedbridge.org. We’ll connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will assist you with the contribution transfer process.

    I have more questions. Who do I ask?

    Please visit http://www.zedbridge.org/contact to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

     

  5. This project is cool, I don’t have a lot of money but I’d like to help out!

    Thank you, we love your dedication! The best way to help us is to make this fundraiser succeed by following the suggestions given below. 

    • Share our campaign video on Facebook.
    • Make a tweet about our campaign on Twitter.
    • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to stay updated on the movement.
    • Join our mailing list and be the first to see our stories of impact.

Get a cool looking shirt and equip a teacher to teach a dynamic and interactive class of at least 30 underprivileged  children in Kolkata, India.
