Statistics show that over 250 million students globally can’t read, write, or count. There are also 1.2 million students that drop out of school in the US every year.  Additionally, 25% of teachers (1.7 million) in India don’t attend classes the entire year.  Zedbridge's mission is to leverage technology to equip unresourced schools and teachers with a high quality education program that allows students to discover and achieve their full potential.  Unlike other solutions, we provide a comprehensive global solution (An entire school in the box) that contains all the components (instructional, training, administrative tools, and a support structure) required to run an Elementary school (pre K - eighth grade).  Also, unlike other solutions that rely mainly on autonomous learning, we understand the importance of working with existing educational infrastructures and having a teacher as a mentor and guide in these children's lives.   The Zedbridge global educational solution empowers almost anyone to teach utilizing the best teaching practices and employs curricula that follows education standards and develops the entire child.  Additionally the program is easily deployable, customizable, scalable, and has a support structure that enables teachers to succeed.  We realize that we can NEVER replace a qualified and experienced teacher but our hope is that through this education model we can exponentially improve the teaching of these un-resourced teachers.  
 Zedbridge was born out of a need to provide affordable high quality education for the underprivileged students of HCS Elementary school in Kolkata, India.  
Over the last two and a half years we have been informally developing and testing select components of the Zedbridge program at HCS and we have seen a dramatic improvement in student grades and teacher motivation.  We are now at a stage where we are ready to develop a complete pre-packaged program that we can try at HCS and then replicate to other schools in India and around the World.

 


“We are striving to transform education for the underprivileged from the chains that bind the poor in the cycle of poverty to be the most powerful tool used to change the world,” Rajiv Patnaik.Our extensive experience working with HCS has provided us with considerable insight into the problems and needs of un-resourced schools that serve underprivileged children.  We also have a team of qualified administrators and educators  who excel at providing quality education. 
We believe that this educational solution can change the world -- or as Steve Jobs said “make a dent in the Universe”-- because of its simplicity, its support structure, its low cost, and its easy replication.  It is our goal to narrow the education gap between the privileged and the underprivileged.This campaign will raise funds for the a team of 12 qualified and experienced teachers to develop 6 months of curriculum and lesson plans for an entire Elementary school (Pre K - 8th Grade) in India. 
Join us and walk with us on this journey to "making a dent in the Universe"
You can help by contributing what you can and by joining our movement.
 
  
 
EXPLORE MORE
     |  solution  |  plan  |  what we need  |  impact  |  perks  | story  |  timeline  |  faq   |   

 
FEATURED IN


 
 

 
                                 
Hello, my name is Rajiv Patnaik, and I am the founder of Zedbridge. 


Zedbridge began in early 2013 after the passing of my father Zachariah Patnaik, who was the president of HCS Elementary.  Zedbridge - “The Zachariah Education Bridge” was founded in honor of my father Zachariah.  It's purpose was to bridge the education gap between the privileged and underprivileged.  
My father, Zachariah, having very humble beginnings, personally experienced how quality education could ignite a child's dreams and desires. He also witnessed how easily those same dreams and desires could be extinguished when a child is engulfed in poverty and does not have access to quality education.  
My father dedicated over 27 years of his life serving underprivileged children through HCS in Kolkata, India.  He passed away in February 2013 when I took over the school.  It is an honor to follow in my father's footsteps and a privilege to be part of such a potentially powerful institution.  
I am where I am in life because of the quality education that my father received through his early years.  If if hadn't been for the people who invested in him at a young age, he would not have had access to quality education and I could have been born into poverty and been part of the 250 million illiterate students!  So it is with much gratitude and a privilege to play a part in the story of each children's lives that I lead this organization.
With the privilege comes a huge responsibility. The parents of our students sacrifice more than you and I can ever imagine to enable their children to attend school, because they believe education is the ticket out of poverty.  This lays on me the responsibility to provide space where all these children are allowed the basic right to dream and then are given the tools to pursue their dreams. 
 

This has been a challenge for us to create given our lack of resources and qualified teachers.   Zcloudschool, our education model was born out of these limitations and the fact that there are many more schools like us that can't afford the traditional resources to provide quality education.  We had to THINK OUTSIDE THE BOX to develop a model that provides quality education at an affordable cost. 


There is yet another level of schools, where teachers are equipped to fail. They have lost the motivation to teach effectively due to a lack of training and support .  These are the schools that employ the 1.7 million teachers in India that don't attend any classes the entire year! These are the schools around the world that produce the 250 million illiterate students!  There is absolutely no reason for these statistics when educational resources are free and plenty.  This injustice is what drives me to spend the rest of my life to create change. 


We have a unique and amazing opportunity with HCS Elementary.  It's our sandbox, our testing ground!  We have complete freedom to develop our model at a live school and test it without limitations.  If successful, it can be replicated in other schools in India and then around the world. 


Thank you for taking the time to read our story.  Please join us in this walk.  We cannot do this on our own.

 
Rajiv PatnaikFounder/CEOZedbridge
You can help by contributing what you can and by joining our movement.
 

 
 
                                   
 
Our mission is to develop a model that makes quality education a universal opportunity made possible through our passionate and global team of partners, volunteers, and supporters.Zedbridge is predominantly a volunteer-driven and grassroots effort. Many talented and diverse individuals from all over the world have contributed their abilities and passions to finding solutions to help make quality education more equally accessible.      
 
                                                      
 



 
 
 

 
Our solution is to equip these under resource and unmotivated teachers with resources that a qualified teacher would have.  We believe that we can inspire these teachers if we can equip them properly and show them how to reach and positively influence their students.
The Zcloudschool solution provides an entire pre-packaged school (PreK - 8th grade) in the cloud with all the main elements that make up a great school:The Zcloudschool alternative educational solution combines traditional teaching and a low-cost technology center to provide an innovative learning environment. The traditional teaching approach follows education standards and uses printed detailed lesson plans following best teaching methods. Classes are taught locally but are monitored and administered remotely. The low-cost technology center follows the Self Organized Learning Environment (SOLE). Classes are taught and monitored remotely through the Internet via live or recorded instruction.

                                  
 
Our next step is to employ a team of local, experienced and qualified teachers in India as well as a team of experienced teachers here in the US to develop the traditional teaching approach of our model. This includes developing a full year of dynamic and interactive lesson plans for an elementary school (PreK - 8th Grade).We will initially follow the ICSE (Indian Council of Standard Education) education standard for the curriculum.  This is one of the main education standards in India. This team will work with our teachers at our school in India to develop and test these lesson plans with our students. This campaign is to raise funds to pay salaries of this team for six months.  We will incorporate these lesson plans into our school and will start evaluating the program at this point to see how it is functioning.  The team will then develop the curriculum and instructional material for the innovative teaching. Our plan is to develop this model within the first 18 months and then replicate it at 5 other schools in Kolkata, India within 2 years of us starting this process.  Once we have seen success, we will take it to other cities in India and then the rest of the world. Our plan is also to develop a model that allows for a level of sustainability, where we can charge for it and offer it free of cost to schools that cannot afford it. 

                                     



Imagine a world where every child has access to schools that have motivated and driven teachers who are excited to impart quality education; have the opportunity to grow and prosper, and where technology, and knowledge are open to them, to help them achieve their full potential.  
Without reading, writing, and arithmetic skills, this world is closed to them. Books...the Internet...Wikipedia...wider education...all of this needs to be unlocked with literacy.

We are creating a movement, a global community of organizations and individuals that will sustain and build up this education model.  If you are interested in joining our team or know anyone that would be interested in this, please let us know.  We want you to be part of this movement and to put your brick in the wall in allowing these children to achieve their full potential. 
We also have a great range of perks that allow you to objectively lay your brick in this wall.  As you can imagine a project this large is going to cost a lot.  We are going to shoestring this project to get us initially started and do this project in modules based on the funding that we receive.  
 
                                     
                                      
We’ve put together an exciting set of perks around our mission.  Our perk names come from animals found in India!
Every dollar you give will not only support quality education for the 280 underprivileged students at our school but will have an exponential return, once we start replicating at other schools in India and the rest of the world. 
These perks are set up to raise $60,000 for the initial phase of this model to be implemented.  This will also help us to develop  six  months of curriculum/lesson plans for an elementary school.

At $10, you will enable a teacher to provide 1 forty min interactive and dynamic class to at least 30 students.  
 


Website Credit - your name will be added to http://www.zedbridge.org to demonstrate your support for the Zcloudschool model.

On a tight budget? There are other important ways you can support too!


Share our campaign video on Facebook.
Make a tweet about our campaign on Twitter.

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to stay updated on the movement.

Join our mailing list and be the first to see our stories of impact.

If you’ve done any of the above, here’s a virtual hug <3
Making the world a more equitable place through education isn’t an easy thing to do alone.  Together, we are changing lives for the better. You have our love and gratitude!
 
 
                                           
 
 


Are you a non-profit?  Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?Yes, Learning Equality is a registered 501(c)(3) charity (EIN 47-1895963), incorporated in California. You will receive tax receipts for your donations through the crowdfunding campaign. 
How can I get a tax deductible receipt?When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes. For all contributions over $250, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the the campaign ends.

How will you spend the money we’re giving you?
Our approximate cost breakdown is as follows. Note: the costs below do not account for all our staff costs and any administration costs.  This campaign is specifically set up to raise the funds to create 6 months of developing the Traditional teaching module of our model.  The costs below are to the best of our knowledge given our experience to-date.  Changing public education is not quite as simple as these charts make it seem.

 


 
Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. Unfortunately we can’t accept PayPal, so the way to donate internationally is with a credit card.
What payment methods do you accept?
Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.
Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over $10,000?
The nonprofit payment processor (FirstGiving) that is handling the transactions for this campaign is able to accept direct wire transfers for contributions of $10,000 or more. If you are interested in making a large contribution through a wire transfer to FirstGiving, please contact us at crowdfunding@zedbridge.org. We’ll connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will assist you with the contribution transfer process.
I have more questions. Who do I ask?
Please visit http://www.zedbridge.org/contact to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.
 


This project is cool, I don’t have a lot of money but I’d like to help out!
Thank you, we love your dedication! The best way to help us is to make this fundraiser succeed by following the suggestions given below.

story:
"A Healthy and Adaptive Mind". WINtelligence Books.

World Intelligence Network On-line Editions (WIN ONE) Chief Editor, Graham Powell, is compiling the first in a series of books focused on self-improvement and motivation, that will be circulated around the globe. 

It is a unique opportunity for members of the 52 intelligence societies which currently constitute the World Intelligence Network to display their thoughts, concepts, life guidance suggestions and practical tips to an international audience.

How will that be? Read on!

WIN founder, Dr. Evangelos Katsioulis, MD, PhD, is keen on the project and has written the preface to the first edition.

The main theme covered in the first book is: "A Healthy and Adaptive Mind".

Many writers have already contributed to the theme. The first book is evolving towards a first draft.

The initial cost of the project is estimated to be around 2,000 pounds sterling. This will be enough for the worldwide distribution of an illustrated book with 100,000 words. Such a book is usually around 200 pages long and costs £12.99 in the shops.

Beyond the primary goal of the initial cost crowdfunding, this announcement is also a plea for contributions towards future books. The idea is that each content contributor will receive his own copy of the book for every thousand copies sold and a quota of any available profits when 10,000 books have been sold.

If you wish to support this venture, you may either choose the book preorder perk or directly donate using the WIN Paypal email account:

  donate@iqsociety.org

Thank you for your attention and interest. Spreading the word about this project among your social circles could be another reason for us to thank you.

story:
Pastoralist Child Foundation conducts educational workshops at Lorubae Primary School in Archer's Post, Samburu County, Kenya. The school has been very gracious in hosting our workshops. It's equipped with classrooms, office, a library, kitchen, bathrooms, a dormitory with toilets and showers, and a bore hole. A bore hole, also known as a "water well" was installed in November 2012.  It is 90 feet deep and provides clean drinking and cooking water for the students and staff at the school.  Unfortunately, the solar powered pump that brings up clean water is not operating. Once the solar pump is repaired, clean water will be restored for approximately 1,500 people!  Prior to the installation of the bore hole students and local villagers were getting water from the Ewaso Nyiro River. The river is very unclean and inhabited by crocodiles that catch, kill and mame people. The river is also a source of water for elephants, lions, baboons, hippos, and other wild animals who live in and around Samburu National Reserve. It's simply unacceptable that people must risk their lives while getting water.  We're in contact with the initial installers of the bore hole and solar powered panel and our goal is to have the repairs completed by November, 2015.

The beauty of the bore hole is that not only do the 350 students and 10 teachers and administration at Lorubae Primary School get clean drinking and cooking water, but approximately 1,200 nearby villagers do too!!

What We Need: 

1.  one c200 pump control unit 

2.  one float switch unit           

3.  one cable tie

4.  labor charge

$2,000 will cover the entire cost of repairing the solar powered pump.


                                            The underside of the solar panel

Once the pump is repaired there will no longer be a need to purchase water for the school or our educational workshops. The bore hole provides plenty of water for everyone. The solar panel is welded into the tower and protected by a fence to prevent theft.  Pastoralist Child Foundation has recently been invited to become a United Nations endorsed Green Hub. This means that we will eventually teach agricultural farming to the students and local villagers in Archer's Post. But first...let's all chip in and get the water back! Imagine the happy faces of children once the water starts flowing up the well again!

     Students are taught health & sanitation.  Clean hands are a good thing!

              

                              Local villagers filling up their water buckets

             

                   Villagers transporting clean drinking and cooking water.
                                         Is it time for Chai?  YUM!!

            

               You can make this girl and many other people healthier and
                 happier by contributing to this campaign. Water is life!

All the above pictures are courtesy of www.zoewaters.org. Pastoralist Child Foundation received permission to post pictures from the installation of the bore hole at Lorubae Primary School in Archer's Post, Samburu County, Kenya.

                                                               
                  This is the Ewaso Nyiro River where students and villagers gather water. Notice how low the water is. This is because it hasn't rained since April. Let's repair the solar pump so that 1,500 people drink clean well water. 

Please don't stop contributing even if we reach our goal of $2,000. The additional funds raised will be used for future repairs or equipment to prolong the life of the bore hole, solar panel, water tower, faucets, water receptacles, and fencing.  

Please contribute (dig as deep as a bore hole into your wallet!) and share our campaign with your friends and family. Click on the Indiegogo "share" links to spread the word and encourage people to make a huge difference in the lives of our friends in Samburu.

story:
Who Are We?

The Interdisciplinary Studio for Learning and Design (ISLAND) is a community created to promote innovation across diverse disciplines through workshops and design projects for the Binghamton University Community. We are a group of seventeen engineering students, who began meeting last fall, that share a common desire to revamp and revitalize the way we learn at school.

What Do We Do?

We create and advise design teams to encourage students to learn practical and project management skills by designing and building a device, either for a competition or for a local client, for the community or university. Projects are one of the best ways to learn, and by providing projects for students, we hope to supplement and enhance traditional classroom learning.

We also host workshops for students, teaching requested skills for classes, design projects, or just for fun. Experienced students meet in the weeks before a workshop, come up with demos and activities, and split up during sessions to help working students. We believe that this hands on learning, outside of the classroom, makes better students and, ultimately, professionals.

What Do We Need?

We’ve already hosted one workshop on Arduino microcontrollers focusing on their ability to interface with biosensors and another workshop on the R programming language using resources we have on hand. Additionally, we have a design team competing in the EMedic Global design competition, plus a team working with a client from the local Binghamton area to design a unique communication device for a child with autism.

Nonetheless, in order to put on different types of workshops and help design teams prototype their ideas, we need to purchase electronics, materials, and tools. As a group comprised of students, we suffer a lack of funds that stunts our ability to teach students and limits the selection of skills we can pass on to other students. If we cannot provide materials for an idea, the idea cannot be explored.

What Do We Do With the Funding?

Your support would go toward the purchasing of materials for our workshops and  design teams. These include microcontrollers, sensors, wires, tools, and other components to use as teaching aides. The increased capacity to purchase supplies would expand both the size of workshops we could host and the variety of skills that can be taught during any one session.This funding would also include the purchase of materials such as wood, plastic, metal alloys and more for our design teams to build prototypes of their devices. 

The Impact

Education happens both inside and outside the classroom. We believe that we can provide the support and guidance necessary for students to enhance their education and improve their professionalism.
Anything and everything helps. Thank you for taking the time to learn more about who we are and what we do. We are always willing to share our progress with you. If you'd like more information, please email Benjamin (bheo1@binghamton.edu), or visit our website, theisland.squarespace.com

Sincerely, 

Students of The ISLAND

We are a group of seventeen engineering students, who began meeting last fall, that share a common desire to revamp and revitalize the way we learn at school.
What Do We Do?

We create and advise design teams to encourage students to learn practical and project management skills by designing and building a device, either for a competition or for a local client, for the community or university. Projects are one of the best ways to learn, and by providing projects for students, we hope to supplement and enhance traditional classroom learning.
We also host workshops for students, teaching requested skills for classes, design projects, or just for fun. Experienced students meet in the weeks before a workshop, come up with demos and activities, and split up during sessions to help working students. We believe that this hands on learning, outside of the classroom, makes better students and, ultimately, professionals.   What Do We Need?

We’ve already hosted one workshop on Arduino microcontrollers focusing on their ability to interface with biosensors and another workshop on the R programming language using resources we have on hand. Additionally, we have a design team competing in the EMedic Global design competition, plus a team working with a client from the local Binghamton area to design a unique communication device for a child with autism.
Nonetheless, in order to put on different types of workshops and help design teams prototype their ideas, we need to purchase electronics, materials, and tools. As a group comprised of students, we suffer a lack of funds that stunts our ability to teach students and limits the selection of skills we can pass on to other students. If we cannot provide materials for an idea, the idea cannot be explored.

What Do We Do With the Funding?
Your support would go toward the purchasing of materials for our workshops and  design teams. These include microcontrollers, sensors, wires, tools, and other components to use as teaching aides. The increased capacity to purchase supplies would expand both the size of workshops we could host and the variety of skills that can be taught during any one session.This funding would also include the purchase of materials such as wood, plastic, metal alloys and more for our design teams to build prototypes of their devices. 
The Impact

Education happens both inside and outside the classroom. We believe that we can provide the support and guidance necessary for students to enhance their education and improve their professionalism.

Anything and everything helps. Thank you for taking the time to learn more about who we are and what we do. We are always willing to share our progress with you. If you'd like more information, please email Benjamin (bheo1@binghamton.edu), or visit our website, theisland.squarespace.com


Sincerely, 
Students of The ISLAND

story:
Hi, I'm Mistress Tara Indiana, and I'm running for President of the United States

You may ask yourself, what qualifications does a Dominatrix have to be President of the United States? Well, I've been in the profession for over 25 years. I'm a small business owner and job creator. I founded my company, The Den of Iniquity in 1994. It's the only dungeon that's ever gone national with flagships in NYC, LA and Phoenix and employing over 80 Women at it's height. 

Over the years, I've dominated over 10,000 men and trained over 1000 Mistresses. Managing an all female company really honed my leadership and management skills.

Being a Dominatrix requires strong negotiation abilities and a profound understanding of human nature. But most importantly, I've been beating men like Donald Trump for 25 years and with your help, I'll beat him in November.

How Dildos Can Save Democracy

My Campaign is focused on attacking Donald Trump in both old and new media through a massive Dominatrix Small Penis Humiliation campaign in realtime and online. To accomplish this, we need to raise money too:

  • acquire 1000s of tiny dildos with the hashtag #mistresstaraforpresident printed on them that can be thrown at him at Trump Rallies and appearances or shipped to him at his home at Trump Towers.
  • Campaign button, posters, bumper stickers and T-Shirts
  • The funds to file all the paperwork and get my name on the ballot in at least 1 state.
  • Travel expenses to tour the country and speak, stump, and hold rallies
  • To hire staff; A publicist to handle the press and campaign manger to organize supporters and events
Our goal is 50,000, but if we don't reach it, we'll focus more on the "Dildo's for Democracy" Campaign and cut back on travel.

The Impact of "Dildos For Democracy"

While I may not be elected President of the United States, if even 1 tiny dildo is hurled at Donald Trump at a rally - wouldn't that alone be worth it!

But more importantly, my campaign humanizes people in the bdsm community and forces people to think of  them in a new way by showing how Dominatrices can be active and contributing members of our political process.

While there are no statistics, I can tell you from my personal experience that many people in the BDSM community lose their jobs, custody of their children and their homes when they are outed.

I believe that kink is an orientation like being gay or straight and we need the same protections as the LBGTQ community. Even if you don't agree with my theory, I'm sure you agree that no one should ever lose their children because of what they do consensually, behind closed doors. We need to get government out of our bedrooms, and with your help and a 1000 tiny didlos, we can make this happen!

The press is already covering our campaign and it has really taken off in Italy and Germany along with a great write up in GQ. We need your help to keep up the momentum. The press needs events to cover and we need to raise funds to sponsor events that will titillate the press. So far, we have 3 scheduled:

7.16 Mistress Tara Speaks at "Looks of Love" Salon and Barbershop

7.22 Mistress Tara Speaks at "Opodz" a collaborative work space

8.26 Mistress Tara's Birthday Party and Presidential Fundraiser

9.3 Debate w/Performance Artist & Presidential Candidate Jeffrey Vallance at "Philosophy in the Bedroom"

See our updates section for a look at all the great press we've been getting!

Other Ways You Can Help Elect a Dominatrix and Stop Donald Trump

If you can't make a donation, there are MANY ways you can get involved and help:

  • Make fun of Donald Trumps tiny, tiny penis on twitter or  social media with any of these hashtags: #mistresstaraforpresident, #donalddicklette, #needledickeddonald, #donaldstump, #stumptowers
  • Make my campaign poster your Facebook, twitter or instagram cover
  • Spreed the word! Like and share my campaign or website: www.mistresstaraforpresident.com

  • Send Donald Trump a tiny, tiny dildo or penis pump from his amazon wishlist. It's set up to deliver directly to him at Trump Towers! And make sure you let him know in the gift card that Mistress Tara sent you! Or remind him that no matter how tiny this dildo is, it's still bigger then his micro-penis! CLICK HERE TO SEND DONALD TRUMP A TINY DILDO!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • We are 2 families who met a few years ago that had very demanding toddlers who loved to watched videos and cartoons but always had to watch them in case creepy videos came up or inappropriate ads showed up.
  • It's important for us to make sure our toddlers and young ones are not taught bad things or shown inappropriate actions from watching these safe videos
  •  With your help, we hope to make watching videos fun and safe for kids and one day really hope to partner up with churches and make our own videos and cartoons to teach kids life lessons.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to start with about $10,000 to fix up the site and work with churches and other conservative organization to come up with videos that are good for kids
  • We hope that with this funding, your toddlers and kids can learn lessons over time and not watch those creepy videos
  • If the goal is not reached, we would like to sponsor a few orphans who are in need

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share at your churches and help us raise these funds.  
  • If you are interested to help come up with story lines or help us in making cartoons, please contact us!

story:
Summary

If every baby born early were fed with human milk, scores of lives would be saved in England and Wales alone. Yet most people have never heard of the milk banking service.

Milk banks work like the blood transfusion service - donors are carefully screened and milk is checked and heat-treated to ensure it is safe. The milk is then sent to hospitals to feed fragile premature babies in their first few days of life when enough of their own mother's milk is not available. This is a common situation, as their mothers are often ill themselves or too traumatised by watching their babies fight for life to express milk immediately.

We need your help. There is a widening gap in the NHS for the provision of donor breast milk, especially in London and the southeast. The Hearts Milk Bank can close that gap, and meet the need from doctors outside of the neonatal unit to access donor milk for their patients.

We currently have a waiting list of women who would love to donate their milk, and we have hospitals across London waiting to receive it. We now need your support to help save tiny babies’ lives. 

 

Who are we?

I'm an Oxford-trained doctor and breast cancer researcher at Imperial College - through my work I started to collaborate with Gillian Weaver, an internationally recognised milk banking expert with almost 30 years of experience. 

Working so closely with Gillian, I became aware of how important milk banks are. I also saw the increasing pressures on the existing milk banks, which have meant that many hospitals are currently unable to access donor milk, or milk is being rationed to only the very sickest babies. Milk bank staff across the region are working so hard, but still cannot meet the demand.

Gillian and I are therefore now working around the clock to establish the Hearts Milk Bank - a social enterprise non-profit organisation that aims to fill the gaps in provision.

We are now at the stage where we have premises at the University of Hertfordshire, volunteer couriers (the fantastic SERV Blood Bikers) who will pick up and deliver milk on their motorbikes, and a network of lactation consultants ready to start our Expresso Clubs - community groups where women can come together to learn about donating their milk and be recruited and supported as donors. And have some fantastic decaf coffee too!

Now, we just need your help.

 

What We Need

We need £50,000 to purchase the specialist equipment to make sure the milk is processed safely.

If we can raise the money through crowdfunding, we will be able to access other funds to train a specialised lactation consultant specifically to work with mothers who have lost their babies. There is currently minimal lactation support available for mothers in this situation, we aim to help mothers with their milk. 

 

The Impact

Around 70,000 babies in the UK are born prematurely each year. According to the latest data, donor milk reduces the risk of babies developing necrotising enterocolitis, a gut condition that can be fatal in up to 40% of affected children, by 75%.

Silke Durm, the mother of two very premature children who received donor milk, says: “The Hearts Milk Bank will play a vital role in securing safe donor milk for all premature babies that need it. It will ensure that these vulnerable babies receive the best possible care, giving parents the peace of mind to know that they have done everything medically and physically possible to ensure that their baby has the best chance of survival.”

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate money, then there are plenty of other ways that you can help:

  • Ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the Hearts Milk Bank all over social media.
  • Listen to the podcasts when they are released on crowdcaster.com (Hearts_Milk_Bank) and share as widely as you can! We will post an update when the first goes live.
  • Consider becoming a milk donor if you are currently breastfeeding.
  • If you live nearby, contact us to discuss becoming a volunteer to the milk bank.

story:
THANKS for a great campaign!

Stay Connected. View our website for additional updates about Children's Books as a Radical Act or to continue supporting our work and books and join our mailing list to stay informed.

_____________________________________________________________

UPDATE:

In the wake of the 2016 US Election, I have added an "Emergency Response" children's book title, When a Bully is President: Truth and Creativity for Oppressive Times, with the goal to have out to our communities in time for the inauguration on January 20th. Read more in this blog post or select this option from the available perks. You can pre-order this book or get this book PLUS my other six titles.

_____________________________________________________________

The Story

I’ve been in the industry for over 20 years illustrating and writing multicultural children’s books and talking about the importance of relevant reflection. As a parent it is STILL challenging to find enough relevant reflection for my kids of color. As a 2nd generation queer family, it is nearly impossible. And I know we are not alone.

This is why I want to jumpstart a mass publishing at my independent press with at least 6 new titles for 2017. I want to invest in serious change right now for myself, my family and my communities.

Reflection Press and School of the Free Mind (the indie press and online school I cofounded) focus on ALL 3Rs of children’s books as a radical act—Reflection, Reclamation and Regeneration— and center People of Color, Indigenous and Queer voices and experiences.

Independently publishing my own picture books is an empowering experience, but my books do not exist in isolation. My voice is stronger in the company of other POC, Indigenous and Queer voices coming into power alongside mine. 

By supporting these 6 new titles that push the bounds of children's books you are also supporting the continuing development of our online courses, materials, and programs for aspiring children's book creators, kids and families.

Voice is a revolution!

More about my first 6 independently published children's books:
(These books will be printed in the US in paperback on sustainably forested paper)

Plus, all 6 books will be bilingual English and Spanish.

I believe getting these books up and out will have an immediate and positive impact, and your contribution will also support voice and creative power rising in our communities. I believe that creating children’s books can be one of the most radical things we do for ourselves, for our kids and for society. Voice is a revolution.

Join us in making children’s books a radical act!

 

 

Read more:

That's the main info for the campaign but if you want to learn even more about what we’re doing with the 3R's, School of the Free Mind, Write Now! Make Books free kid series, Mentorship and more read on.....

Contributing to our books also supports our online school and free programs.

The 3 R’s—Reflection, Reclamation and Regeneration—help us envision a full and effective path of action that ultimately supports true power rising from our communities in the form of our OWN VOICE.

The first : REFLECTION

We need to see ourselves. Support books that reflect.

The lack of reflection for POC, Indigenous and Queer communities is so severe, that we don’t feel like we can wait any longer. We have over 20 books in our queue and chose the first six that feel the most developed and pressing to get out this next year. Most are written and/or illustrated by me.

To learn about our first six titles and more, stay tuned to my Blog during the campaign.
And learn more about our indie press on the Reflection Press website.

The second : RECLAMATION

Own what is and always was OURS. Voice. Support VOICE rising in our communities.

For many of us and our communities, silence has kept us alive but that doesn’t mean we didn’t always have voice. To create the kind of reflection our kids need, we need more voices coming into power and in greater numbers. Our School of the Free Mind shares all we know about making and publishing children’s books with our communities with a full online classroom that centers OUR communities in the book making process and supports the whole person.

Our classroom offers a playground of support and includes everything from me sharing my 20+ years experience in the industry to training future indie publishers and an extensive library of community spotlights and children’s book reviews of POC, Indigenous and Queer artists, authors and publishers who are unapologetically doing it now!

What I’ve learned from teaching and mentoring these last 3 years through our school is that coming into voice is a powerful act, so powerful in fact that we often need to heal seemingly unrelated aspects of our lives. So we offer both practical Skill training alongside courses on Radical Self Love and Beliefs & Intention.

Instead of single courses, our newly revamped classroom will have a nominal yearly fee for access to all our courses with additional limited work-trade scholarships available. We’ve found that having a fee supports folks committing to their selves and their work.

I have seen firsthand what kind of impact these courses can have on people’s lives. Many people in the beginning believe they don’t have a story or are not an artist, only to find that they have a wealth of creative power they had never accessed and in fact may have been suppressing. And freeing that creative power is not an isolated event but affects nearly every aspect of their lives.

Generations of silence and invisibility can be transformed through power sharing and supporting each other. The reclamation of voice is at the heart of all people coming into equity.

To learn more about all our courses visit the School of the Free Mind website.

The third : REGENERATION

Create sustainable and lasting change so deep that silence and invisibility are never again an option. Change the narrative. Support the continuing development of our FREE PROGRAMS.

FREE is FREE. It’s important to share information in as many ways as possible and to make sure that as many different folks as possible have access to it. And that means FREE. Our free programs have evolved from my other work and are another way that I hope to support and seed our communities.

I believe that if we want to create lasting equity in children’s books and society we must attend to the present moment, to the future and to creating a flexible, sustainable model that can support true voice rising independently.

My inaugural Mentorship with Intent to Publish group will start in 2017. Small group work via webinars with me will focus on specific projects to publish as well as pass on deeper skills and removing blocks to success. Authors/Artists are chosen through our online school/anthology participation and the 2017 group will serve as a a model for subsequent years.

The 1st installment for our Write Now! Make Books free online program joins me in my SF studio where kids and families learn the basics of how to create books using the same steps as professional authors and artists. It contains over 2 hours of step-by-step video, downloadable guide, bookmaking map and sample book project to make a homemade book.

    To view our 1st installment for our kids program visit Write Now! Make books.

    More about us:

    Who are we? We are Maya and Matthew the founders of Reflection Press and School of the Free Mind. I am an award-winning queer Chicanx children’s book artist, author and progressive educator whose life work using creativity as a tool for transformation is the foundation of our online School and Indie Press. Matthew is a 2nd gen, queer white guy who provides all the behind the scenes design and technical support. Together we love to create things with the vision of a new and equitable world.

    Over the last 3 years we’ve developed our online school with 6 very full courses and tons of extras, taught over 200 students, and walked 56 aspiring artist/authors step-by-step through the process to publish one full spread of art and text in our 3 Heart of It anthologies. We’ve learned a lot.

    We began as an educational press for my curricula and evolved into a small independent press with an online school about to burst at the seams with more books and resources. Our vision has always been very big although we've done all of this practically on air.

    I have been in the traditional children's book industry for over 20 years and got my start with the seminal multicultural press, Children's Book Press.

    Matthew and I see independent publishing as a fantastic opportunity to take accessible, grass roots publishing into our own hands and make super-crafted books in our own voices right now.

    We’re literally aching to drop into this work and devote even more of our time to it. We feel there is great possibility for true power/true voice rising and reshaping our world. We know we are stronger together.

    Everyone has a story.
    We are not whole until all of them are free to be told.
    Let’s find a new way!

    Join us in supporting the 3R’s!

    OTHER WAYS YOU CAN JOIN US IN MAKING CHILDREN’S BOOKS A RADICAL ACT:

    Can't support monetarily, not a problem! Support comes in many forms.

    • Share our campaign using Indiegogo's links at the top
    • Like our Reflection Press and School of the Free Mind Facebook pages and share our campaign images
    • Tweet about us
    • Share about us on your website or blog

    every little bit helps reach more and more people from our communities!

    • Visit Write Now! Make Books or download our Self-Publishing mini-packet and begin (or continue) coming into your OWN voice and making children's books YOUR Radical Act!
story_txt:
THANKS for a great campaign!
Stay Connected. View our website for additional updates about Children's Books as a Radical Act or to continue supporting our work and books and join our mailing list to stay informed.
_____________________________________________________________

We need to see ourselves. Support books that reflect.
The lack of reflection for POC, Indigenous and Queer communities is so severe, that we don’t feel like we can wait any longer. We have over 20 books in our queue and chose the first six that feel the most developed and pressing to get out this next year. Most are written and/or illustrated by me.
To learn about our first six titles and more, stay tuned to my Blog during the campaign.And learn more about our indie press on the Reflection Press website.

The second  : RECLAMATION
Own what is and always was OURS. Voice. Support VOICE rising in our communities.
For many of us and our communities, silence has kept us alive but that doesn’t mean we didn’t always have voice. To create the kind of reflection our kids need, we need more voices coming into power and in greater numbers. Our School of the Free Mind shares all we know about making and publishing children’s books with our communities with a full online classroom that centers OUR communities in the book making process and supports the whole person.
Our classroom offers a playground of support and includes everything from me sharing my 20+ years experience in the industry to training future indie publishers and an extensive library of community spotlights and children’s book reviews of POC, Indigenous and Queer artists, authors and publishers who are unapologetically doing it now!
What I’ve learned from teaching and mentoring these last 3 years through our school is that coming into voice is a powerful act, so powerful in fact that we often need to heal seemingly unrelated aspects of our lives. So we offer both practical Skill training alongside courses on Radical Self Love and Beliefs & Intention.

Instead of single courses, our newly revamped classroom will have a nominal yearly fee for access to all our courses with additional limited work-trade scholarships available. We’ve found that having a fee supports folks committing to their selves and their work.
I have seen firsthand what kind of impact these courses can have on people’s lives. Many people in the beginning believe they don’t have a story or are not an artist, only to find that they have a wealth of creative power they had never accessed and in fact may have been suppressing. And freeing that creative power is not an isolated event but affects nearly every aspect of their lives.
Generations of silence and invisibility can be transformed through power sharing and supporting each other. The reclamation of voice is at the heart of all people coming into equity.
To learn more about all our courses visit the School of the Free Mind website.

The third : REGENERATION
Create sustainable and lasting change so deep that silence and invisibility are never again an option. Change the narrative. Support the continuing development of our FREE PROGRAMS.
FREE is FREE. It’s important to share information in as many ways as possible and to make sure that as many different folks as possible have access to it. And that means FREE. Our free programs have evolved from my other work and are another way that I hope to support and seed our communities.
I believe that if we want to create lasting equity in children’s books and society we must attend to the present moment, to the future and to creating a flexible, sustainable model that can support true voice rising independently.
My inaugural Mentorship with Intent to Publish group will start in 2017. Small group work via webinars with me will focus on specific projects to publish as well as pass on deeper skills and removing blocks to success. Authors/Artists are chosen through our online school/anthology participation and the 2017 group will serve as a a model for subsequent years.
The 1st installment for our Write Now! Make Books free online program joins me in my SF studio where kids and families learn the basics of how to create books using the same steps as professional authors and artists. It contains over 2 hours of step-by-step video, downloadable guide, bookmaking map and sample book project to make a homemade book.

To view our 1st installment for our kids program visit Write Now! Make books.

More about us:
Who are we? We are Maya and Matthew the founders of Reflection Press and School of the Free Mind. I am an award-winning queer Chicanx children’s book artist, author and progressive educator whose life work using creativity as a tool for transformation is the foundation of our online School and Indie Press. Matthew is a 2nd gen, queer white guy who provides all the behind the scenes design and technical support. Together we love to create things with the vision of a new and equitable world.
Over the last 3 years we’ve developed our online school with 6 very full courses and tons of extras, taught over 200 students, and walked 56 aspiring artist/authors step-by-step through the process to publish one full spread of art and text in our 3 Heart of It anthologies. We’ve learned a lot.
We began as an educational press for my curricula and evolved into a small independent press with an online school about to burst at the seams with more books and resources. Our vision has always been very big although we've done all of this practically on air.
I have been in the traditional children's book industry for over 20 years and got my start with the seminal multicultural press, Children's Book Press. 
Matthew and I see independent publishing as a fantastic opportunity to take accessible, grass roots publishing into our own hands and make super-crafted books in our own voices right now.
We’re literally aching to drop into this work and devote even more of our time to it. We feel there is great possibility for true power/true voice rising and reshaping our world. We know we are stronger together.
Everyone has a story.We are not whole until all of them are free to be told.Let’s find a new way! 
Join us in supporting the 3R’s!
